events.id: Yoga Nidra: A Garden of Calm-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga Nidra: A Garden of Calm
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
An evening of deep rest and gentle renewal — followed by a nourishing plant-based dinner.

This guided Yoga Nidra session invites you to slow down and settle the body, mind, and breath. Through grounding awareness practices and serene visualizations, you’ll be guided into a state of profound rest, where the nervous system can unwind and reset.

The practice will follow a garden theme, inviting you to visualize planting seeds of peace, health, and intention. As you rest, these seeds can be gently nurtured — offering space for inner growth and the possibility of flourishing in your own time.

The space will reflect this theme with soft greenery, natural scents, and a soundscape inspired by the outdoors — all designed to evoke stillness and ease. Comforts are provided — mats and blankets — though you’re welcome to bring anything personal that helps you feel completely relaxed.

Whether you’re feeling depleted, overstimulated, or simply in need of a pause, this is an opportunity to tend to your inner garden and replenish from within.

After the session, enjoy a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, included in your ticket — a grounding way to connect, nourish, and carry the calm into your evening.

Meet Karuna, your host
Trained as a primary school teacher, she also has a background in psychology and Spanish. But her heart is in connecting with others, and she always brings a lively and warm energy to the space.

events.id: The "Other" Curriculum Roadshow - WELLINGTON-581 Evans Bay Parade, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The "Other" Curriculum Roadshow - WELLINGTON
events.venue: 581 Evans Bay Parade, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Multiple Choice: Wellington Screening and Education Discussion
Join the Aotearoa Educators Collective (AEC) for a pivotal evening of discussion focused on the future of education with colleagues in Wellington. We are proud to host a screening of the compelling documentary, Multiple Choice - see the trailer here.
This film explores the profound and often challenging impacts of high-stakes, standardised testing on students, teachers, and the entire education system. Following the screening, we will open up a vital conversation about how we assess, Curriculum reform, and celebrating what is great about what we are doing now in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Your Voice Matters
This event is a crucial opportunity for educators, policymakers, parents, and community members to engage directly with key issues shaping our local schools and kura. We aim to:
Spark informed discussion about the role of assessment and qualifications.
Reflect on the implications for the ongoing redevelopment of the New Zealand Curriculum, national testing, and NCEA.
Encourage collaboration across our sector to reimagine equitable, future-focused pathways for all learners.
The Event Plan
Come together for a social networking event and evening of insight, hosted at St Patrick’s College.
The event will include:
A screening of the documentary Multiple Choice (approx. 1 hour).
A dynamic DRAFT Panel Discussion featuring a mix of local and national leaders:
Panel Convenor - Mark Potter | Principal of Berhampore School
Ragne Maxwell | Principal of Porirua College
Lynda Knight | Principal of Glenview Primary School
An Audience Q&A to foster broad community dialogue.
This is your chance to connect with peers and contribute your perspective to the national conversation. Secure your spot today!

events.id: 3 Polish Folkloric Dance Workshops-257A Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: 3 Polish Folkloric Dance Workshops
events.venue: 257A Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Masterclass 1 Thursday 27 November - Orzel dancers and friends 7 - 9pm Dom Polski Newtown
Workshop 2 Friday 28 November - Open to youth and adults 13 years plus 6 - 9pm Dom Polski Newtown
Workshop 3 Saturday 29 November - Open to children and youth 7 - 13 years 2.30 - 4pm Te Whaea National School of Dance 11 Hutchison Road Newtown
Workshop 2 and 3 are open to the public.
They will be led by qualified instructors from Wielkopolska in Poland and will incorporate the dances and traditions from that region as well as dances of Poland.
The workshops will suit all dancers who wish to benefit from the visit of these professionals and this unique opportunity. Particularly those who love folkloric and national character dancing.
The workshops are sponsored by the Polish Association in NZ Inc and the Council of Wielkopolska in Poznan Poland and are FREE of charge. Registration however, is mandatory.
For information email or phone Ela: association@polishcommunity.org.nz or see information on: www.polishcommunity.org.nz

events.name: HALF/ANGEL ALBUM FUNDRAISER w/ MYSTERY WAITRESS, KINDEKEL II & ELLY MAE
events.venue: 171 Cuba Street, Wellington
events.description:
𝗛𝗔𝗟𝗙/𝗔𝗡𝗚𝗘𝗟 𝗔𝗟𝗕𝗨𝗠 𝗙𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗥𝗔𝗜𝗦𝗘𝗥 | 𝗦𝗔𝗡 𝗙𝗥𝗔𝗡, 𝗡𝗢𝗩𝗘𝗠𝗕𝗘𝗥 𝟮𝟳𝗧𝗛 | 𝘄/ 𝗠𝗬𝗦𝗧𝗘𝗥𝗬 𝗪𝗔𝗜𝗧𝗥𝗘𝗦𝗦, 𝗞𝗜𝗡𝗗𝗘𝗞𝗘𝗟 𝗜𝗜 & 𝗘𝗟𝗟𝗬 𝗠𝗔𝗘
It’s not often a band as exciting as Half/Angel emerges in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
Less than a year since their inception, their name has become a whispered promise across the city’s music scene, with many already declaring them next in line to the throne.
Half/Angel and Goose Garden are delighted to present a supporting lineup woven from their favourite voices in the scene.
A standout among them is 𝗠𝗬𝗦𝗧𝗘𝗥𝗬 𝗪𝗔𝗜𝗧𝗥𝗘𝗦𝗦, who conjured one of Aotearoa’s most enchanting indie releases of 2024 with Bright Black Night.

events.long_description:
Eva Pub's Open Mic Night: A Celebration of Wellington's Finest Musicians!

Join us every Thursday night at Eva Pub for an unforgettable celebration of Wellington's vibrant music scene!
With an electrifying array of local talent and plenty of opportunities for you to shine, there's no better place to experience the magic of live music than your favorite local hangout.
When: Every Thursday
Time: 8:00 PM Onwards with DJ set from DKav after the open mic
Where: Eva Pub, 35 Dixon Street, 6011
What to Expect:
Local Talent Showcase: Our stage is open for musicians of all genres, offering a platform for both seasoned performers and emerging artists.
Supportive Atmosphere: Hosted every week, our Open Mic Night is more than just an event; it's a community. Our friendly host will help you settle in, assist with setup, and organize the sets to ensure a seamless and enjoyable experience.
Community of Creatives: Experience the warmth of a community that appreciates and supports local and new performances. Whether you're a regular or a first-timer, our stage welcomes you with open arms.
Why You Should Be Here:
Discover Hidden Gems: Uncover the hidden musical gems that Wellington has to offer. Our Open Mic Night is a melting pot of diverse talents waiting to be discovered.
Join In or Enjoy as a Spectator: Whether you're a performer or a music enthusiast, our Open Mic Night is the perfect place to share your talent or simply enjoy a night of entertaintment.
Secure Your Spot:
Don't miss out! Reserve your spot now for Eva Pub's Open Mic Night
Let's make Thursday nights at Eva Pub the highlight of your week as we come together to celebrate the incredible music that our city has to offer. See you there!

events.id: Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton-49 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton
events.venue: 49 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ali Whitton is a New Zealand-based singer-songwriter. Born in Aotearoa and raised in rural North Yorkshire, his music blends introspective folk, alt-country, and acoustic storytelling, drawing inspiration from artists like Nick Drake, Bright Eyes, Johnny Cash, and Bob Dylan.
With poetic lyrics rooted in nature and emotional honesty, his songs explore themes of longing, resilience, and cosmic wonder. After an early career touring the UK and France – including sharing stages with Ed Sheeran – Ali settled in Aotearoa New Zealand, where salty sea winds and bush covered landscapes continue to shape his sound.
-----------------
Tom Cunliffe returns with 'Spit Out Your Gum' – his fourth album and most intimate release to date. Vivid, offbeat, and full of heart, the record captures Cunliffe at his most direct, delivering a collection of songs that glow with warmth and humanity.
Across its tracks, Cunliffe takes listeners on a journey from the streets of London to the bright lights of Karangahape Road, and out into the cold green waves of the Irish Sea. Each song feels alive – steeped in imagery, character, and a quiet intensity that rewards deep listening.
Recorded live-to-tape at Roundhead Studios, 'Spit Out Your Gum' carries the unmistakable warmth of that hallowed room and the people within it. With Paddy Hill engineering, Cunliffe was joined by Dave Khan (violin, piano) and Cass Basil (bass, clarinet).
Together, they captured performances that unfold in real time – no edits, no digital polish, just songs recorded in single takes, preserving the intimacy, imperfection, and energy of the moment.

With poetic lyrics rooted in nature and emotional honesty, his songs explore themes of longing, resilience, and cosmic wonder.
After an early career touring the UK and France – including sharing stages with Ed Sheeran – Ali settled in Aotearoa New Zealand, where salty sea winds and bush covered landscapes continue to shape his sound.

events.id: Early Midnight Circus - An absurd late-night talk and comedy game-show-17b Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Early Midnight Circus - An absurd late-night talk and comedy game-show
events.venue: 17b Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cue the house band, fire up the applause sign and prepare for an unhinged night of late-night comedy.
This November, Early Midnight Circus returns, hosted by the irrepressible Aaron James Douglas and it's more unhinged than ever. The stage is set: Keegan Thomas is your mischievous sidekick, Matt Hutton is back on keys as band leader, and the spotlight is on this month's guests – Mo Munn, Mog Connolly, and Q Potts… who have absolutely no idea what they’re walking into.
This isn’t your standard talk show: it’s a meticulously crafted disaster, designed to push guests into the deep end with absurd character comedy, unpredictable improv and sketch chaos that thrashes through any idea of “normal.” Early Midnight Circus is a "humorous hurricane where everything can (and will) go wrong," so prepare for a night of wild interviews, absurd surprises, audience-ambushing segments, musical mayhem and a crew determined to derail everything.
It’s a late-night gateway to one of the most absurd, experimental and ambitious shows of the year - with live music, sketch chaos and improvised mayhem in a format that’s part cabaret, part meltdown and all circus.
FEATURING: Aristarkh Tikhonov, Elliott Lam, Felix Uallach, Joel Luscombe, Keegan Thomas, Kipling DC, Lydia Sainsbury, Malcolm Morrison, Matt Hutton, Ralph Hilaga, Summer Begalka and Aaron James Douglas.

events.id: The End of the Golden Weather-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The End of the Golden Weather
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
A theatrical double-shot from an iconic playwright and one of our greatest actors.

Bruce Mason is perhaps the most significant playwright in Aotearoa New Zealand’s theatrical history. Writing with courage and insight, he was a lover of language and a champion of the underdog.

Between 1959 and 1978, Bruce toured the country, telling uniquely Kiwi stories about emerging identity, cultural cringe and social difference. From church halls to country shearing sheds to the Edinburgh Festival, Bruce would play anywhere, in any circumstance, to any audience.

To celebrate his extraordinary legacy, Brilliant Adventures and Circa Theatre are collaborating to make two of his greatest solo works resound for a new age.

Two plays: timeless, universal, distinct. Following their critically acclaimed, sold out run of THINGS I KNOW TO BE TRUE, actor Stephen Lovatt and director Shane Bosher return to Circa for a not-to-be missed theatrical encounter with a master craftsman.


THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER
“I invite you to join me, in a voyage into the past, to that territory of the heart we call childhood.”

Bruce Mason’s quintessential Kiwi classic chronicles the friendship between a 12-year-old boy and Firpo, a social outcast who dreams of winning an Olympic medal.

Through the boy’s eyes we see the wonder of life on a perfect beach, in a perfect 1930s New Zealand, during a perfect summer. It’s a world of magic and transformation, where anything can happen and miracles seem possible.

When the boy sets out to help Firpo make his athletic dream a reality, ignoring his father’s rebukes and community ridicule, a battle rages between the eternal optimism of childhood and the harsh pragmatism of adulthood.

Gliding effortlessly between flights of poetic fancy and blunt everyday speech, THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER is New Zealand storytelling at its very best.


NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES
An adolescent boy tries to find his place in an adult-dominated world. A young man retraces an intensely felt boyhood experience of bullying. A playwright in his last days reconciles the value of an artistic life and challenges the idea of New Zealand identity.

Comic disasters and confronting your own hubris. NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES is a richly autobiographical search for self-expression. Profound and true, it is a set of variations about over-reaching, cheekily confronting our very own Tall Poppy Syndrome.

Celebrating Bruce Mason
Directed by Shane Bosher
Performed by Stephen Lovatt

Please note The End of the Golden Weather and Not Christmas, but Guy Fawkes tickets need to be purchases separately, see the Circa Theatre website for full dates and ticket details.

events.long_description:
Meet new people - Make international and local friends - Speak languages (mingle) - Have fun

................
Any question or request? Reach out to us on Instagram: www.instagram.com/blablalanguage
................
Join Our BlaBla Whatsapp Group: https://chat.whatsapp.com/LFeNVmzCnaG1BrHYpgBnqU
................
Stay updated via our Telegram channel: https://t.me/+n6e00r9ByRw0MmNk
................
Some guidelines for a delightful experience:
-
Our events are GRATIS, we will not charge you anything but You are asked to order a drink directly upon arrival to participate
(Mandatory).
-
Outside food and drinks are not allowed.
-
Please respect the venues staff and make sure to leave the place clean and tidy before you leave.
-
Be polite and respectful.
Please kindly note that venue staff or our organizers will ban you from our events and community without any warning if you don't respect it. We offer you opportunities to make friends and improve your language skills for free. Be nice enough to make things easy for us.
................
How it's working:
We are working with a mingle setup and we usually don't have designated language tables or areas.
English and the local language are typically spoken.
If you would like to speak other languages, please ask the organizers or seek participants who meet your language expectations.
................
Things to keep in mind before joining:
-
By attending our events, you consent to being photographed or filmed. Photos and videos taken during the events will be shared on our social media. If you do not wish to appear in the photos, please send us a private message as soon as possible on Instagram (@blablalanguage).
-
Remember to keep an eye on your belongings and prioritize your own well-being. We are not responsible for any lost items or personal issues.
................
/

These gatherings are brought to you by BlaBla Language Exchange, spanning over 150 cities across 5 continents. We are always looking for new organizers. More information and application here: https://www.blablalanguageexchange.com/event-organizers
................
/
Share your photography / video skills: Volunteer as photographer (volunteering)!
Are you a photo virtuoso or a video wizard?
Whether you're a pro or a passionate newbie, we want YOU!
No cash, but lots of laughs and fame (well, sort of). We'll even give you a virtual high-five!

events.id: SharePoint Online/2019 for Power Users, 4-Day Training Course in Wellington-100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: SharePoint Online/2019 for Power Users, 4-Day Training Course in Wellington
events.venue: 100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Course: SPOPEU Duration: 4 Days Audience: End Users Microsoft Course: 55215 Overview This course delivers the complete site owner story from start to finish in an engaging and practical way to ensure you have the confidence to plan and create new sites or manage your existing sites, whether you're using SharePoint Online through Microsoft 365, or SharePoint 2019 on-premises.
Your goal is to learn how to make SharePoint relevant to your team by using a sites functionality to help you share information and collaborate with your colleagues.
During the class you will also learn best practices and ‘what not to do’ as you watch live, interactive demonstrations and put theory into practice with hands on exercises.
Module List Module 1: Introduction to SharePoint Module 2: Finding Content Module 3: Working with Lists Module 4: Working with Libraries Module 5: Working with Publishing Features Module 6: Leveraging Social Content in the Business Module 7: Site Owner Responsibilities Module 8: Creating and Managing Sites Module 9: Site Customisation Module 10: Permissions and Security Module 11: Creating & Managing Lists & Libraries Module 12: Advanced Document Management Module 13: Power Platform Integration Module 14: Creating & Managing Content Types Click here for the full 'SharePoint Online for Power Users' course outline Click here for the full 'SharePoint 2019 for Power Users' course outline

events.long_description:
AKWAABA!

Please come and support Ato on his journey getting back to Ghana!

Ato Kwamena is a composer and a percussionist from the Cape Coast in Ghana.
Inspired by West African highlife music, he has performed with numerous Aotearoa groups, including Culture Embassy, Orchestra of Spheres, ISKRA and Lord Echo.

Ato's mum recently passed away and we're fundraising money for a flight back home, so he can be with his family.

RAS JUDAH AND THE CULTURE EMBASSY

a 10-piece NZ band of varying cultural backgrounds, hence the name.
The cultural diversity of the band is reflected in the sound of the music
a fusion of African styles, Reggae/Ska, Jazz and Afro-Latin rhythms.

We describe our sound as Afrocentric-World Music as much of what we play is based on African rhythms and songs, which is where our lead-singer ‘Ras Judah’ and two of our master drummers come from (Botswana, Ghana and Tanzania respectively), plus Roots Reggae. Though everyone contributes their own culturally inspired sound, with other band members from Cuba, England and Japan, and others with Greek, Kiwiana and jazz backgrounds. Not just a musical treat representing many parts of the world, but also a visual one; a carnival of ethnic diversity and collaboration on stage!

ISKRA

Iskra are an otherworldly quartet heralding from Te Whanganui-a-Tara formed by saxophonist Josh Buckler and featuring Simon Grove (Niko Ne Zna) on helicon, Ato Kwamena (Culture Embassy) on percussion and David McGurk (Planet Hunter) on drums.

Inspired by the likes of Sons of Kemet and the London jazz scene, they bring driving grooves, soaring melodies and the fire of afro-beat, Balkan music and a style that is best described as brass-house. Think dance party at the end of the world, when the last lights have gone out

events.id: Andy Binns: Immersive-event Designer-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Andy Binns: Immersive-event Designer
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
In this final Creative Mornings event for 2025, our guest speaker will be, Andy Binns. Andy is an immersive-event designer, transforming spaces into unique, powerful, sensory experiences. With some basic equipment, he founded Hype Entertainment (@HypeEntertainmentNZ) in 2010. Operating out of his parents’ garage, growing it into a creative enterprise known for one-of-a-kind installations that capture international attention.
Andy’s journey has been one of continual growth and discovery, professionally and personally. Guided by a strong spiritual side and a firm faith in synchronicity and symbolism, he is driven by simple desires:
• To inspire awe as people walk into a space
• To lift the energy in a room
• To design projects that make a positive impact
Through his creations, Andy reminds us that design can be a form of meditation- that, “true magic happens when art, nature, and spirit meet”.
Come along for this immersive and inspiring talk, meet like minded creatives, enjoy a light breakfast and register your spot today.

events.id: James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington-The Fringe Bar,28 Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington
events.venue: The Fringe Bar,28 Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington
Irreverent, incorrigible, and just ever so outraged, award-winning comedian James Nokise lets loose in Wellington for one night only!

Politicians, policies, preachers, and protests are all in the line of fire as Nokise brings his fast paced, semi-chaotic, always cathartic, blend of humour and hot takes back to NZ for a hilarious hour of big laughs and the occasional frustrated scream.

One Night Rant is political comedy at its sharpest. From parliament scandals to global chaos, Nokise rips into the news cycle, mixing big laughs with bite-sized truths. This is a one-hour comedy special designed for anyone who’s ever shouted at the TV, despaired at the headlines, or secretly enjoyed watching politicians squirm.


About James Nokise

A multi-talented comedian, playwright, columnist, podcaster, theatre maker, and social commentator, James Nokise is known for his fearless approach and his ability to give a voice to underrepresented issues.

Over the course of his illustrious career James has been nominated twice for the Billy T Award (2005, 2006) and the Fred Award for Best New Zealand Show (2013), which he subsequently took out in 2019 for his show God Damn Fancy Man. He won Best Male Comedian at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards (2013), Spirit of the Festival at the 2021 NZ Comedy Fest and the Topp Prize (2024). James was also the winner of best documentary at the 2025 NZ radio awards for his series The Last Voyage of the Rainbow Warrior, and winner of the Best International Podcast at the 2025 Asia Podcast Awards.

James has an extensive touring career, including over a decade of shows in the NZ International Comedy Festival and multiple Comedy Gala performances, as well as years on the international Fringe Festival circuit, performing successful seasons in Edinburgh, Perth, and New York.

events.name: JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series #1
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series #1
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session starting on November 28th!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

Booking Details
Investment: $55

Sesssion - 7pm -8.30pm on Fridays
in 2025 - 28/11, 12/12,
in 2026 - 30/1, 13/2. 27/2, 14/3, 28/3

events.id: SAYA GRAY + Karen Nyame KG + MĀ-Meow Nui, 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011,92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: SAYA GRAY + Karen Nyame KG + MĀ
events.venue: Meow Nui, 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011,92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
SAYA GRAY + Karen Nyame KG + MĀ
Drunken Piano, Banished Music and The Others Way festival are hyped to announce a huge debut NZ appearance on Friday 28th November 2025 for Canada’s Saya Gray at Wellington’s stunning Meow Nui. Support comes from UK producer DJ Karen Nyame KG and Te Whanganui-a-Tara local artist Mā.

Taking the stage in Wellington ahead of her Others Way Festival appearance the next night, Saya Gray will be performing material from her excellent record released earlier this year SAYA.

Saya Gray has earned a reputation for electric, hypnotic live performances, leaping between instruments and genres, beguiling and entrancing her audiences.

“The alt-pop experimentalist delivered a mesmerizing, emotional performance with a triumphant sense of self” – Range Magazine

Watch her NPR Tiny Desk performance here.

Sharing the Meow Nui stage with Saya is UK DJ, producer, vocalist Karen Nyame KG.

“Channeling a deeply rooted attachment to the African diaspora, KG’s innovative and percussive assemblage of dance music spanned amapiano, afrobeats, uk funky, gqom and beyond.” – Resident Advisor

You can check our her boiler room set at Primavera here.

Rounding out the evening is local artist Mā. With their second album “Blame It On The Weather” being released earlier this year, Mā told RNZ “I’d rather talk about how we can move forward, how we can evolve, how we can work together better”.

Don’t miss this celebratory evening of creative expression and artistic genius. With Saya Gray and KG performing for the first time in New Zealand, tickets are on sale now from ticketek.co.nz

You may also like the following events from Banished Music:
Next month, 29th October, 09:30 am, C.W Stoneking - Auckland - The Tuning Fork in Auckland
Next month, 31st October, 09:30 am, C.W Stoneking - Pāuatahanui - The Morgans Clubhouse in Porirua
This November, 1st November, 09:30 am, C.W Stoneking - Dunedin - Hanover Hall in Dunedin
Also check out other Entertainment events in Wellington, Arts events in Wellington, Music events in Wellington.

events.id: Catalytic Thinking for Capacity Builders-50 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Catalytic Thinking for Capacity Builders
events.venue: 50 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Catalytic Thinking for Capacity Builders
A 4 hour, practice-based session with Hildy Gottlieb.
Who this is for
People whose mahi is to help organisations do their best work: capacity builders,
advisors, funders and philanthropy staff, backbone and collective impact teams,
council and agency community advisors, sector peak bodies, governance support roles, coaches, consultants and trainers.
Why come
When you support others to thrive, the questions you ask can unlock entirely new
pathways. In this interactive session, you’ll learn practical, question-led approaches you can apply immediately in meetings, workshops, coaching and governance development.
Bring
A realworld situation you’re supporting (e.g., a governance challenge, a funding
conversation, a stuck collaborative). You’ll apply the tools to that context during the session.
Event details
Date: November 28, 2025
Time: 10am to 2pm
Location: 50 The Terrace, Wellington
Cost: $250+gst
Capacity: Limited to 30 participants
Accessibility: We aim to make this session accessible. Please let us know
any requirements (e.g., captions, stepfree access, dietary needs).
Register
Presented by LEAD
Contact/ Questions? Email info@lead.or.nz

events.id: Little Blast Trio with Oscar Laven-Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Little Blast Trio with Oscar Laven
events.venue: Pyramid Club,272 Taranaki Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Little Blast Trio with Oscar Laven
Little Blast Trio (with special guest, Oscar Laven), play the music of ‘Triplicate’ - the 1988 album released by the Dave Holland trio on the legendary ECM label.

“Holy shit! You can do that in jazz?” thought these young players upon encountering it almost 30 years ago. Sure can! It’s time to put this lovely mix of tunes through their paces, refracted through the prism of these four stalwarts of the craft who have performed extensively in Aotearoa and beyond over the last few decades. Should be quite a gig.

Little Blast Trio is:
- Blair Latham ~ Tenor Sax/Bass Clarinet
- Alistair Isdale ~ Acoustic Bass
- Darren Mathieson ~ Drum kit
- with Oscar Laven ~ Tenor Sax/Bassoon

$15 presale tickets via UTR
$20 door sales ($10 unwaged)

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: RED RIBBON REVUE: Wellington Cabaret for World AIDS Day with Comedy, Drag, and Community-The Fringe Bar,30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: RED RIBBON REVUE: Wellington Cabaret for World AIDS Day with Comedy, Drag, and Community
events.venue: The Fringe Bar,30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
RED RIBBON REVUE: Wellington Cabaret for World AIDS Day with Comedy, Drag, and Community
This World AIDS Day season, join us at Fringe Bar for an unforgettable night of comedy, drag, burlesque, and music - all in support of Body Positive and Burnett Foundation Aotearoa 🌈❤️

Hosted by award-winning comedian Neil Thornton, the Red Ribbon Revue brings together some of Wellington’s finest queer and allied talent for an evening that’s equal parts celebration and solidarity. Expect laughs, glamour, and moments that remind us why this cause still matters.

Doors open at 7pm | Show starts at 8pm.

✨ Featuring performances from:

Willy SmacknTush - Multi Award-winning Drag king. From TV's House of Drag
Jak Darling - Billy T Award Nominee
Margot Embargot - Pole artist and founding member of Fired Up Stilettos
Faux Femme - Winner, Mx Capital Drag
Anya Rzhevitskaya - Comedian and producer
Victor Victorious - Veteran cabaret performer
Thomas Doreen - Wholesome-meets-filthy comedian
Ralph Hilaga - Comedian. Raw Comedy Quest finalist
Dusty Daze - Hutt Valley drag queen

All proceeds support Body Positive and Burnett Foundation Aotearoa, two organisations who are leading the fight against HIV stigma and supporting people living with HIV across Aotearoa.

After the show, stick around for karaoke and community connection - because what’s a cabaret without a singalong? 🎶

🎟 Tickets:
GA $30 | Concession $20 (+fees) (VIP $50)
👉 Get yours at eventfinda.co.nz
or call 0800 BUY TIX (289 849)

About World AIDS Day (1 December): A time to honour those we’ve lost, celebrate how far we’ve come, and keep pushing toward an HIV-free, stigma-free future.

All profits benefit Body Positive (bodypositive.org.nz), a peer support organization founded by and run for all people living with HIV in New Zealand.

Join us for a night of laughter, love, and legacy

events.name: Roots Rising Tour Palmerston North – House of Shem, Son and Water, Brutha Rodz
events.venue: The New Royal Hotel Papaioea,44 Rangitikei St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Roots Rising Tour Palmerston North – House of Shem, Son and Water, Brutha Rodz
Roots Rising Tour – Presented by Titan Entertainment

Get ready for the Roots Rising Tour, hitting Aotearoa across four locations!

This is a tour you don’t want to miss, featuring Aotearoa reggae heavyweights — House of Shem, Son and Water, and Brutha Rodz — bringing energy and authentic roots music to the stage.

House of Shem are back and will perform all their classic hits alongside brand new music.

Joining them is Son and Water, led by the legendary Jamie Ferguson — the saxophonist and songwriter behind many of Katchafire’s biggest hits. Now performing alongside his sons, Jamie and the band are creating fresh, inspiring sounds that are capturing hearts all over Aotearoa.

Adding to the lineup is Brutha Rodz, a true roots reggae storyteller known for his smooth vocals, conscious lyrics, and powerful live performances that connect deeply with the crowd.

This will be the first time Son and Water perform in many of these cities, making it an extra special experience for fans of real Aotearoa roots reggae.

Tickets on sale now.

⸻


Tour Dates

📍 15 Nov – Hamilton – The Factory

📍 28 Nov – Palmerston North – The Royal

📍 29 Nov – Whakatāne – The Boiler Room

📍 6 Dec – Rotorua – Phoenix Bar

events.id: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression-Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression
events.venue: Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Some people may have experienced depression in the past and come along to help manage relapses.
It is a very diverse group and ranges in number from week to week - from 3 to 14 people.
There is a structure to the meetings, with a new topic each week.
What is the structure of group meetings?
- 12:30pm - Meditative grounding exercise - 12:40pm - Opening round – how was your week, a highlight, did you achieve your goal or anything else you’d like to say - 1:30pm - Tea break (about 10 minutes) - 1:40pm - Educational topic - 2:20pm - Closing round - what you found useful, something you are looking forward to this week, possibility to set a goal for the week to come.

events.long_description:
We would love you to join us for our exclusive Déjeuner de Noël event, Bubbles & Canapé's with Lisa O'Neill being held at Quarter Acre, for our end of year Women in Business Networking Event.
The event is being held on Friday 28th of November, from 12.30-2.30pm. 
For over two decades, Lisa O'Neill has been electrifying audiences with her unique ability to deliver profound messages through side-splitting humour. After watching countless people struggle with energy, leadership and personal growth, Lisa discovered that transformation happens when hard truths are delivered with lightness and laughter. She's authored seven books, spoken to audiences of 5000+, and works with major organisations like Ray White, Foodstuffs and L'Oreal.
With infectious energy and practical wisdom, Lisa helps people get out of their own way to create magnificent lives and exceptional results.
What sets Lisa apart is her ability to make transformation feel both possible and fun. She's been called a "human Berocca" for her energising presence, and "emotionally nutritious" for her ability to nourish both hearts and minds. Through her speaking, books, and programs, Lisa empowers people to stop making excuses and start living magnificent lives. Her message is simple but profound: with the right energy, belief and action, you can have, be and do everything you want.
Join us Quarter Acre Private Event Venue - Don't miss the opportunity to hear from Lisa in person.
Friday 28th November
12.30-2.30pm  
Limited tickets - book today! 
Welcoming glass of bubbles and 2 course canapés
$60pp + bf

events.id: Community Comms Collective workshop for NFPs: Social marketing essentials - communications that create change-170 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Community Comms Collective workshop for NFPs: Social marketing essentials - communications that create change
events.venue: 170 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
How can we change or maintain people’s behaviour through marketing, and truly benefit the communities we serve?
This hands-on workshop will demonstrate how you can create behaviour change through social marketing. You’ll learn the basics of behaviour change marketing and communications, including best practice approaches to achieve behaviour change for social good outcomes.
Learn tools, tips, and strategies to help you:
·      Develop programmes or services that influence the communities you serve
·      Target resources effectively and choose tactics that have impact
·      Create communications and marketing campaigns that resonate
We are thrilled to have communications expert and social entrepreneur Tracey Bridges lead this workshop. She is a co-founder and director of The Good Registry, a social enterprise that directs consumer spending on gifts towards good causes. Tracey has significant governance experience in the not-for-profit space, including Whānau Āwhina Plunket and the WELLfed Charitable Trust, and is a fellow Public Relations Institute of New Zealand.
Tracey's insights are drawn from international and local practice, and a long career in behaviour change in social marketing, working on projects, including It’s Not OK, Sorted, Like Minds, Like Mine and many more.
Workshop presenter: Tracey Bridges
For out of towners or those who can’t make it on the day, this workshop will be recorded and shared on our website after the event, along with our other resources.
This is a free Community Comms Collective workshop for not-for-profits and collective volunteers hosted by Volunteer Wellington and supported by JacksonStone & Partners. We are grateful for their support and for our speaker for giving their time and talent pro bono.
Koha welcome to help cover venue hire.
St John’s in the City conference room is wheelchair accessible – please contact the Church Office with any queries https://www.stjohnsinthecity.org.nz/contact-us

events.name: Handmade Greeting Card workshop
events.venue: 151 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for a relaxing and fun introduction to the world of handmade cards! Perfect way to create personalised cards to add a heartfelt touch to your gifts this festive season.
In this 2 hours workshop, you'll learn the fundamentals of creative card design, from selecting the right materials to mastering basic card-making techniques.
We'll cover everything you need to get started, including folding cardstock, layering paper and adding unique embellishments.
You'll leave with several handcrafted cards and the confidence to keep creating at home. All materials and tools are provided—just bring your creativity!
Participants can expect to make three cards during the session.
All necessary supplies including cardstock, punching machines and embellishments will be provided.
Techniques including flower making, quilling layering and embellishing will be taught including skills like - conceptualising, layout and playing with scale.
Saturday 15 November 2025 at 4 pm
Friday 28 November 2025 at 5.30 pm
Saturday 29 November at 4 pm
materials provided
2 hours workshop limited at 5 attendees per session
Beginner and intermediate level
$50 per person

events.id: Chris Knox: Not Given Lightly | BOOK LAUNCH, WELLINGTON-57 Willis Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Chris Knox: Not Given Lightly | BOOK LAUNCH, WELLINGTON
events.venue: 57 Willis Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us to celebrate the release of Chris Knox: Not Given Lightly, a biography by Craig Robertson.
Friday 28 November
6pm
Unity Books
57 Willis Street
Wellington
Come along to hear more from Craig in conversation with
Nick Bollinger and to get your copy signed. Books will be available to purchase thanks to our hosts, Unity Books, and light refreshments provided.
Read more about the book: https://aucklanduniversitypress.co.nz/chris-knox/
—
ABOUT THE AUTHORS
Craig Robertson grew up in Dunedin, New Zealand, where as a student he wrote a thesis on the ‘Dunedin Sound’, as well as articles for Rip It Up and a fanzine on local bands. He is now professor of media studies at Northeastern University in Boston, Massachusetts, and the author of The Passport in America: The History of a Document (‘provocative’ – New York Times) and The Filing Cabinet: A Vertical History of Information (‘captivating’ – The Atlantic). His book on Chris Knox is a labour of love by an enthusiast with a deep understanding of the man, the music and the culture he worked in. Knox himself blessed the project before his stroke.

Friday 28 November 6pm Unity Books 57 Willis Street Wellington Come along to hear more from Craig in conversation with Nick Bollinger and to get your copy signed.
Books will be available to purchase thanks to our hosts, Unity Books, and light refreshments provided.
Read more about the book: https://aucklanduniversitypress.co.nz/chris-knox/ —

events.id: James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington-30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington
events.venue: 30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Irreverent, incorrigible, and just ever so outraged, award-winning comedian James Nokise lets loose in Wellington for one night only!
Politicians, policies, preachers, and protests are all in the line of fire as Nokise brings his fast paced, semi-chaotic, always cathartic, blend of humour and hot takes back to NZ for a hilarious hour of big laughs and the occasional frustrated scream.
One Night Rant is political comedy at its sharpest. From parliament scandals to global chaos, Nokise rips into the news cycle, mixing big laughs with bite-sized truths. This is a one-hour comedy special designed for anyone who’s ever shouted at the TV, despaired at the headlines, or secretly enjoyed watching politicians squirm.

About James Nokise
A multi-talented comedian, playwright, columnist, podcaster, theatre maker, and social commentator, James Nokise is known for his fearless approach and his ability to give a voice to underrepresented issues.
Over the course of his illustrious career James has been nominated twice for the Billy T Award (2005, 2006) and the Fred Award for Best New Zealand Show (2013), which he subsequently took out in 2019 for his show God Damn Fancy Man. He won Best Male Comedian at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards (2013), Spirit of the Festival at the 2021 NZ Comedy Fest and the Topp Prize (2024). James was also the winner of best documentary at the 2025 NZ radio awards for his series The Last Voyage of the Rainbow Warrior, and winner of the Best International Podcast at the 2025 Asia Podcast Awards.
James has an extensive touring career, including over a decade of shows in the NZ International Comedy Festival and multiple Comedy Gala performances, as well as years on the international Fringe Festival circuit, performing successful seasons in Edinburgh, Perth, and New York.

events.id: SAYA GRAY + Karen Nyame KG + MĀ-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: SAYA GRAY + Karen Nyame KG + MĀ
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Drunken Piano, Banished Music and The Others Way festival are hyped to announce a huge debut NZ appearance on Friday 28th November 2025 for Canada’s Saya Gray at Wellington’s stunning Meow Nui. Support comes from UK producer DJ Karen Nyame KG and Te Whanganui-a-Tara local artist Mā.
Taking the stage in Wellington ahead of her Others Way Festival appearance the next night, Saya Gray will be performing material from her excellent record released earlier this year SAYA.
Saya Gray has earned a reputation for electric, hypnotic live performances, leaping between instruments and genres, beguiling and entrancing her audiences.
“The alt-pop experimentalist delivered a mesmerizing, emotional performance with a triumphant sense of self” – Range Magazine
Watch her NPR Tiny Desk performance here.
Sharing the Meow Nui stage with Saya is UK DJ, producer, vocalist Karen Nyame KG.
“Channeling a deeply rooted attachment to the African diaspora, KG’s innovative and percussive assemblage of dance music spanned amapiano, afrobeats, uk funky, gqom and beyond.” – Resident Advisor
You can check our her boiler room set at Primavera here.
Rounding out the evening is local artist Mā. With their second album “Blame It On The Weather” being released earlier this year, Mā told RNZ “I’d rather talk about how we can move forward, how we can evolve, how we can work together better”.
Don’t miss this celebratory evening of creative expression and artistic genius. With Saya Gray and KG performing for the first time in New Zealand, tickets are on sale now from ticketek.co.nz
events.description:

events.id: SOLD OUT: Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt : SOLD OUT-The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: SOLD OUT: Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt : SOLD OUT
events.venue: The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
SOLD OUT: Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt : SOLD OUT
All tickets to this show have sold. Second show announcement soon...

This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.

Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterised by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.

With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.

Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.

Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.

You may also like the following events from Darren Watson:
This November, 9th November, 05:00 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Tauranga in Tauranga
This November, 15th November, 09:30 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Kumeū in Waitakere
This November, 21st November, 10:00 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - New Plymouth in New Plymouth
Also check out other Music events in Lower Hutt, Entertainment events in Lower Hutt, Arts events in Lower Hutt.

events.id: Little Blast Trio with Oscar Laven-272 Taranaki Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Little Blast Trio with Oscar Laven
events.venue: 272 Taranaki Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Little Blast Trio (with special guest, Oscar Laven), play the music of ‘Triplicate’ - the 1988 album released by the Dave Holland trio on the legendary ECM label.
“Holy shit! You can do that in jazz?” thought these young players upon encountering it almost 30 years ago. Sure can! It’s time to put this lovely mix of tunes through their paces, refracted through the prism of these four stalwarts of the craft who have performed extensively in Aotearoa and beyond over the last few decades. Should be quite a gig.
Little Blast Trio is:
- Blair Latham ~ Tenor Sax/Bass Clarinet
- Alistair Isdale ~ Acoustic Bass
- Darren Mathieson ~ Drum kit
- with Oscar Laven ~ Tenor Sax/Bassoon
$15 presale tickets via UTR
$20 door sales ($10 unwaged)
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: Red Ribbon Revue: A Cabaret for World Aids Day-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Red Ribbon Revue: A Cabaret for World Aids Day
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
A fun and festive (and gently informative) cabaret in recognition of World Aids Day (which is a few days later on Dec 1st). Hosted by Neil D'Bear Thornton (Best Comedian and Best MC, Wellington Comedy awards) and sponsored by The Burnett Foundation and Body Positive. Comedy! Drag! Burlesque! Music! More! (Cast includes Jak Darling, Willie Smackntush, members of Fired Up Stilettos, and more!)

World AIDS Day, observed annually on December 1st, is an international day to raise awareness of the global fight against HIV/AIDS.

All profits to benefit Body Positive (https://bodypositive.org.nz/). Body Positive Inc. is a peer support organisation, founded by and run for, all people living with HIV in New Zealand.

Doors at 7:00pm. Cabaret at 8:00pm. Drinks and karaoke to follow!

events.id: Let's Planet New Album Release-St Peters Village Hall, Paekākāriki,19 Beach Rd, Paekakariki 5034, New Zealand, Paekakariki-All Events In
events.name: Let's Planet New Album Release
events.venue: St Peters Village Hall, Paekākāriki,19 Beach Rd, Paekakariki 5034, New Zealand, Paekakariki
events.long_description:
Let's Planet New Album Release
Doors open 6:30 pm

Show starts 7:30 pm

Cash door sales available - $30

Tickets available on https://events.humanitix.com/let-s-planet-new-album-release

Let’s Planet makes jangly pop with a backbone and they have been doing it for 40 years. Formed by songwriter/guitarist Alan Galloway, with Nigel Clements and Helen Cairney, the group found its true direction when Caroline Easther (The Chills, The Verlaines, and now in The Warratahs) joined with her snap-tight drums and Murray Costello (The Mockers) came in on bass. Pagan Records released Favours, Loving Tongues and La Gloria, where Let’s Planet honed their chiming guitars, close vocal harmonies, melodic basslines, and catchy hooks. They have shared stages with R.E.M., Crowded House, Throwing Muses, The Proclaimers, Split Enz, and Paul Kelly. Reviewers have called their catalogue “thoughtful and polished, moving from breezy guitar numbers to moody indie-rock”, and their earlier material has been collected on Pearlers, a best-of compilation available on Bandcamp.

Alan and Caroline have kept on writing and performing. Now - only 27 years after their last studio album - Let’s Planet is back with a new record! Anything You Want picks up all the right threads again: textured songs, thoughtful arrangements, and the hooks that long-time fans expect and new listeners will be excited to discover.

The album release gig will start 7:30 pm 29 November in St Peter's Hall, Paekakariki ﻿with help from Tatiana Sogrina, and Nigel Mitchell from Orangefarm.

Let’s Planet are offering anything you want — and quite possibly something you didn’t know you needed.

Formed by songwriter/guitarist Alan Galloway, with Nigel Clements and Helen Cairney, the group found its true direction when Caroline Easther (The Chills, The Verlaines, and now in The Warratahs) joined with her snap-tight drums and Murray Costello (The Mockers) came in on bass.
Pagan Records released Favours, Loving Tongues and La Gloria, where Let’s Planet honed their chiming guitars, close vocal harmonies, melodic basslines, and catchy hooks.
They have shared stages with R.E.M., Crowded House, Throwing Muses, The Proclaimers, Split Enz, and Paul Kelly.
Anything You Want picks up all the right threads again: textured songs, thoughtful arrangements, and the hooks that long-time fans expect and new listeners will be excited to discover.

events.id: Third Eye Hi-Fi Presents - Druid's Temple-154 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Third Eye Hi-Fi Presents - Druid's Temple
events.venue: 154 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Third Eye Hifi Presents:
Druids Temple
Rooted in the ancient traditions of the druids, this night channels the deep connection between land, spirit, and sound. The druids saw the earth as sacred — every tree, stone, and breath carrying rhythm and resonance. Their gatherings in the forests were not just rituals, but sonic ceremonies — where vibration, intention, and nature intertwined.
Carrying that lineage into the present, we gather once more — not in oak circles, but beneath the pulse of sub-bass and smoke. The dancefloor becomes our modern temple, a sacred space where frequencies align and collective energy moves as one.
Channeling ancient energy through modern frequencies, our array of homegrown and international artists bring their influence in the 130 / 140 bass music scene for an immersive experience to remember.
// Druids Line-Up //
Tamar
Clova
Tarantist
Kameano
Bvrbwyre
Steering Hippies
Decor by RabidFoam
Visuals by Focal Point
Artwork by P-S-I

events.id: A.Skills (UK)-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: A.Skills (UK)
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
A.Skillz (UK)
A.Skillz is a master of the decks and a true party rocker, known for fusing Funk, Soul, Hip Hop, Rock, and Bass into an electrifying mix that’s uniquely his own. His sets burst with re-edits, remixes, and original productions, taking crowds on a high-energy journey through sound. With a signature flair that blurs genres and ignites dancefloors, A.Skillz brings the party wherever he goes.

With support from The Sandwiches Guy (Bryce) and KARDIAK
The Sandwiches Guy, aka Bryce, spent the ’90s in London immersed in rave and club culture—DJing, promoting, and throwing parties. Returning to Wellington in 2000, he co-founded the event brand Sandwiches, which by 2003 had evolved into one of the city’s most iconic venues. For over a decade, Sandwiches was at the heart of Wellington’s nightlife, hosting top local and international acts and expanding into large-scale events such as the legendary Summerset at the Basin Reserve festival.

A.Skillz (UK) A.Skillz is a master of the decks and a true party rocker, known for fusing Funk, Soul, Hip Hop, Rock, and Bass into an electrifying mix that’s uniquely his own.
His sets burst with re-edits, remixes, and original productions, taking crowds on a high-energy journey through sound.
With a signature flair that blurs genres and ignites dancefloors, A.Skillz brings the party wherever he goes.
With support from The Sandwiches Guy (Bryce) and KARDIAK The Sandwiches Guy, aka Bryce, spent the ’90s in London immersed in rave and club culture—DJing, promoting, and throwing parties.
Returning to Wellington in 2000, he co-founded the event brand Sandwiches, which by 2003 had evolved into one of the city’s most iconic venues.

events.id: W**d Releasing Bee-Hana Udy Pl, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032-All Events In
events.name: W**d Releasing Bee
events.venue: Hana Udy Pl, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032
events.long_description:
W**d Releasing Bee
Kia Ora Koutou

Now we have finished planting for the year we are turning our attention to the all-important W**d releasing. This is essential to keeping the young plants that we have planted this winter from being overwhelmed by grass and weeds. Also mulching to help with moisture retention over those hot summer days. Our next weeding is on Saturday 29th November, meeting at the Nursery on Hana Udy Place at 9.00am. Gloves, tools and sunscreen provided along with a morning tea and an update on the Reserve afterward. Hope to see you there! Feel free to bring a friend and encourage others to join us. This will be our last volunteer activity for the year.

Also over summer we may need some help in watering the plants we put in this year, I will do a post if we need extra help.


Health & Safety Notice: When working in the Reserve, please ensure your clothing and footwear are appropriate for expected weather conditions (cold, wet or hot) and the terrain (such as holes, hidden objects, blackberry, overhead branches). Trip hazards and slippery tracks are a possibility. Stay clear of waterways. Be cautious if you have allergies and carry the necessary medication. Enjoy your time in the Reserve and please avoid blocking pathways used by other users. Report any accidents, injuries or possible hazards to the H&S Coordinator (021 071 5364).
events.description:
Our next weeding is on Saturday 29th November, meeting at the Nursery on Hana Udy Place at 9.00am.
Gloves, tools and sunscreen provided along with a morning tea and an update on the Reserve afterward.
Hope to see you there!
Feel free to bring a friend and encourage others to join us.
Also over summer we may need some help in watering the plants we put in this year, I will do a post if we need extra help.

events.id: Eco Dye Workshop-Waikanae Arts and Crafts Society Inc,27A Elizabeth St, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae-All Events In
events.name: Eco Dye Workshop
events.venue: Waikanae Arts and Crafts Society Inc,27A Elizabeth St, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Eco Dye Workshop
Impressions of Nature on Silk

Eco dyeing, also known as leaf or eco print, is a gentle, alchemical process where the natural pigments of leaves are transferred directly onto fabric, creating one-of-a-kind botanical imprints.

Join me for a full day of slow making and discovery as we explore this beautiful dialogue between nature and cloth. In the morning, we’ll forage around the hall, gathering leaves and foliage that speak to us. You’ll learn how to prepare and bundle silk with plant materials, drawing out colours and patterns from the landscape itself.

In the afternoon, you’ll design and dye your own silk scarf — a wearable memory of place and season, marked by the delicate traces of nature’s touch.

You will learn

• which plants and fibres work best for this method
• how to use an iron mordant to enhance colour and detail
• different bundling techniques and approaches

All materials and tools will be provided for use during the workshop.

Your workshop fee includes silk fabrics to explore and experiment with, one silk scarf to design and dye, and a detailed handout with information on mordants, dye plants, tips, and useful resources.

A ‘what to bring’ list (including suggestions for clothing and optional items) will be sent out closer to the workshop date.

Booking through my website (see link above)

Location

27A Elizabeth Street (Art and Craft Society)
Waikane
Kāpiti

Join me for a full day of slow making and discovery as we explore this beautiful dialogue between nature and cloth.
In the morning, we’ll forage around the hall, gathering leaves and foliage that speak to us.
In the afternoon, you’ll design and dye your own silk scarf — a wearable memory of place and season, marked by the delicate traces of nature’s touch.

events.id: Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day-6 Hewson Cres, Otaki Beach, Otaki 5512-All Events In
events.name: Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day
events.venue: 6 Hewson Cres, Otaki Beach, Otaki 5512
events.long_description:
Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day
Create gorgeous simple leadlight suncatchers with Lisa Sinclair.

A super fun day-class, ideal as a stand-alone experience, or as a day to get stuck into projects with your tutor at hand.

Beginners choose from a range of achievable patterns and choose their colour palette. They will learn to cut the glass, and prepare it before foiling and soldering each piece, creating a simple elegant colourful glass project.

The aim of this one day class is to leave with a completed small leadlight glass item.

More experienced students may bring existing projects to work on in class - though emphasis will be placed on focusing on the same techniques of flat, nicely soldered simple designs.

This is a warm and friendly class with excellent support and learning for complete beginners and more advanced students. All tools are supplied, though you are welcome to bring your own tools and glass if you have them.

Your materials for your beginner project are supplied as part of your course fee.
Additional materials and tools are available to purchase.

Not suitable for children. Older teenagers (16+) are welcome.

Workshop fee $215, Early bird $194 till 2 November.

events.venue: St Marks Wesley Uniting,58 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Gaudete!! - A Christmas Concert
The end of the year is coming up fast and Hutt City Chorale's Christmas concert "Gaudete!!" is on Saturday 29 November. The Chorale is back at St Marks Church, 58 Woburn Road, Central Lower Hutt again for this concert. Doors open at 1.30pm with the concert starting at 2.00pm. This time we are singing three movements from the Anton Diabelli Pastoral Mass, a selection of carols from various regions or countries in Europe and of course some Christmas favourites.

Tickets are available from choir members, via email or at the door (cash/internet banking)

At the conclusion of the concert the Christmas raffle will be drawn. $2 a ticket/3 for $5. The prizes are fantastic!!! Following the concert afternoon tea ���will be served in the church foyer. This is the perfect opportunity to mix and mingle with the choir and other audience members. ��

events.id: Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again-12 Britannia Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012,12 Britannia St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again
events.venue: 12 Britannia Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012,12 Britannia St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again
Our upcoming Echoes of Home invites audiences on a musical and storytelling journey that traces the emotional path of every migrant — from the laughter of childhood to the quiet ache of distance and the enduring warmth of return.

Through five evocative chapters of live music, dance, and performance, the show unfolds as a tapestry of memory and identity — celebrating resilience, cultural pride, and the beauty of belonging.

It begins with “Tuổi Thơ Bé Nhỏ” (Childhood Memories), a tender glimpse into early life in Vietnam, filled with playfulness and sunshine.
Then comes “Thời Học Sinh” (School Days), where friendship, curiosity, and the vibrant pulse of youth take centre stage.
“Trưởng Thành” (Adulthood) follows, echoing the courage to grow, dream, and chase life’s horizons.
The story deepens with “Xa Quê Lập Nghiệp” (Life Abroad) — a heartfelt portrait of those who leave home to build a new life, balancing hope and longing.
Finally, “Nhớ Nhung Tìm Về” (Longing and Return) closes the circle, where nostalgia meets gratitude and the heart finds its way home again.

Blending traditional Vietnamese melodies with modern artistry, Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again is more than a performance — it is a bridge between generations, a celebration of roots, and an embrace of the shared human journey toward belonging.

events.id: Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio-SPACE Yoga and Mindfulness Studio,8 Lookout Road, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio
events.venue: SPACE Yoga and Mindfulness Studio,8 Lookout Road, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio
We invite you to a special evening of Sacred Harmonic Sound with multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia. This immersive sound journey offers a deeply restorative experience that invites you to settle into stillness, reconnect with the heart, and explore a sense of inner spaciousness through vibration and tone.
Claudio skilfully layers the sounds of gongs, crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other traditional instruments, enhanced through high-quality audio equipment so the sound can be both heard and felt throughout your body.
Harmonic sound and vibration offer the nervous system a chance to truly rest. In this state of relaxation, the thinking mind softens, and we find connection to citta — the heart-mind. From this place, silence arises naturally through the vehicle of sound.
This experience is open to everyone. No previous yoga or meditation practice is needed.

What to bring:
You are welcome to bring your own yoga mat, though studio mats are also available. We will provide bolsters, blankets, and eye pillows for your comfort.

Booking is essential — spaces are limited and this event often fills quickly.

About Claudio
Claudio is a multi-instrumentalist musician originally from Mexico City and now based in Wellington. Born into a family of musicians, he began playing music at a young age and later studied classical guitar. His journey led him to Montreal, where he explored jazz, world music, and spiritual sound traditions.

Extensive travels in Asia and Europe deepened his connection with Indian music and yogic philosophy. He studied Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu and Varanasi, and has since worked with a wide range of instruments including the sitar, esraj, bansuri, harmonium, flutes, gongs, and voice.

Claudio’s work blends technical skill, deep presence, and a profound respect for the healing power of sound.

Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:
SoundCloud https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio

events.id: Porirua Parkrun-Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Porirua Parkrun
events.venue: Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

events.name: Christmas Community Garage Sale
events.venue: St Ninian's Uniting Church, 208 Karori Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Come along to our Christmas Community Garage Sale — a great morning out for the whole family! Browse through a wide range of quality second-hand items including household goods, books, toys, games, puzzles, CDs, and more. There’ll also be delicious home baking, a BBQ, and hot food and drinks available too.

You’ll also find stalls from local entrepreneurs and people raising funds for good causes — the perfect chance to support small ventures and community initiatives while picking up some Christmas bargains.

Buying second-hand is a simple, sustainable way to give new life to pre-loved items — good for the planet, good for the community, and good for your wallet. We’d love to see you there! BYO bags.

*Please note that the sale is CASH ONLY.

Location: St Ninian's Church, 208 Karori Road, Karori.

events.id: South Wairarapa Half Day Tour - Morning-Featherston Train Station, Harrison Street West, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: South Wairarapa Half Day Tour - Morning
events.venue: Featherston Train Station, Harrison Street West, Featherston
events.long_description:
Journey with us through the breathtaking landscapes of South Wairarapa, where every hill, river, and breeze carries a story. Our guided experience weaves together the rich history of the land, the life-giving waters, and discover the ancestral stories. Learn about the deep connections between people and environment. Our half day tours invites you to see, feel, and respect this region in a way that stays with you long after you leave.

This tour is a travelling tour. We pick you up from Featherston Train Station 10 minutes before the event starts and we will deliver you back to Featherston Train Station on finishing.

Please ensure you bring comfy shoes, warm clothes and sun protection. Water Bottles are encouraged and refreshments will be provided throughout the trip.

events.long_description:
ROLL UP, ROLL UP – THE EXTRAVAGANZA FAIR IS BACK!

Celebrating 11 epic years of magical mayhem on the road!

New Zealand’s biggest and most fabulous traveling fair is rolling back into town – and you’re invited!

We’re bringing grassroots charm, vintage flair, and old-school fun to town – a joyride for all ages! Whether you’re 5 or 95, there’s something here to make your heart happy.

FREE ENTRY for kids! Gold coin for adults – that’s it!

Get ready for a weekend packed full of FREE entertainment the whole whānau will love.

Expect a kaleidoscope of colour, creativity, and community vibes with:
*Unique market stalls, arts,crafts & more!
* Yummy street food galore
* Kids rides & games all day
* The fabulous Ashton Family Circus
* Burns the Dragon breathing fun
* Enchanting Mermaid Storytime
* Sparkling LuckyStar Zone (as seen at Splore!)
* Live music all day
* Tarot, past-life readings & mystical moments

Tiny homes, solar setups & sustainable inspiration
Retro lounges & shady chill zones = your new favourite hangout spot

See you there this summer 2025 - 2026!!

events.id: A Marvellous Miramar Christmas: 29 November (3 sessions)-63 Miramar Avenue, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: A Marvellous Miramar Christmas: 29 November (3 sessions)
events.venue: 63 Miramar Avenue, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We've designed a Christmas experience for the whole family!
Come along and get into the Christmas spirit by joining in a marvellous Miramar Christmas extravaganza! As a family, come along and enter our amazing, indoor, interactive Christmas festival!
Enjoy hands-on crafts and activities together, get into some fun games at your own pace, listen and singalong to live music, let the younger tamariki have their space in a free-play area, tuck into our delish loaded free hot chocolates and cookie bar, get your annual whanau photo in our dress up photobooth, hear Christmas stories, take time to remember someone special at the remembrance tree... and many more merry and marvellous festivities!
Timing note: This year's Christmas event is a 'go-at-your-own-pace' session and you are welcome to leave when needed. Sessions/festival conclude 90mins after the start time.
Market note: While this event is designed to feel like a Christmas market/fair or festival - all experiences and crafts while in your session have no additional cost/are included. The only fee is the initial ticket fee.

TICKET DETAILS:
A Marvellous Miramar Christmas is all about getting into the Christmas spirit - our hope is that we can support families in the Miramar community through this event!
Tickets are $3 per child or adult / $13 for a group of 5.
Please note: if you require more than 5 tickets, please add any additional individual or group tickets to make up your group total.
All proceeds from this event will go towards providing Christmas gifts and support for families in the Miramar community. Thank you for your support!
Simply book tickets for your prefered session using this website! Please reserve tickets for any adults AND kids attending.


SESSION TIMES:
There are three A Marvellous Miramar Christmas sessions over the weekend. Each session is up to 90mins.
Saturday 29 November: 9.30 - 11am
Saturday 29 November: 11am - 12.30pm
Saturday 29 November: 1.30pm - 3pm
Please note: All children under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult.

RESERVE YOUR TICKETS ONLINE TODAY!
 Any queries, contact us on Facebook or email miramar.corps@salvationarmy.org.nz or call 04 388 8284

events.name: K A T E Plays The Shed
events.venue: 46a Victoria St Alicetown,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
K A T E Plays The Shed
K A T E brings sultry soulful, ethereal blues.

Teamed up with some of Wellingtons greatest musicians, K A T E and her band have been known to bring an outerworldy experience to those who witness them live, leaving people feeling as though they are on a natural high.

Playing songs written by K A T E, that she truly believes she has channeled for the healing and expansion of not only her heart but all other hearts on this planet. Songs that deliver powerful messages and not only bring a presence to the room when played, but as the frequency of K A T E's voice radiates in and through the audience, people can't help but become engaged with their whole being.

A setlist of heartfelt music that you will also most definitely want to move your body to too.

Doors open 7pm for a 7.30pm start.

events.id: Stand-Up Comedy Christmas Party-Globe Theatre,318 Main St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: Stand-Up Comedy Christmas Party
events.venue: Globe Theatre,318 Main St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Stand-Up Comedy Christmas Party
Kick off the silly season early and laugh your Christmas stockings off!

Palmy’s wind getting you down? Stuck for a fun Christmas work party idea? Blow into The Globe, grab a drink at the bar, and let loose at the Comedy Christmas Work Do!

Hosted by Patch Lambert, an award-winning comedian who appears on ‘The Project’, is a 2017 Bill T Award nominee and writer for ‘7 Days’. Patch is a regular fixture throughout the country’s pro comedy circuit and has supported international acts including Ed Byrne and Josh Wolf.

Featuring Kajun Brooking - raised on the gang-infested streets of Hastings, Kajun moved to Whanganui in search of a better life. Now he’s slinging sharp punchlines and slick observations drawn from real-life grit and wit. Described as slippery, quick-witted, and punchy, Kajun’s mission is simple: make at least one person laugh. If he does, he can go home satisfied - and keep proving to his kids that Dad is actually funny.

Also featuring local favourites Chris Ingham, Elaine Reilly and Airguityler for a night that promises to be funnier than your last pay rise!

Tickets just $20, or $15 for groups of 6+!

events.name: Artisan Craft Market
events.venue: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Come support local at our monthly market in Lower Hutt City outside at the Dowse Square!

Come to the first event on Saturday 29 November, 10am-5pm, on Cuba Street between Ghuznee and Vivian Street.

Free bike parking and valet for those choosing to come by bike and prizes for active travel and PickPath users.
Support Local, Win Local.
