events.name: Are you my ancestor?
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for Verb's final event of the year, where we mark International Day of Disabled People with literary flair – and a nod to the past. (FREE! But Registration appreciated at the link provided).
Crip the Lit writers will share an eclectic line-up of snappy new poems and prose celebrating the rich world of disability ancestors. Expect a few slyly subversive takes paired with deep, and often hilarious, insights.
Crip the Lit advocate for d/Deaf and disabled writers having their unique voices, perspectives and stories included and valued in mainstream writing. They are the talent behind some of our most popular LitCrawl events (most recently, 'I'm disabled ... of course I'm a villain!').
Featuring: Bee Trudgeon, Lucy Croft, Erin Donohue, Elizabeth Heritage, Mike Gourley, Wendi Wicks, Al Gray, Henrietta Bollinger, Lee Ota-Calderwood, Alice Mander, Robyn Hunt, Trish Harris, and Helen Vivienne Fletcher (MC).
Be part of this special occasion where we not only close out Verb's year, but also raise a toast to these exceptional artists.
This event is free to attend and includes tea & coffee. You can turn up on the day, or register to secure your spot. This event is NZSL interpreted.

events.id: Freedom and Responsibility in Science - WELLINGTON-11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Freedom and Responsibility in Science - WELLINGTON
events.venue: 11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join the Royal Society Te Apārangi for a wide-ranging panel discussion about the many threats to the integrity of science around the world, how they can be addressed, and New Zealand’s place in the global context. The panel will feature expert guest speakers from the International Science Council’s (ISC) Committee for Freedom and Responsibility in Science.
Science today faces many challenges: Scientific and academic freedoms are declining worldwide as anti-science ideology becomes imbedded in many of the world’s governments; state obligations towards enabling science as a human right remain chronically ignored; irresponsible scientific conduct and governance of all kinds increasingly undermine science from within; and the tally of wars and crises which rob the world of the scientific talent held by entire nations is growing year by year.
At precisely the moment when scientific progress on some of the existential threats to humanity is most urgent, science itself is under more pressure than perhaps ever before. So, what can we do?
About the ISC Committee for Freedom and Responsibility in Science:
The Committee monitors trends related to scientific and academic freedom globally, advises the ISC on official statements and positions, and advocates for the Principles of Freedom and Responsibility in Science. The Committee also engages in major projects at the intersection of science, human rights, and philosophy, such as the ISC’s recent interpretation of The Right to Participate in and Benefit from Science.
Event details:
5:40pm - Doors open
6:00pm - Panel discussion
7:15pm - Networking with drinks and canapés till 8:15pm

events.id: HUT KEEPERS-205 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: HUT KEEPERS
events.venue: 205 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
DUE TO PUBLIC DEMAND
An extra screening on Wednesday, 3 December at 6:00 p.m.
A grassroots legacy for New Zealand's remote huts.
Amid decades of underfunding and bureaucratic gridlock, the future of New Zealand’s remote backcountry huts and tracks hangs in the balance. Frustrated by inaction, Andrew Buglass sets out to make a difference - hoping to spark a movement.
“We were hoping that it would become a movement, a shift in consciousness.” Hut Keepers is a story about doing what’s right - even when no one’s watching.
All ticket proceeds will go to the Backcountry Trust to fund work in the Tararua Forest Park.

events.id: Draw It Out - Fertility NZ national online workshop-Online - link provided on booking-Humanitix
events.name: Draw It Out - Fertility NZ national online workshop
events.venue: Online - link provided on booking
events.long_description:
A bespoke Draw It Out workshop for Fertility NZ, open to all genders.
Tickets: $34.50pp
Theme: Strengthen self-care for the holiday season
Strengthen your inner resources to care for yourself over the holiday season, and meet others going through similar experiences through this online national workshop, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.

FertilityNZ exists to support New Zealanders experiencing fertility problems, whether facing challenges becoming or staying pregnant. This bespoke workshop shares drawing for wellness, to tap into your inner guidance for support, within a safe space where others may be experiencing similar journeys.
Included in your workshop
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
What you will need
As this is an online workshop, you will need a computer in a comfortable, quiet setting. A hard surface to draw on (like a desk or a board), three to five pages of A3 paper (you can also tape two A4 printing papers together), and any colouring tools of your choice. Crayons are great as they are more child-like so you don't worry about how it looks. Coloured pastels or pencils are also good, or any coloured markers. The key is a range of colours.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz.
Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.name: Miro Holland's 'Theo Thompson, welcome home' suite
events.venue: Garibaldi Club, 118 Tory St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Undercurrent presents... Miro Holland's 'Theo Thompson, welcome home' suite
Musicians:
Miro Holland - Trumpet
Theo Thompson - Guitar
Evie Patterson - Bass
Ateo Buhne - Drums
Isaac Randel - Saxophones
Top cats, and friends, invite you on a spiritual release. A new sound!
Welcome home Theo Thompson, back from the jazz clubs of Europe with us! After an acclaimed Jazz festival performance with his troupe minus one, Miro returns with an all original concept to the Undercurrent... Plus one!
This group have been playing together, in one form or another, for seven years- burgeoning out of the wallow and lulls of Wellington, the highs too- having shaped an entirely unique sound. Changing the rhythms and rhyme of the swing to whatever tendency is inherently antipodean.
Miro has written a new suite of music designed to amplify each of his friend's unique timbre, and make clear the joy of their collective sound. Be there!
Wednesday 3rd December
Doors 6:30pm/ Gig 7pm
$15
Tickets available online and on the door!

events.id: Wellington - Information Lecture: A Path to a Healthy Body & Soul-7 Moncrieff Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington - Information Lecture: A Path to a Healthy Body & Soul
events.venue: 7 Moncrieff Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BvGE7HCJEtw&t=4s Help and Healing on the Spiritual Path through the teaching of Bruno Groening - Medically Verifiable.
Bruno Groening (1906-1959) brought a simple message: there is a higher power that is the basis of all living things and it can heal.
He showed how this energy can be absorbed freely into the body, and through his teaching many people were cured back then as today, even from diseases that are considered incurable.
These success reports have been proven and documented within the Medical Scientific Group – a world-wide forum of independent medical doctors, psychologists and health care professionals within the Bruno Groening Circle of Friends.
Our Information Lecture is open to all interested people.

events.id: 5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model-41 Percy Cameron Street-All Events In
events.name: 5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model
events.venue: 41 Percy Cameron Street
events.long_description:
5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model
The immediacy of the model’s presence encourages close observation and instinctive decision-making leading to work that is expressive and real. This hands-on interaction brings a sense of movement and authenticity that’s hard to achieve otherwise.

The sculpting process typically starts by analyzing the model’s proportions and pose. A wire armature is built to support the structure and clay is gradually applied to develop the form to a one-third life size 750mm tall figure. From there the artist refines the shapes focusing on anatomical accuracy and expressive detail that give the sculpture its final character.

With nearly 30 years of experience in traditional sculpture and the film industry Javier is not just a sculptor — he’s a mentor. Trained in classical techniques he studied fine arts and took anatomy courses at medical school developing a rare combination of artistic and anatomical knowledge. He spent over five years at the world-renowned Weta Workshop contributing to major films and exhibitions and has worked across materials scales and digital technologies.

Material is included in the price.
Armature is supplied during the workshop.
You can buy our tools during the workshop if you like.
Tea

Also check out other Workshops in Lower Hutt, Arts events in Lower Hutt, Fine Arts events in Lower Hutt.

events.id: Come Together — Kiwi vs Oz Rock Big End of Year Bash 2025-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Come Together — Kiwi vs Oz Rock Big End of Year Bash 2025
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
For decades, New Zealand and Australia have sung along to each other’s songs. We’ve traded bands and tunes across the Tasman. The team of famous Kiwi musicians at Come Together are now putting it all to the test. Kiwi vs Oz Rock Big End of Year Bash 2025 packs the biggest hits from both sides of the ditch onto one stage. Some of New Zealand’s most iconic rock musicians will tear through these legendary antipodean tracks in an all-out rock fest. You can decide who truly owns rock. Is it the swagger of Aussie pub rock or the grit and heart of Kiwi anthems? Perhaps it’s both. 
Get ready to hear the biggest tunes from AC/DC, Split Enz, Cold Chisel, The Datsuns, INXS, DD Smash, Silverchair, Australian Crawl, and Hello Sailor. That’s just for starters, so the showdown is set to be epic. Here’s the kicker — you help shape the setlist, and when the amps power down, you vote for which nation takes home the crown. 
This is more than a concert — it’s a massive celebration of the music we grew up to, the songs that built us, and the riffs that still get us moving. Grab your mates, grab your tickets, and get ready to make some noise.

Every three years, our school transforms into a buzzing hub of excitement to raise funds and celebrate the heart of our vibrant community. This year, we’re going bigger, brighter, and more fun-filled than ever before!

Fun for all ages – bounce high on giant inflatables, race on Little Driver ride-on cars, battle it out in Nerf wars, and so much more!

Tasty treats – savour a tempting range of delights from food trucks and refreshment stalls.

Santa’s grotto – share your Christmas wish list with Santa himself!

A huge thank you to our Diamond Sponsor, Kylie Wilson – Ray White, for helping make this unforgettable night possible.

events.long_description:
Open Mic night @ G16 Upper Hutt
📣 Come along to a brand new open mic night at Garage 16 media in Upper Hutt.

Bring your originals, covers, instruments, voice, even your poems!

This is an opportunity to try something new, collaborate or refine what you’re already working on.

Grand piano, drums, keyboard, guitars and microphones are available to use.

Doors open from 5pm and Open mics begins at 6pm.

Bring yourself, friends and family, it will be warm and cosy inside 🔥

ABOUT G16
G16 (Garage Media 16) is Upper Hutt’s newest performing arts centre for musicians, creatives and artists. Aaron (owner) has opened this space for current and emerging artists to come along, perform, jam and connect.

Performance slots are 15 minutes long.
To book your slot visit the booking page here: https://dth.kiwi/dthopenmic.html

*Open mic slots are an open, friendly and supportive space to practice, experiments and gain experience and feedback through a fun and low pressure environment. These nights are for musicians of any age and ability 🎶

Twenty years. One obsession: brew bold, unforgettable beer. Epic is hitting the road to celebrate two decades of shaping New Zealand craft beer—and we’re bringing the tour to Queenstown, Christchurch, Wellington, Tauranga, and Auckland.

events.id: Westpac Smarts: Local innovation to global ambitions-Westpac Building,Level 10, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Westpac Smarts: Local innovation to global ambitions
events.venue: Westpac Building,Level 10, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Westpac Smarts: Local innovation to global ambitions
Westpac Smarts: Local innovation to global ambitions with the Village Goldsmith

About this Event

Join Westpac and the Wellington Chamber of Commerce for the final Westpac Smarts session of the year, featuring a local innovation story that is reshaping a global industry and offering real-world insights for local businesses with global ambitions.

Christine Douglas and Chris Benham from The Village Goldsmith will share the journey behind Floeting®, a world-first diamond setting technology developed in Wellington that’s a step away from traditional claws and clasps, allowing the diamond to appear to float.

Hear how this bold idea evolved into an inspiring story of global innovation, forged a landmark partnership with Tiffany & Co., and scaled to more than 50 countries - all while keeping design and IP anchored in Wellington.

Floeting® has captured the attention of the world’s luxury sector, with the Financial Times calling it “gravity defying” and Vogue France saying the diamond appears “freed from all metal, shining as if suspended above the jewel.” Their achievements have been recognised nationally, with Chris Benham named the winner of the EY Entrepreneur Of The Year™ 2025 New Zealand Product Category, alongside The Village Goldsmith receiving top honours at the NZ Hi-Tech Awards.

This is a relaxed, inspiring session for business leaders to sit back, connect, and reflect on how bold ideas backed by smart strategy can transform established industries.

Event details:
12:00pm - Networking
12:15pm – Presentation
1:15pm – Wrap-up

Chamber members and Westpac customers: Free entry
Non-members: $5.00 donated to Life Flight Trust through the Westpac Chopper Appeal

events.id: A Place of Firsts-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: A Place of Firsts
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Globally, citizens assemblies are widely used as an effective way to involve local people in deciding how to address complex issues such as climate change. Despite the repeated failure of standard policy processes, citizens assemblies have only recently made it to New Zealand. Register for this event to find out more about the Porirua Assembly on Climate and its innovations. 
Porirua is known for community-led innovations in governance and delivery, and the Porirua Assembly on Climate continued this tradition by being:
the first climate assembly in New Zealand,  
the first assembly co-designed and organised by an iwi authority and a community group, 
the first assembly process designed to honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi by using a tricameral design,  
the first New Zealand assembly to include children and young people, and 
by creating a new local governance body - the Porirua Community Leaders Forum - that sponsored the Assembly, holds its recommendations and can instigate ongoing community dialogue on local issues. 
Panellists will share learning on the Porirua Assembly’s innovations, talk about why the standard citizens assembly model was modified, dig into what enabled so many firsts and how these worked out in practice. They will reflect on this legacy and possible future impacts. Might these democratic innovations strengthen local democracy elsewhere in Aotearoa New Zealand? 
About the Host and Speakers
Jodi Watene is a Systems Change Lead at Te Rūnanga o Toa Rangatira Incorporated, was the project manager for the Porirua Assembly and is helping to establish a New Zealand Community of Practice on Indigenous Citizens’ Assemblies.
Makerita Makapelu is a Team Leader for Wesley Community Action in Porirua with a background in performing arts and youth work. She specialises in community-led development and grassroots systems change, and was one of the Porirua Assembly facilitators.  
Cally O'Neill was a participatory designer of community spaces until 2019 when she shifted her focus towards advocating for Te Tiriti-based deliberative democracy to address the climate and other contemporary crises. She is a founding member of Te Reo O Ngā Tāngata/The People Speak and was one of the Porirua Assembly facilitators. 
Future Unity, a youth climate group formed during the Assembly process will be represented by Orini Rokx-Taratu and Santino Morehu, who were participants in the Assembly’s youth and community streams.  
Emily Beausoleil is an Associate Professor at Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington. Her research as a political theorist centres on the dynamics, conditions and challenges of democratic engagement in diverse societies. She is conducting an independent evaluation of the Porirua Assembly process.

events.name: Young Enterprise Scheme National Awards 2025
events.venue: 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Celebrate the amazing achievements of young entrepreneurs from across New Zealand. Hear from the next generation of business stars, and find out which teams will take home a share of over $20,000 in prize money and tertiary scholarships.
The Lion Foundation Young Enterprise Scheme National Awards evening is a showcase and celebration of the entrepreneurial successes of our students, bringing together the top YES companies from across New Zealand.
Join us at the awards dinner as we hear from the next generation of business leaders, changemakers and disruptors, where we’ll find out who will take home a share of more than $20,000 in prize money and tertiary scholarships and who will be named YES Company of the Year.
Pre-dinner drinks and product display from 5:45pm with the evening events commencing at 6:30pm.
The evening will include a 3-course menu and complimentary mocktail on arrival. A cash bar will be available throughout the night.
Dress code: Business/cocktail
If you would like to cover the cost of one of our fabulous YES students attending this year awards, we have included a Gift-a-Ticket option in our ticket section. 

Tickets can be purchased by credit card or by invoice at checkout

Any other queries can be directed to support@youngenterprise.org.nz

events.id: F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #10-15 Mercer St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #10
events.venue: 15 Mercer St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Sign up here: https://luma.com/ftstwellington10
F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington!

WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?
FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!
Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!

HOW TO JOIN?
Take 2 minutes to fill out our form

https://luma.com/ftstwellington10
Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma

HOW MUCH IS IT?
The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:
3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
Also includes those pesky ticket fees!

WHERE IS IT?
We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.

WHAT THEY SAY
“Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias

“This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya

“F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika

“I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda

"it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara

“Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz

Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7

FAQ
• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.

• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings

• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences.
This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us

• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!

• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.

• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form
--

𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙.
* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit
)

This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket

We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver.

--
Stay in touch
Website: https://www.epicllama.com/fuckthesmalltalk
Instagram: www.instagram.com/epic.llama/
Join the club (newsletter): epicllama.myflodesk.com/wellington

events.id: KinoFest goes Wellington - Cologne 75-Massey University Theatrette, Block 10 (Old Museum Building), Buckle Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: KinoFest goes Wellington - Cologne 75
events.venue: Massey University Theatrette, Block 10 (Old Museum Building), Buckle Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
KinoFest goes Wellington!
After a successful run in Auckland, the Goethe-Institut New Zealand is bringing KinoFest to Wellington with two special film screenings.

On 4 December 2025, we present Cologne '75 — the remarkable story of Vera Brandes, the 17-year-old concert promoter behind one of the most legendary jazz recordings of all time: Keith Jarrett’s Köln Concert. This captivating documentary dives into the chaos, charm, and cultural impact of a night that changed music history.

The screening begins at 6:45 PM, but we invite you to join us from 6:00 PM for snacks and drinks in the foyer.

Cologne 75: Family, 2025, 110 minutes
German with English subtitles
Age rating: Recommended for ages 16 and up

events.id: Terra Soma Yoga-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Terra Soma Yoga
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
You are welcomed to a gentle, invitational yoga experience.

Terra-soma yoga (translating to earth-body) weaves together hatha yoga, somatic inquiry, and nature connection, inviting you into awareness of your inner terrain. This approach encourages you to meet yourself as you are — to listen to the intelligence of your body's own rhythms and sense how they echo the wider rhythms of the earth. Through this listening, we enter a living, evolving conversation about well-being and what it can look like in today’s world.

How is your heart? We often hear “follow your heart” or “listen to your heart,” but what does that actually mean? In this class, you’ll be invited into heart somatic enquiry - locating this intelligent organ, listening into this space, and perhaps allowing it to lead, inform, or express through movement.

The structure of this hour-long class includes:

A gentle lead-in towards the heart

A mixture of supine, seated, and standing asana

Repeated sequences with encouragement to make them your own — add or subtract asana, move in your own time, with your own breath

Optional free movement explorations

This is an invitational practice — everything is a choice, not a must. Tailor the practice to suit yourself. Come as you are; everyone and all of you is welcome.

Your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, making this an evening of movement, heartful awareness, and wholesome connection.

Meet Abbie, your facilitator,
Abbie is a 200-hour certified yoga teacher who trained with Awakening Arts: School of Yoga and Eco Somatic. She deeply values the insight, liberation, inner and collective resources somatic movement practices can offer. Abbie has also completed a 50-hour training exploring how yoga can support trauma awareness, mental health, and body image. She thrives in and intends to create spaces where each person’s pace is honored and the body’s innate wisdom is encouraged to emerge and lead.

events.description:
Terra-soma yoga (translating to earth-body) weaves together hatha yoga, somatic inquiry, and nature connection, inviting you into awareness of your inner terrain.
This approach encourages you to meet yourself as you are — to listen to the intelligence of your body's own rhythms and sense how they echo the wider rhythms of the earth.
How is your heart?
Come as you are; everyone and all of you is welcome.
Your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, making this an evening of movement, heartful awareness, and wholesome connection.

events.id: The Power of Awareness: the Energies That Shape Us-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Power of Awareness: the Energies That Shape Us
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
You've probably noticed that there are particular patterns and energies that we meet over and over again in our life until we finally understand that we need to make some internal shifts in order to change our external reality.

We may continuously run into the same situations being frustrated with what happens to us - not noticing that we're actually meant to learn something and change our own doings.

In this seminar we will uncover some energetic principles that govern human beings and discuss psychological and energetic tools which we can practically apply in our lives - to change our internal and external reality to live a little happier and fulfilled lives.

Your ticket includes an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert too

Meet Gopi, your host

Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity and overcome challenges on their path through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.

events.id: Conservation Kōrero: Under The Mistletoe-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Conservation Kōrero: Under The Mistletoe
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us this December for a kōrero exploring the complex lives of native mistletoes in Aotearoa.

Leading mistletoe expert and hands-on conservation practitioner, Trevor Thompson, will share insights into the ecology of these beautiful yet elusive plants, how he is propagating them, and the challenges they face across our landscapes.

From habitat loss to seed dispersal and browsing impacts, learn what is threatening the survival of these special plants and what’s being done to protect them. Come along to deepen your understanding, ask questions, and discover how we can help ensure these special species remain part of our ngahere for generations to come.

This event will be held in the Pāteke Room in the Visitor Centre with light refreshments provided. Doors open at 6.15pm, parking is available at both our Visitor Centre and overflow parking area on Birdwood Street.

events.id: Gordon H Brown Lecture: Dr Maia Nuku-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gordon H Brown Lecture: Dr Maia Nuku
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us to hear Dr Maia Nuku (Ngāi Tai) deliver the annual Gordon H Brown Lecture, hosted in collaboration with Victoria University and the Adam Art Gallery. Nuku is the Evelyn A. J. Hall and John A. Friede Curator for Oceanic Art at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City.
What is the role and relevancy of museums in the 21st century? Are they living, expansive archives of Indigenous knowledge? Or outdated relics of colonial pasts.
The complete overhaul and construction of new galleries for the Arts of Oceania at The Metropolitan Museum in New York gave curator Maia Nuku a unique opportunity to reframe the galleries conceptually; to emphasize connectivity in the context of global and local histories; and elevate the equally critical arts of storytelling, oratory, and performance alongside Oceania’s dynamic visual arts. Curator Maia Nuku shares insights into the 10-year project that has culminated in a suite of galleries that offer international visitors perspectives on art that reach deep into Oceania’s past while also acknowledging ongoing manifestations of its agency in the present.
Born in London of English and Māori (Ngai Tai) descent, Dr. Maia Nuku is Curator for the Arts of Oceania at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. She completed two post-doctoral fellowships at the University of Cambridge (2008-2014) as part of an international research team exploring Oceanic art collections in European museums in France, Spain, the Netherlands and Russia. Researching the collections alongside Pacific artists and practitioners, the work was collaborative and sought to create access to these collections both in the physical and digital domains. During her time at the Met, Maia has evolved a curatorial approach that centers indigenous Pacific perspectives, grounding the presentation of visual arts in the unique conceptual and cosmological connections that make art from Oceania so compelling. In 2023, her exhibition The Shape of Time: Art and Ancestors of Oceania travelled to Museum of Art in Pudong, Shanghai (June 1 - Aug 20, 2023) and National Museum of Qatar (Oct 23, 2023 - Jan 15, 2024).  For the past eight years, Maia has overseen a major reinstallation of the Oceania galleries at the Metropolitan Museum which showcases the creativity of indigenous Pacific artists from the 18th century to the present through the compelling lenses of global history, indigenous storytelling, and Pacific oratory and performance.

events.id: Jamie Pye Quintet (UK/NZ)-G20 Apartments, 20 Garrett St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Jamie Pye Quintet (UK/NZ)
events.venue: G20 Apartments, 20 Garrett St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Jamie Pye is a London-based jazz guitarist and composer with roots in both Australia and New Zealand. He performs in various line ups and contexts; from intimate duo residencies, to headline performances as a bandleader showcasing his original music. He is often part of house bands for jam sessions around town, or as a sideman on other projects.
In 2023, Jamie completed a 10-date national tour around Aotearoa, including appearances at the Creative Jazz Club in Auckland and Hanover Hall in Dunedin. In between shows, Jamie recorded his debut album ‘Monochrome’, released in November 2024 on Good Twin Records.
As a composer, Jamie draws influence from all music and art forms, paying particular attention to the work of composers and bandleaders Brian Blade, Kendrick Scott, Petros Klampanis and Aaron Parks. Jamie composes music with the intention of honest storytelling and narrative;
creating compositions that are as complex as they are harmonically-rich, while still remaining musically accessible to all ears.
“Guitarist Jamie Pye is establishing himself as a new and dynamic artist coming out of the New Zealand contemporary jazz scene. Displaying a strong compositional voice, he's delivered an exciting debut album and I'm looking forward to seeing his artistry progress into the future”.
-Myele Manzana, Artist, Drummer, Composer
For this Pōneke show, Jamie will be joined by Louisa WIlliamson (Tenor Saxophone), Ayrton Foote (Piano), Seth Boy (Bass) & Hikurangi Schaverien-Kaa (drums)

Honey… All I want for Christmas is YOU at DRAG BINGO!
This is not your nana’s holiday party, this is Christmas Drag Bingo! Served piping hot by Wellington’s very own rooftop angel's, Selina Simone (ya dad's favourite sinner and showgirl) & Olivia Dreams (takatāpui titan and Drag Race Down Under Season Four legend). Expect festive glamour, diva attitude, and Christmas chaos to make you scream 'Ho Ho Ho!'
Join us at Dirty Little Secret, Wellington’s most iconic rooftop hideaway, for a night filled with incredible prizes, cheeky jokes, gorgeous queens, and XXXmas magic.

Bingo balls drop at 7.30 pm sharp

Live drag performances that sleigh the season
Jokes, some your dad would like
DJs spinning holiday anthems

Bring your workmates, your favorite gals, or your festive chaos crew (Bring your boss and we will bully them for you xx) Table bookings for 7.00 pm are essential to secure your spot.

4th December, Selina Simone

18th December, Selina Simone
Dirty Little Secret offers breathtaking rooftop views that make the night feel truly magical and the party don't stop! DJs spin from around 9.00 to 9.30 pm until late (Better WFH Friday xx)

Proudly LGBTQIA plus friendly with a safe, welcoming vibe for everyone.

events.id: Capital Blues Presents: King Oyster-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Capital Blues Presents: King Oyster
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This is one of THE best bands in Wellington.
Driving grooves, classy funk, outstanding musicians. That’s what you get from King Oyster.
The band is Oscar Laven on sax, Blain Fitzpatick on bass, Matthew Fitpatrick on guitar, and Jacob Randall on drums. One look at those names, and you know you are in for some remarkable playing.
A surrealist funk/fusion outfit blending shreddy guitar, sax, bass, and drums into a kaleidoscope of grooves. Their music spins between aggressive funk, jazz fusion, and playful originals, drawing influence from Jaco Pastorius, John Scofield, Primus, Billy Cobham, and George Benson.
This is the first time that King Oyster has played for Capital Blues so come and see why we were so keen to get them.

events.id: Dancing & Drinking Society-Garibaldi Club, 118 Tory St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Dancing & Drinking Society
events.venue: Garibaldi Club, 118 Tory St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
DADS return to The Undercurrent!
The Dancing & Drinking Society (or DADS for short), is New Zealand’s premier exponent of authentic 1920s dance Jazz with Rags, Rambles, Shuffles, Drags and Blues from the juke joints, speakeasies, woolsheds and Memorial Halls of 1920s New Zealand.
DADS have been bringing their swing blues sounds to dance floors and craft beer bars across the capital since late 1913. When they take to the stage, guitar, horns, vocals, and kick drum blend as The Society present their favourite old rarities with exactly the sort of vigour you want for some stress relieving dance times. They’ve cultivated a decent reputation for generous and open-hearted live performance.
If you feel like a decent drink and a leg shake or two, this would make for a pretty good option.
With Adrian Jensen, Daniel Yeabsley, Blair Latham, and now Michael Costello!
See: ⁦https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rlWe4fbd-O4⁩
Thursday 4th December
Doors 7pm/ Gig 7:30pm
$20
Tickets available online and on the door
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/.../Dancing-And-Drinking...

events.long_description:
Thursday Laughs brings some of the best comedy talent NZ has to offer to the Wellington's coziest comedy bar, the Cavern Club

With Rhys Mathewson
Rhys Mathewson is a stand up comedian and reporter who has won pretty much every award New Zealand comedy has to offer. He currently serves as the roving reporter on Seven Sharp. Rhys has performed all over the world, including a packed out Spark Arena supporting Jack Whitehall.
Winner 2024 Directors Award at the NZ International Comedy Festavil
Winner 2016 Fred Dagg Award for best show at the NZ International Comedy Festival
Winner 2010 Billy T James Award
“One of New Zealand’s best comedians’” – stuff
“world class joke writing” – the speakeasy

And Brendon Green
Brendon Green brings a warm and friendly energy to every room he's in.

Combining hilarious jokes, world class storytelling, and an authentic emotional honesty, he is a treat for every kind of comedy fan. A great MC and a favourite feature act, he has honed his comedy skills on stages all over the world.

2023 Fred Award Nominee
2018 Best Storytelling Show Winner
2014 Billy T Award Nominee
Writer for 7 Days, Taskmaster NZ, Have You Been Paying Attention, Paddy Gower Has Issues, and many more.

"one of the strongest story-telling comics in New Zealand" - Ruminator
"He uses words and wordplay skilfully… and has a sweet wit about him" Stuff.co.nz

More acts to be announced!

Brought to you with support from Pub Charities Ltd

events.id: Come Together - End of Year Big Bash-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Come Together - End of Year Big Bash
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
One stage. Two nations. One unforgettable night of rock.

This December, the Come Together Big Bash 2025 will ignite New Zealand stages with the ultimate Kiwi vs Oz rock showdown. For one massive night in each city, a supergroup of Aotearoa’s best rock musicians will unleash the biggest hits from both sides of the Tasman in an all-out end-of-year rock fest.

Expect wall-to-wall anthems from AC/DC, Split Enz, Cold Chisel, DD Smash, INXS, Silverchair, Hello Sailor and more – the songs that have defined generations, blasted stereos, and packed stadiums.
Joining forces for this epic battle are:

- Jennie Skulander (Devilskin)
- Milan Borich (PLUTO)
- EJ Barnes (Jimmy Barnes)
- Seamus Johnson (Seamouse)
…plus more to be announced.

They’ll be backed by the powerhouse Come Together Band: musical director Jol Mulholland, alongside Brett Adams, Matthias Jordan, Mike Hall, and Alistair Deverick.

For decades, Kiwis and Aussies have traded bands, stages, and stadium tours. Now, it’s time to settle the score the only way that matters — with a night of unrelenting, unapologetic rock.

And the audience isn’t just along for the ride — you’re part of the action. Fans can help shape the setlist by voting for the songs they want to hear in the Kiwi vs Oz showdown.

Head to www.libertystage.com/ct25poll to cast your vote before October 10th.

This is the ultimate end-of-year blowout — a chance to scream, sweat, and celebrate with some of New Zealand’s greatest musicians performing the biggest rock hits of all time.

So, who truly owns rock?

Is it the swagger of Aussie pub rock, or the grit and heart of Kiwi anthems? You decide.

The Come Together Big Bash 2025 caps off an epic year for the juggernaut series, which has already seen thousands of fans pack venues for Neil Young’s Live Rust, Pink Floyd’s Dark Side of the Moon and, next month, the hotly anticipated Led Zep II.

Born five years ago in the isolation of a world turned upside down, Come Together began as a bold celebration of legendary rock albums. It has since grown into one of New Zealand’s most electrifying live concert experiences. With a powerhouse collective of the country’s finest musicians, the series has drawn more than 50,000 fans nationwide and earned critical acclaim, cementing its place as a must-see on the music calendar.

events.id: Draw It Out - Parents of neurodivergent children block course-level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Draw It Out - Parents of neurodivergent children block course
events.venue: level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A unique space to support those who are supporting others.

Theme: For parents of neurodivergent children
Care for yourself so you can care for others, by processing emotions using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
Parenting can often feel isolating yet many are going through similar journeys. This 4-session block course is a safe space for parents of neurodivergent children to draw out their feelings, draw out their inner guidance, and draw on each other.

Dates
This block course consists of 4 workshops:
6.30pm-8.00pm
Thursday 13 November – Re-finding yourself
Thursday 20 November – Caring for your needs
Thursday 27 November - Self-compassion
Thursday 4 December – Seeing potential

Cost
$184 total ($46 per session)

Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz.

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.id: BOOK FESTIVAL: Songs of Solidarity-115 Taranaki Street, New Zealand 6011,115 Taranaki St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: BOOK FESTIVAL: Songs of Solidarity
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, New Zealand 6011,115 Taranaki St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
BOOK FESTIVAL: Songs of Solidarity
📅 DAY 1 — Friday, December 5 (Evening)

• Formal opening
• An evening on Palestinian resistance and solidarity, with Justice 4 Palestine, Falastin Tea Collective and many more, with speeches, poetry readings, kai, and music from Nam Chucks, Amira and Welmie

📅 DAY 2 — Saturday, December 6 (11am–12pm)

• Panel discussion: Solidarity with uprisings in the Global South, chaired by Richa Sharma and joined by 4 panellists
• Journaling workshop with Nadine Hura
• Collective bamboo wind chime making workshop with visual artist Jieying Cai, with support from Asian Arts Aotearoa
• Book Launch: "Our Climate Glossary" from Borneo to Aotearoa New Zealand
• An evening of poetry and other words, MCed by Nadia Solomon, featuring Khadro Mohamed, Cam McCausland-Taylor, Ahinata Kaitai-Mullane, Tarns Hood, Joshua Toumu’a and others

📅 DAY 3 — Sunday, December 7 (10am–5pm)

• Kai and Kupu from India, Nepal and Gaza — a screening of writers from Nepal, India and Gaza reading their work
• Children's reading event with Ar-Em Bañas
• Matike Mai — Constitutional transformation wānanga

💸 HOW BOOKS ARE PRICED

The bookstore will operate on a transparent ‘pay-what-you-can’ model to ensure accessibility as well as the sustainability of the project.

events.long_description:
🎶 Concert, Wine & Food Pairing and Fundraiser @ Urlar 🎶
🎶 The Songbirds at Urlar Winery 🎶

Join us at Urlar Winery, Gladstone, for a fantastic evening of music, wine, and food in the majestic barrel room!

✨ Songs
Enjoy a mix of festive favourites, contemporary waiata, and popular choral arrangements performed by The Songbirds.

🍷 Evening Details
Please arrive at 6:00 p.m. to enjoy your first wine and food pairing before the concert begins at 6:30 p.m.
Parking is limited — please ride share if possible.

🎟️ Tickets
$55 per person
Available via or from any Songbirds member. Tickets are limited to 80pax. Price includes 4 sample wine and food pairings.
Last year’s concert sold out — book early to avoid missing out!

💖 Supporting a Great Cause
All proceeds will go to the Ruel Foundation NZ, which funds cleft palate operations for orphaned children in the Philippines — a cause close to our hearts.

🎁 Extras
Bring cash for the fundraising raffle! Urlar will also be offering special wine case deals.

⚠️ R18 event – due to liquor license rules.

Don’t miss this lovely evening of music, food, and wine at Urlar Winery! 🌟

Douce Ambiance - Blenheim
The versatile and popular Douce Ambiance quartet comprising of Cathy Irons (violin), Dan Roberston (keyboard), Dougal Canard (guitar, double bass) and Doug Brush (drums) are all set to delight audiences again.

Well-known for the energy and creative musicianship they bring to the stage, this talented ensemble of top Christchurch musicians brings an exciting programme of rustic medieval dances, sublime classical music, light jazz, Irish, tango with a little Hendrix and a healthy splash of fiery Gypsy thrown in.

A breath-taking concert that captivates from start to finish.

“A brilliant gifted ensemble...truly inspiring!”

Tickets: $10-$25 online

Door sales available (if not sold prior) $15-$30
Limited seats

events.id: Slinky Physics Workshop - Wellington-249 Taranaki Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Slinky Physics Workshop - Wellington
events.venue: 249 Taranaki Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This one-day workshop experimentally investigates the physics of the slinky spring using past IYPT problems.
It is for both students and teachers, attending as a school group or individually.  
The workshop will reinforce the waves, mechanics and practical achievement standards of NCEA and their equivalent across other examinations. It will be especially useful for
Current year 12 students who plan to participate in the 2026 NZ Tournament or try for the NZ Representative team going to Zurich in July
Teachers new to the New Zealand Young Physicists' Tournament who want to support students through the Tournament in 2026
This is a full day workshop, between 9am and 4pm. We are providing lunch and refreshments in the breaks, plus a goodie bag for every student. We will also have workbooks for all participants including a teacher's version. 
You should bring a water bottle and your phone to film some of your experiments, sometimes in slow motion. A laptop may also be useful for sides to present your work, but it is not essential as whiteboards are available. All experimental equipment will be provided.
The cost is $135 for a school group of up to four people, or $40 for individual teachers and students. Both prices are inclusive of GST.

events.id: SOLD OUT SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt-The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: SOLD OUT SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
events.venue: The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
SOLD OUT SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
The original 28 November show is now SOLD OUT.

DON'T MISS OUT ON THE SECOND AND FINAL WELLINGTON REGION SHOW IN '25!

Tickets on sale NOW! Don't miss out...

This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.

Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterised by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.

With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.

Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.

Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.
events.description:
SOLD OUT SECOND SHOW!
Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt The original 28 November show is now SOLD OUT.
Tickets on sale NOW!
Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry.
Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop.

It was the 20th night before christmas, and all through the house, not a creature was stirring...except for 10 crazy comedians going BE-OW BE-OW BE-OW! It's AIRHORN! For Christmas!

Come together for some early yuletide cheer as good as, if not better, than yr office holiday party!

events.id: Friday Laughs with Rhys Mathewson and Brendon Green-The Fringe Bar,30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Friday Laughs with Rhys Mathewson and Brendon Green
events.venue: The Fringe Bar,30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Friday Laughs with Rhys Mathewson and Brendon Green
Friday Laughs brings some of the best comedy talent NZ has to offer to the Fringe Bar

With Rhys Mathewson
Rhys Mathewson is a stand up comedian and reporter who has won pretty much every award New Zealand comedy has to offer. He currently serves as the roving reporter on Seven Sharp. Rhys has performed all over the world, including a packed out Spark Arena supporting Jack Whitehall.
Winner 2024 Directors Award at the NZ International Comedy Festavil
Winner 2016 Fred Dagg Award for best show at the NZ International Comedy Festival
Winner 2010 Billy T James Award
“One of New Zealand’s best comedians’” – stuff
“world class joke writing” – the speakeasy

And Brendon Green
Brendon Green brings a warm and friendly energy to every room he's in.

Combining hilarious jokes, world class storytelling, and an authentic emotional honesty, he is a treat for every kind of comedy fan. A great MC and a favourite feature act, he has honed his comedy skills on stages all over the world.

2023 Fred Award Nominee
2018 Best Storytelling Show Winner
2014 Billy T Award Nominee
Writer for 7 Days, Taskmaster NZ, Have You Been Paying Attention, Paddy Gower Has Issues, and many more.

"one of the strongest story-telling comics in New Zealand" - Ruminator
"He uses words and wordplay skilfully… and has a sweet wit about him" Stuff.co.nz

More acts to be announced!

Brought to you with support from Pub Charities Ltd

events.id: The Way whanau camp-Te Horo-Facebook
events.name: The Way whanau camp
events.venue: Te Horo
events.long_description:
MARK THE DATE

5-7th December 2025
Whanau camp in Te Horo
This is open to all. There is no cost to our whanau, but we do encourage each family to bring along something in terms of kai . If you are interested in coming along, please reach out to Pastor Mishana or Pastor Stacey before the 26th of October (this Sunday) so that we can confirm numbers of adults and children. If you want to join and for any reason there is an obstacle stopping, please reach out and let us know so we can try to sort something out. We are looking at carpooling for those whanau who have no transport . Even if you are not sure, but think it may be something you would like to attend, reach out - we would rather over estimate what we need, then to not have enough

events.id: BOOK FESTIVAL: Songs of Solidarity-115 Taranaki St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: BOOK FESTIVAL: Songs of Solidarity
events.venue: 115 Taranaki St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
DAY 1 — Friday, December 5 (Evening)
• Formal opening
• An evening on Palestinian resistance and solidarity, with Justice 4 Palestine, Falastin Tea Collective and many more, with speeches, poetry readings, kai, and music from Nam Chucks, Amira and Welmie
DAY 2 — Saturday, December 6 (11am–12pm)
• Panel discussion: Solidarity with uprisings in the Global South, chaired by Richa Sharma and joined by 4 panellists
• Journaling workshop with Nadine Hura
• Collective bamboo wind chime making workshop with visual artist Jieying Cai, with support from Asian Arts Aotearoa
• Book Launch: "Our Climate Glossary" from Borneo to Aotearoa New Zealand
• An evening of poetry and other words, MCed by Nadia Solomon, featuring Khadro Mohamed, Cam McCausland-Taylor, Ahinata Kaitai-Mullane, Tarns Hood, Joshua Toumu’a and others
DAY 3 — Sunday, December 7 (10am–5pm)
• Kai and Kupu from India, Nepal and Gaza — a screening of writers from Nepal, India and Gaza reading their work
• Children's reading event with Ar-Em Bañas
• Matike Mai — Constitutional transformation wānanga
HOW BOOKS ARE PRICED
The bookstore will operate on a transparent ‘pay-what-you-can’ model to ensure accessibility as well as the sustainability of the project.

events.id: Clubhouse Sessions-93 Mornington Road, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Clubhouse Sessions
events.venue: 93 Mornington Road, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Get ready for an evening of groove and good times at the legendary Vogelmorn Bowling Clubhouse — a cosy community gem with vintage charm and a dance floor full of heart.
Join Marcos Alonso and Max Maxwell, two long-time collaborators known for their infectious energy and genre-blurring sets. Expect funky rhythms, cheeky basslines, and a joyful crowd ready to move.
Good people, great sound, and that unmistakable Vogelmorn vibe — this is your Friday night sorted.
Accessibility & Venue Info
Please note that Vogelmorn Upstairs is not wheelchair accessible, though there is an accessible bathroom available on site. The venue is all ages, but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm.
The Vogelmorn Precinct is a cherished community space within a residential area — so please be kind, look out for others, and help us keep the good vibes going by leaving quietly after the show.
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked & Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm for pre-show drinks and kai. To book a table, email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com.
Follow Vogelmorn on Facebook: facebook.com/vogelmornnz￼

events.id: Glass Bead-Making Taster - Christmas session!-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Glass Bead-Making Taster - Christmas session!
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for this fabulous introduction to working with colourful molten glass and get into the festive Christmas mood!

This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).

As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?

Students are shown correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours! How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.

Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: SCENT SERIES - DIY PERFUME ROLL ON-110A Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: SCENT SERIES - DIY PERFUME ROLL ON
events.venue: 110A Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us at the Wellington Apothecary for a series of botanical alchemy workshops centred around the art of scent.
Discover the unique aromas and healing properties of over thirty pure, therapeutic-grade essential oils. Learn about top, middle, and base notes, and how to blend your chosen oils to create your own balanced, bespoke fragrance. Use your aromatic concentrate to craft a collection of beautiful aromatic products — for yourself or to gift to those you love.
A series of three workshops — book one, or book them all.
Session Three - Create Your Own Aroma Roll-On
5pm, Friday, December 5th
Create your own signature scent to craft three personalised aroma roll-ons. Each blend will be mixed in a base of organic golden jojoba oil and bottled in a 3 x 10 ml glass roll-on vessel to take home.
Make up to nine bespoke products worth over $200, and discover the joy and skill of being an artisan maker.

events.id: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax - Friday Nights-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax - Friday Nights
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun on Friday nights!

In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there will be a week's break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what sized ring they want to make and the type of metal you choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 to $30 in metals depending on if you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Chant du Saxophone-St Michael's Anglican Church, 81 Upland Rd, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Chant du Saxophone
events.venue: St Michael's Anglican Church, 81 Upland Rd, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Enjoy the lush and mysterious sounds of French music performed by an exciting yet subtle chamber duo.
This concert explores a diverse range of repertoire from household names such as Claude Debussy to lesser known composers such as Paul Bonneau and Paule Maurice. Hear the many moods timbres of the saxophone, from delicately soaring melodies, to dark, enchanting arias and joyful, raucous moments.

Programme:
Francis Poulenc - Flute Sonata FP164
Eugene Bozza - Aria
Claude Debussy - Petite Suite (transcribed by Yukio Nakano)
Paul Bonneau - Caprice en Frome de Valse
Paule Maurice - Tableaux de Provence

About the performers:
Alex Trask is a saxophonist based in Pōneke. He has a keen interest in the classical saxophone and has studied with some of New Zealand's leading player such as Simon Brew and Reuben Chin. He is a member of the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and has performed with many other significant organizations such as Gallery Orchestra, Saxcess, Wellington Youth Orchestra, and Wellington City Symphonic Band.

Alex is also an accomplished jazz player, and has organized many events both in Wellington and nationally, performing in the Wellington Jazz Festival and the National Jazz Festival many times. Alex was the lead alto saxophone player in the Rodger Fox Big Band from 2024-2025 and has performed as a guest with that band since 2022. His debut album 'Pool of Tears’, which blends folk and classical melodies with jazz performance techniques, was released on Thelonious Records in 2023 and has been featured on RNZ Concert as well as other prominent radio stations.
-
David Codd is a New Zealand-born horn player and pianist. Originally from New Plymouth, New Zealand, David undertook a Bachelor of Music in Classical Performance—Collaborative Piano under Dr Jian Liu at Victoria University of Wellington, as well as secondary studies in French horn with Samuel Jacobs and Sebastian Dunn.

David maintains a busy schedule of performances as a horn player, pianist, and conductor. As well as being a member of the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band horn section, David performs with the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Orchestra Wellington, Auckland Philharmonia, and the Dunedin Symphony Orchestra.

As a pianist, David has a particular passion for collaborative work, enjoying performing with artists from NZSO and Orchestra Wellington, as well as orchestral keyboard for NZSO and the NZSO National Youth Orchestra.

events.id: Under the Full Moon: An Evening with Horses-299 Takarau Gorge Road, Ohariu, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Under the Full Moon: An Evening with Horses
events.venue: 299 Takarau Gorge Road, Ohariu, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A gentle gathering to reconnect with your breath, your body, and the quiet language of presence.
This is not a riding session.
It’s an opportunity to slow down, soften the edges of the day, and spend time with horses in an intentional, grounded way.
We’ll begin with warm cacao and a simple guided reflection to help you arrive in yourself. You’ll then be invited to step into the space with the horses; noticing your posture, your pace, your emotional landscape, and how the horses respond. They reflect us in subtle and honest ways, offering connection, feedback, and companionship without judgement or expectation.
No horse experience is needed.
Just a willingness to stay curious, breathe, and be present.
What to expect:
Cacao on arrival
A gentle guided settling practice
Time with the horses at liberty
Optional shared reflection
A quiet, unhurried closing
Duration: ~90 minutes
Location: Horse Space (Wellington region)
Group size: Max 6 to keep it intimate and personable
Suitable for: Anyone craving grounding, spaciousness, or connection
We usually make the cacao with coconut milk and honey so let us know if you have an allergy

events.id: Micetro - Classic improv-Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Micetro - Classic improv
events.venue: Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Let the holiday battles begin!

Beloved improv elimination comedy competition Micetro is back for another bite of the cheese. The magnificent Steven was once crowned the Greatest WIT in Wellington. But can he defend his title?

A crew of eager improvisers will again battle head to head using wit, spur-of-the-moment storytelling and risking everything for an the love of the audience. There’ll be songs! Drama! Pathos, bathos probably a bit of logos! A mix of seasoned improvisers and adorable newcomers and everyone in between will play their hearts out to decide who gets eliminated and who survives to be crowned ‘Micetro’.

The Wellington Improvisation Troupe, aka WIT, is a member-based community theatre group, teaching and performing in Wellington since 2003. Our theatre is made up on the spot, usually based on suggestions from the audience. WIT players share a love of storytelling and work together as a team to inspire the audience, we’re sometimes serious, often hilarious and always totally unpredictable.

Pay-what-you-can tickets from $5, and door sales. WIT is a registered charity.

𝗢𝗻 𝗦𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗡𝗼𝘄
🗓️ Friday, December 5
📍 San Fran, Wellington (U18 ALLOWED WITH GUARDIAN)
🎫 bit.ly/nirvtrib25well

𝙎𝙞𝙜𝙣 𝙪𝙥 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙫𝙤𝙩𝙚 𝙛𝙤𝙧 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙤𝙣𝙜𝙨 𝙔𝙊𝙐 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙝𝙚𝙖𝙧..𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙝𝙤𝙬 𝙞𝙨 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙨 🤲

What if you could choose the songs at a Nirvana concert… and then watch them come to life on stage?

🎤 For the first time ever, Nirvana Tribute is putting the show in the hands of the fans. Audiences across Australia and New Zealand will vote on the songs they want to hear. From iconic anthems like Smells Like Teen Spirit, Come As You Are, and Heart-Shaped Box, to the deep cuts only true fans would dare request.

This isn’t just a tribute. It’s a show 𝗯𝘂𝗶𝗹𝘁 𝗯𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗳𝗮𝗻𝘀, 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗳𝗮𝗻𝘀.

events.id: Somatic Dance Wellington ~ Hara Rising-11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Somatic Dance Wellington ~ Hara Rising
events.venue: 11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
HARA RISING ~ FRIDAY EVENING SOMATIC DANCE
This month, we dance from the deep.
From the low-lit well within the pelvis, where instinct, intuition, and our inner fire reside.
Breath descends, awakening the Hara, our life force energy, clearing what no longer serves us.
Movement rises, carrying what wants to be felt, freed, and transformed, opening space for more joy and vitality.
We dance not to perform, but to reclaim our energy, our presence, our aliveness.
To sink into the molten center where your belonging, your power, and your knowing dwell.
Let your hips answer.
Let your breath carve.
Let the Hara lift you, guiding you toward the embodiment of your truest self and the year ahead.

~ Friday 5th December
~7pm -9 pm
~Te Whaea National Dance and Drama Centre, Newtown
~Limited Spaces Available
~No door sales 
✨ We are a passionate group of certified Somatic Dance facilitators, eager to get you grooving on a Friday evening and set the perfect mood for your weekend.
What to Expect:
Somatic Dance: A guided, free-form movement journey, delving deep into the layers of the body, supported by a carefully curated soundscape.
Non-Judgmental Space: Let it all go! All of you is welcome to explore your own unique expression.
No Dance Experience Necessary: There are no routines or steps to follow here, simply an invitation to discover how your body wishes to move.
Come and move to the rhythm of you, ready to deepen your connection with self and others.
This is a space free of booze, shoes and talking on the dance floor. Let the epic music and steady voice of your facilitator carry you out of mind and into body, slipping away to the transformative power of somatic dance. The music takes the form of a wave, beginning gently before building to a peak, then settling softly and slowly. You'll leave feeling refreshed and high-vibed for the days ahead. 
What to Bring:
Comfortable clothes for movement (layers are recommended)
A drink bottle
A drop or two of curiosity!
Please arrive 5-15 minutes early to settle into the space. We welcome you from 6:45 PM for a prompt 7PM start.
We can't wait to dance with you!
~Wellington Somatic Dance Collective x

We welcome you from 6:45 PM for a prompt 7PM start.

events.id: Yoga Nidra-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga Nidra
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
Yoga Nidra, often referred to as "yogic sleep," is a deeply restorative practice that promotes physical relaxation, mental clarity, and emotional balance.
It's the perfect way to rejuvenate your mind, body, and soul: your hinengaro, tinana and wairua.
What to Expect: - A 90-minute guided Yoga Nidra Meditation led by one of our experienced instructors - A comfortable space to lie down (mats, blankets, bolsters & cushions provided) - A supportive community of fellow meditation enthusiasts - Complementary herbal tea before/after the session; - An opportunity to journal your experience, if desired - A chance to destress and cultivate inner calm Yoga Nidra is for everyone and no prior experience is required - everyone is welcome to experience the profound benefits of Yoga Nidra with us.
Wear comfortable clothes, and bring an open mind, a journal and eye mask if you have one (not required).
So, mark your calendar for the first Friday of each month and treat yourself to an evening of deep relaxation and mindfulness.

events.description:

events.id: SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt-The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
events.venue: The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
The original 28 November show is now SOLD OUT.

DON'T MISS OUT ON THE SECOND AND FINAL WELLINGTON REGION SHOW IN '25!

Tickets on sale NOW! Don't miss out...

This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.

Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterised by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.

With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.

Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.

Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.

You may also like the following events from Darren Watson:
This November, 9th November, 05:00 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Tauranga in Tauranga
This November, 15th November, 09:30 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Kumeū in Waitakere
This November, 21st November, 10:00 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - New Plymouth in New Plymouth
Also check out other Music events in Lower Hutt, Entertainment events in Lower Hutt, Arts events in Lower Hutt.

events.id: Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Levin-58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Levin
events.venue: 58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To mark the release of his brand-new single “Smoooth”, Sonic Delusion is hitting the road for a special six-date release tour. Known for his infectious grooves, playful looping, and feel-good folk-pop energy, Sonic Delusion brings audiences a mix of fresh tunes and crowd favourites — all wrapped in the joy and honesty that make his shows so irresistible.
Audiences can join the celebration at:
Saturday 15 November – Lakeside Playhouse, Opunake
Sunday 16 November – Wood St, Kakaramea
Thursday 4 December – Globe Theatre, Palmerston North
Friday 5 December – Firebird Cafe, Levin
Saturday 6 December – Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Sunday 7 December – Janette House Gig, Studio 73, Greytown
From Taranaki to the lower North Island, each stop promises to be a night of rhythm, laughter, and community. With “Smoooth” as the soundtrack, Sonic Delusion invites audiences to protest the madness of the world in the best way possible — by coming together, dancing, and choosing to live smoooth.
