events.id: Candlelit Concerts - it's a night out that feels good and does good!-87 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Candlelit Concerts - it's a night out that feels good and does good!
events.venue: 87 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
🌙 Candlelit Concert Series — Summer Edition
Step into an evening of warmth, wonder, and world-class music. Once each season, our historic local church transforms into an intimate haven softly lit by 800 flickering candles. Pause, breathe, and connect in a truly magical atmosphere.
✨ What to Expect
Ease into the evening with local wines, dessert nibbles, and gentle background music by a talented youth musician. Then, as dusk settles, enjoy 75 minutes of exquisite acoustic music, curated to uplift and inspire.
🎶 Guest Artists: Saxcess
New Zealand’s premier saxophone quartet, Saxcess, delivers a rich kaleidoscope of sounds  swing, classical, tango, cutting-edge NZ contemporary, and much more. For decades, they’ve delighted audiences young and old across Aotearoa and beyond.
Saxcess members:
Debbie Rawson (soprano/alto)
Richard Marin (soprano/alto)
Franz Ombler (tenor)
Rachel Collingridge (baritone)
Let your ears travel the world, from the bold energy of Latin American saxophone pieces to the inventive sounds of New Zealand compositions.
Founded and led by Debbie Rawson, Saxcess is a project-based collective that has toured nationwide for nearly 30 years and have played all major Arts Festivals in Aotearoa, and performed original NZ compositions at Saxophone Congresses in Australia, Belgium, and the USA.
🎹 Pre-Concert Performance (8:15–8:30pm)
Be captivated by rising young pianist Kasra Mitchell-Kouttab, 15, whose talent and passion for classical music have already impressed audiences far beyond his years.
🕯️ Event Details
Doors: 8:00pm | Pre-show: 8:15pm | Main concert: 8:30–9:45pm
Venue: Historic local church, transformed by candlelight
Tickets: $35 | Limited to 100 guests — bookings essential
💛 Music That Feels Good and Does Good
Each concert supports local community programmes — so your night out helps make a difference.
Whether for the spellbinding music, magical setting, or sense of connection, this is an evening you’ll never forget — and one you’ll return to season after season.
✨ Book your tickets now!
(Adults only; please no children under 10.)

events.venue: 30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Friday Laughs brings some of the best comedy talent NZ has to offer to the Fringe Bar
With Rhys Mathewson
Rhys Mathewson is a stand up comedian and reporter who has won pretty much every award New Zealand comedy has to offer. He currently serves as the roving reporter on Seven Sharp. Rhys has performed all over the world, including a packed out Spark Arena supporting Jack Whitehall.
Winner 2024 Directors Award at the NZ International Comedy Festavil
Winner 2016 Fred Dagg Award for best show at the NZ International Comedy Festival
Winner 2010 Billy T James Award
“One of New Zealand’s best comedians’” – stuff
“world class joke writing” – the speakeasy
And Brendon Green
Brendon Green brings a warm and friendly energy to every room he's in.
Combining hilarious jokes, world class storytelling, and an authentic emotional honesty, he is a treat for every kind of comedy fan. A great MC and a favourite feature act, he has honed his comedy skills on stages all over the world.
2023 Fred Award Nominee
2018 Best Storytelling Show Winner
2014 Billy T Award Nominee
Writer for 7 Days, Taskmaster NZ, Have You Been Paying Attention, Paddy Gower Has Issues, and many more.
"one of the strongest story-telling comics in New Zealand" - Ruminator
"He uses words and wordplay skilfully… and has a sweet wit about him" Stuff.co.nz
More acts to be announced!
Brought to you with support from Pub Charities Ltd

events.long_description:
Jazmine Mary Indie Folk artist is giving us a hot sad summer with a 9 date Duo tour across Aoteroa
“When you step into a
Jazmine Mary gig, be
prepared to be met by either
a clown, a pop star, a pilgrim
farmer, or a nightgown-clad
ghost howling brazenly
onstage. It’s a whimsical
experience that you won’t
want to miss. — VICE
Jazmine Mary is a noir folk artist whose work evokes haunting beauty, poetic grit, and
unflinching vulnerability. They were the 2022 winner of the Auckland Live Best
Independent Debut award for their album The Licking of a Tangerine. Their critically
acclaimed follow-up Dog was named one of Aotearoa’s Top 25 Albums by Rolling
Stone Magazine.
In 2025, Jazmine Mary signed to the iconic Flying Nun Records, marking a new chapter
in their sonic evolution. Their latest album, I Want To Rock And Roll, is raw, transcendent,
and emotionally unguarded. It debuted at #10 on the Oﬃcial NZ Top 20
Jazmine Mary has performed alongside Kurt Vile, Billy Bragg, Hand Habits, and toured
nationwide with Reb Fountain. A standout moment was their show at the Hollywood
Avondale, supported by Julia Deans, praised for its theatrical, spellbinding atmosphere.

events.id: Heartland Flyer-Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Heartland Flyer
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand
events.long_description:
Heartland Flyer
Travel with Steam Incorporated north from Kapiti via the spectacular Manawatu Gorge to Woodville for an easy day out. Picking up along the way from Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, and Levin, our destination today is Woodville. To get there, we travel through the famous Manawatu Gorge. Now only accessible via rail, you get a unique perspective of the monumental slips which closed the Gorge to road traffic from 2017.

At Woodville, sample the delights of the restored 1960s era station whilst our train is prepared for the run back down the coast. Meridian’s Te Apiti wind farm can also be seen from the station, occupying 1,150ha of land, with enough sustainable renewable energy to power 45,000 kiwi homes.

Fares
Adult (12+yrs) - $139
Child (3-12yrs) - $89
Infant (0-2yrs) - Free

Tickets available at steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/heartland-flyer/

events.name: HARD OUT
events.venue: 26 Blair Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Hard Out — Jungle Juice is dropping their first-ever Hard Techno party, and it’s gonna go off.

We’re talking straight-up belters, raw sounds and heavy energy, just pure underground sound for the real techno whānau.

Pull up, bring your crew, and get ready for a full-on sesh — loud, sweaty, and proper hard out.

Heavy pulse of the underground. Jungle Juice has been shaping Wellington’s dance floors, and now they’re turning up the pressure — faster, harder, and unapologetically raw.

Lose yourself in the kick. Feel the weight of the bass. This one’s for the ones who live the night — Aotearoa’s true techno heads.
Line-up:
• DANI — 22:00–23:00
• MALWARE — 23:00–00:00
• DJ BY ACCIDENT— 00:00–01:00
• VNESS — 01:00–02:00
• GASPAR — 02:00–03:00

Venue: Red Square — 26 Blair St, Te Aro, Wellington

Get ready, Wellington — this is Hard Out. No compromises, just pure Hard Techno.
Important Information
This event is R18. Valid photo ID will be required for entry.
Respect each other and the venue.
We will not tolerate any form of discrimination.
Look out for each other and please report any antisocial behaviour.
Consent is key – always.
Lighting & Visual Effects: Please be aware that strobe lights, lasers and other flashing
visuals may be in use throughout the night. These effects may not be suitable for everyone.
Photos & Video: Our crew will be capturing the energy of the night through photos and videos. By being here, you’re part of that magic and may appear in content we share to celebrate and promote future events.
Have fun and please find the crew if you have any issues.

events.id: AUDITIONS - Girls Night The Reunion!-15 Hinemoa Street, New Zealand 5032,15 Hinemoa St, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: AUDITIONS - Girls Night The Reunion!
events.venue: 15 Hinemoa Street, New Zealand 5032,15 Hinemoa St, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
AUDITIONS - Girls Night The Reunion!
Coasters Musical Theatre is proud to present the New Zealand premiere of Girls Night The Reunion!
Our five 50-something friends are back together at their 40th school reunion. They’re facing new challenges like hot flushes, grown up children, failed marriages and everything that comes with middle age! Sharon has managed to hang onto her wings and the others are still navigating life together. They re-live the past and reveal a couple of surprising secrets! But as always, the warmth of their friendship carries them through. Girls Night – The Reunion tells us that life is messy, but it’s much easier to navigate with good friends.

We are lucky enough to have two of our original actors from Girls Night and Girls Night Too returning and are now looking for three more performers with strong singing voices to join them.

Email Jo at for more information and to book an audition time for SATURDAY 6 DECEMBER.

Show dates are 16 - 26 April 2026

Character descriptions:
Carol is 50-something, confident, well dressed and likes a drink – the perpetual party girl! She was Sharon’s best friend and has been married, divorced, married, divorced and married. Turns out she found the answer to marriage but didn’t realise it. Well, we all kiss a lot of frogs before we find a prince…Everyone knows and loves a Carol.

Anita is 50-something, naïve and uncensored and has had mental health issues all her life. The friends know about this but there’s never been any deep discussion between them as to why this is…such close friends but with hidden secrets. Her journey is like a rollercoaster. Will we find out at the reunion what Anita’s secret is?

Kate is late 40’s/early 50’s and is Carol’s little sister. She is quite prim and proper and a school teacher. Anita and Kate are quite close but despite issues with her sister Carol, the sisters are also close. Kate is quiet compared to the others but sticks with the friends. She is menopausal and with her hot flushes she’s relying heavily on her fans! She is very determined and is definitely the kind one.

events.id: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve-Island Bay Beach, Taputeranga Marine Reserve,300 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve
events.venue: Island Bay Beach, Taputeranga Marine Reserve,300 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve
Dive into Taputeranga Marine Reserve and take part in a free snorkelling event this summer!

Beginners welcome! We provide all the necessary gear and experienced guides to ensure your safety and enjoyment in the water. Participants just need to be at least eight years old and confident swimmers. Those under sixteen must be accompanied by an adult.

Registrations open at 9.45am. Come down to book a snorkel time for the day, as spots may fill up quickly. Bring your togs, towel, refreshments and make a day of it exploring the activities and environment at Taputeranga Marine Reserve.

This free event is brought to you in partnership with Greater Wellington Regional Council.

Cancellations/Postponements

Events are weather dependent. Stay updated by checking the Mountains to Sea Wellington Facebook event listings for any cancellations, postponements, or location changes.

To get to Taputeranga Marine Reserve

We encourage attendees to leave cars at home and use alternative transport where possible. Locals- please come on foot or bring along your bikes/scooters! For those further afield, the number 1 bus drops you right to the event from the Wellington Train Station.

Accessibility

Island Bay Beach is accessible by beach wheelchair. The nearest accessible toilets are in Shorland Park. There are two accessible parks in front of the Island Bay Surf Club, additional vehicles can be accommodated if required, near to our MTSW trailers. Please see a staff member on arrival if the Surf Club parks are full. We have a variety of options to enable a more comfortable experience in the water, including flotation aids and 1:1 support from our trained guides. Please get in touch with us at in advance of the event to discuss your accessibility requirements, including to enquire about beach wheelchair assistance. We love helping people to experience our marine environment!

The snorkelling in this event is run under the Health and Safety of the Mountains to Sea Conservation Trust programme Experiencing Marine Reserves. Adventure Activity Certified - AA0534.

‍
Photos: Kristine Zipfel

events.name: Public Raku Day at Otaki Pottery Club
events.venue: Otaki Pottery Club,61C Te Roto Rd, Otaki 5512, New Zealand, Otaki
events.long_description:
Public Raku Day at Otaki Pottery Club

Join us for an exciting Raku pottery experience that's perfect for the entire family! Discover the joy of creating your very own masterpiece with our hands-on pottery event.

Event Details:*
- Date: Saturday, 6th December 2025
- Time: 10am - 1pm (last sale at 1pm) (Final pieces may take up to 1.5 hours to fire)
- Location: Otaki Pottery Club

What to Expect:
Come along and immerse yourself in the world of Raku pottery. Choose from a delightful selection of bisque ware, including options like birds, butterflies, hearts, and more. For just $3 each, you can select your favourite piece and add your personal touch.

Create and Fire:
Experience the thrill of glazing your chosen piece right on the spot. Once you've finished, we'll take care of firing it for you. No need to wait long – your masterpiece will be ready before your eyes!

Family Friendly:
This family-friendly event features live music, face painting for the kids, and plenty of space to picnic on the grass. Delicious food and drinks will also be available, including a sausage sizzle and refreshing homemade lemon drinks.

*Please note:

The event details are subject to change. Stay updated by visiting our website or Facebook page. https://www.otakipotteryclub.org/public-raku.html

While last sale is at 1pm it may take 1.5 hours to get the last work thru the kiln.

events.id: The Festive Flyer-Wellington Railway Station,Wellington Station, 2 Bunny St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: The Festive Flyer
events.venue: Wellington Railway Station,Wellington Station, 2 Bunny St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Festive Flyer
Join us and celebrate Christmas with a delicious lunch and a day out on the train! Saturday 6th December 2025

Get into the festive spirit with Steam Incorporated—perfect for celebrating with colleagues, friends, and family!

Jump onboard our heritage train departing Wellington Station, and nestle down into your seats for a relaxing journey up the coast behind one of our heritage Da class locomotives.

After arriving at the private entry at Tatum, you'll take a short walk across the car park and follow the music into the Pavilion, where we settle in just in time for lunch!

Immerse yourself in a well-crafted meal, created by the talented chefs there. The menu is set to be a classic kiwi style Christmas buffet feast with all the trimmings!

There will be plenty to keep you entertained such as outdoor games, live music, and 2 dinner sittings, so there is plenty of time to tour Tatum, check out Tatum House, and relax in the gardens on the Tatum House Lawn with a drink. You will be advised of your sitting time prior to arrival.

Departing Tatum, climb on board, head to the Lounge Car, grab a drink from the bar and enjoy the journey home. This unforgettable ride hugs the dramatic coastline along the famed Kapiti escarpment, offering sweeping views of the Tasman Sea and rugged cliffs. It’s a rare chance to relive the golden age of rail in one of New Zealand’s most scenic rail corridors as the sun begins to set.

This excursion will be hauled by our 1955-built diesel electric locomotive, Da 1410, and consist of our steel carriages.

Fares (include your return train travel, meal and entertainment)
Adult 13+ yrs - $229
Child 2-12yrs - $189
Infant 0-2yrs - FREE

Thinking of a larger event, or your corporate Christmas Function?
We're pleased to be able to offer some fantastic packages for large groups, or corporate functions with our friends at Tatum. This all inclusive train ride and Christmas lunch combo is a great way to celebrate 2025 with your team! Please contact us via email or call us on 0800 783 264 for a personalized group package.

Please be at your boarding station minimum 10 minutes prior ready to roll, with your tickets, carriage letter and seating allocations at the ready.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Tatum does NOT have a platform. This means you must be able to board and disembark the train from ground level with little to no assistance.

Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

All tickets and seating allocations are sent via email, within 48 hours prior to the departure of this excursion.

Prior booking is essential, make sure you reserve your spot now to avoid missing out on this experience.

Open Air are excited to return to a day/night adventure at the weird and wonderful Carlucci Land in Happy Valley.

3-430pm K-oTik

6-730pm Everybody

2nd Stage to be announced soon!


Our friends from Cosa Nostra food truck will be back serving fresh pizzas and also have a range of soft drinks available.

The #29 Metlink Bus route will be running on the hour with the last bus leaving Happy Valley around 10pm. We will also contact the taxi companies to get them to provision taxis for the event closure.


We will not be offering ticket refunds or swaps for this event, if you can no longer make the event, you can on-sell your own ticket - buyers please be sure about who you are buying from as there are lots of scammers around!


Consent is always required at any event to ensure that everyone is kept safe and boundaries are not crossed. Please ask before any hugging, touching of any sort, taking photos, etc. We operate a zero-tolerance policy to bad behaviour. If you see something that doesn’t seem right, you have a responsibility to do something. And remember, if it’s not an enthusiastic YES then it’s a NO.


Open Air reserve all rights and have a zero-tolerance approach.

events.id: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December-28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013,28 Moana Rd, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December
events.venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013,28 Moana Rd, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness. Discover the power of your own voice, mantra and silence working to find inner peace and contentment. Bring an intention, get comfortable and let the sound waves take over. Invite the sound to take you into a journey within, into your heart, to rest, to release physical, mental and emotional tension.

Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc..Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.

Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.


About Claudio: Claudio is a 3rd generation Multinstrumentalist Musician from Mexico City now based in Wellington. Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years. When he finished music school as a classical guitarist he moved to Montreal, Canada and explored new genres such a Jazz, World Music, and Spiritual Music. Traveling he discovered Indian Music and the Yoga Tradition and they became a very important influence on his career and lifestyle, and allowed him to study Music and Yoga with teachers in Europe and Asia. He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer. He has been playing the Tibetan bowls for more than 10 years now.

You may also like the following events from Claudio Escutia Yoga - Sound Healing- Music:
Next month, 11th October, 07:00 am, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 11th October in Lower Hutt
Also check out other Music events in Lower Hutt, Entertainment events in Lower Hutt, Health & Wellness events in Lower Hutt.

events.id: Heartland Flyer-Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: Heartland Flyer
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki
events.long_description:
Travel with Steam Incorporated north from Kapiti via the spectacular Manawatu Gorge to Woodville for an easy day out. Picking up along the way from Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, and Levin, our destination today is Woodville. To get there, we travel through the famous Manawatu Gorge. Now only accessible via rail, you get a unique perspective of the monumental slips which closed the Gorge to road traffic from 2017.

At Woodville, sample the delights of the restored 1960s era station whilst our train is prepared for the run back down the coast. Meridian’s Te Apiti wind farm can also be seen from the station, occupying 1,150ha of land, with enough sustainable renewable energy to power 45,000 kiwi homes.

If you are wishing to take a ride from Palmerston North or Woodville, check out the Ashhurst Flyer running on the same day!
Group bookings of 10+ please contact us via email admin@steaminc.org.nz or call us on 0800 783 264 for a personalized package!

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

events.name: Kiwi Christmas in Kaitoke
events.venue: Kaitoke Regional Park,Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kiwi Christmas in Kaitoke
Celebrate the season at Kaitoke Regional Park – Christmas carols and movie night in the park! 🎄🎅🎶

Gather the whānau and head to Kaitoke Regional Park for a magical evening of festive fun in nature.

Join us for Nick Tansley’s Pop Up Carols Caravan, bringing joyful live music to the park. Stay later for a screening of the movie Kiwi Christmas on the big screen—a funny, whānau-friendly movie about Santa tuning up for a summer holiday as far away from the North Pole as possible – Aotearoa!

Warm up with marshmallow toasting, pack a picnic or grab a bite from the from the local Scouts fundraising food stall (cash only), and if conditions allow, join a guided night time walk with the park ranger after the movie.

Carols: 5.30pm - 6.30pm

Movie: 6.30pm - 8pm

Why not make a weekend of it? Come camp at Kaitoke Regional Park and enjoy everything the park has to offer—from swimming holes and forest walks to peaceful picnic spots and native wildlife.

Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of your regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Kaitoke Regional Park is more than just a beautiful place—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater, restores native bush, preserves historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers play a vital role in keeping this park special.

events.id: Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag and Ozzy Memorial Show-Wildkiwi distillery,23 Blenheim St, Maidstone, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag and Ozzy Memorial Show
events.venue: Wildkiwi distillery,23 Blenheim St, Maidstone, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag and Ozzy Memorial Show
Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: A Memorial for Metal Legends
Rail Records, Wildkiwi Distillery, Women's Refuge, and Rockstock present a monumental night of heavy metal in honor of two of the genre's most important and beloved figures: the legendary guitarist "Dimebag" Darrell Abbott of Pantera, and the recently departed Godfather of Metal, Ozzy Osbourne.

Join us on Saturday, December 6th, 2025, at Wildkiwi in Upper Hutt for a memorial show that will shake the foundations. This date holds a special importance to us metal heads, falling just three days after what would have been Ozzy's 77th birthday (December 3rd) and just two days before the anniversary of Dimebag's tragic passing (December 8th, 2004), giving us all a chance to raise a glass and celebrate both legends in the loudest way possible.

This is a night to pay tribute to the artists who defined a generation of heavy music. From Dimebag's revolutionary groove and unmistakable harmonic squeals to Ozzy's haunting vocals and iconic stage presence, their impact is eternal. We invite the metal community to come together for an unforgettable evening of remembrance, unity, and blistering riffs.

The Lineup
Prepare for a full-throttle sonic assault from four of New Zealand's premier tribute acts, performing the anthems that have become the soundtrack to our lives:

•Hell's Wrath delivering the ferocious power of Pantera

•Zombie Stomp (ft. Danny Rascal) channeling the madness of Ozzy Osbourne

•Angel Dust performing the eclectic genius of Faith No More

•Demon Fetal Harvest unleashing the thrash mastery of Megadeth

(More bands to be announced!)

Event Details
•Date: Saturday, December 6, 2025

•Venue: Wildkiwi, Unit 13/27 Blenheim Street, Maidstone, Upper Hutt

•Time: Doors open at 6:00 PM

•Age Restriction: This is a strictly R18 event. ID will be required.

•Charity: We will be accepting donations at the event and at point of sale on behalf of Women's Refuge. Your support is greatly appreciated.

Ticket Information
Secure your spot to witness this massive tribute event. Tickets are on sale now!

•$20 Early Bird (+GST/BF) - Limited quantity available! Grab them before they're gone.

•$30 General Admission (+GST/BF)

•$40 Door Sales/Lates (If not sold out prior)

VIP Table Experience - Only 6 Available!
For the ultimate night out, gather your crew and secure a VIP table.

Price: $240 per table (includes 6 tickets - works out to $40 per person)

Perks:

•Guaranteed reserved seating for your group of 6.

•Early venue access from 4:00 PM to settle in and have a meal.

•10% discount on delicious bar food from the Wildkiwi kitchen.

•First dibs on the merch table.

•Check out soundcheck and meet the bands (where possible).

Limited Edition Merchandise
•Exclusive Event T-Shirt: $30

•Commemorate this special night with a limited edition T-shirt. There are only 20 of these shirts being made, so this is a true collector's item. Available as a ticket add-on. Don't miss out!

This show is a tribute, a memorial, and a celebration. Get your tickets now and be part of a historic night for New Zealand's metal scene.

LINK TO SIZING AND DESIGN HERE:

https://www.railrecords.net/utf2-tee

EVENT TNCS:

https://www.railrecords.net/ticketing-tncs

events.id: Yana- An Inward Journey of Release and Renewal Share-Lotus Yoga Centre,91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Yana- An Inward Journey of Release and Renewal Share
events.venue: Lotus Yoga Centre,91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Yana- An Inward Journey of Release and Renewal Share
https://events.humanitix.com/yana-release-and-renewal
Mystic Creative warmly invites you to join us for a very special evening to close out the last part of 2025. You'll experience the opportunity to restore, recalibrate and realign your soul to its highest timeline for 2026 and beyond. This intimate event will have very limited capacity, to ensure a deep inward experience for all.

We will share in a sacred water ceremony with coherent water that has been structured, charged and infused with frequency- ready to be programmed with your intentions to release and shift into the new.

Next, we will connect with a Triple Cone Orgonite meditation, further amplifying the Euphoria to all, energising your intentions and clearing the way for the shifts to come.

With awareness of breath and the rhythmic handpan drumming, you will gently be guided inward to begin your journey and actualize your intentions.

The heartbeat of the journey is a very special 30 year old handmade Buffalo drum from Utah, USA. Yana is the beat we move and breathe to, the guide and the gateway, the beat of Mother Earth. Allow her depth and resonance to take you to places you’ve forgotten and re-introduce to you the primal heartbeat of humanity, of your humanity.

An intentional weaving of a multitude of instruments, beats and frequencies that will take you to places deep within yourself: an opportunity to explore, feel and release what no longer serves you. As we move into higher frequencies of consciousness as a collective, we are being called to clear the old- expectations, stories, beliefs, programs, conditioning and paradigms. You bring the intention and Yana will guide you into surrender, allowing all that does not serve your highest timeline to fall away.

And as you gently re-emerge into the waking state, you'll experience the quiet and space to recalibrate and sink into the tenderness of renewal.

This journey is a sacred experience, designed to guide you through your own process. As such, this will mainly be a silent event (not social).
Contribution $55
Nameste

Namaste
events.description:
Yana- An Inward Journey of Release and Renewal Share https://events.humanitix.com/yana-release-and-renewal Mystic Creative warmly invites you to join us for a very special evening to close out the last part of 2025.
This intimate event will have very limited capacity, to ensure a deep inward experience for all.
We will share in a sacred water ceremony with coherent water that has been structured, charged and infused with frequency- ready to be programmed with your intentions to release and shift into the new.
Yana is the beat we move and breathe to, the guide and the gateway, the beat of Mother Earth.
An intentional weaving of a multitude of instruments, beats and frequencies that will take you to places deep within yourself: an opportunity to explore, feel and release what no longer serves you.

events.id: PADI Open Water Diver Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures,9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: PADI Open Water Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures,9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua, New Zealand
events.long_description:
PADI Open Water Diver Course
“Ever Since I Was A Kid I’ve Wanted To Learn To SCUBA Dive…”

PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun safe relevant and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in your PADI qualification will be recognised.

To learn to dive first complete the medical questionnaire to make sure you are medically fit to dive. Next pay your deposit and select your course dates. You will receive your PADI eLearning theory which must be completed before you attend the first practical session. This simple and fun eLearning program will give you the knowledge you need to understand the reason for the skills you will learn.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive so we can go at your pace no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed you will be ready for the sea dives.

During the second weekend you complete four sea dives two per day. This is where we confirm and practice the skills you learnt in our pool – all under direct supervision. You will also complete a simple 300m swim (no time limit and wearing wetsuit mask snorkel and fins).

Once you are a certified diver you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification online. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course and our regular Dive Days.
Our aim is to prepare you for the fascinating adventure of diving. We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call email or stop by our Dive Store.
 
PPADI Open Water Diver course at a glance
Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
Practical: One weekend pool training one weekend with four sea dives
Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
Start Time: Be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am each day.

Location
We are located at 9 Marina View Mana Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Our Location

Prerequisites
Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
Be able to swim 300m (mask snorkel and fins no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts a visit to your doctor is required.
eLearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
Complete the Optional RDP Tables Quiz and Exam after the final exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring
Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
A pen swimming costume towel and a snack for the breaks.
Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost
Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
Includes: PADI eLearning Course Dive Gear Rental Pool Sessions and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased.
10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.

Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course
Course bookings can be made in-store via email online or over the phone
The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
eLearning courses once redeemed cannot be transferred.
Before we can send you the eLearning link we require your full name date of birth a valid personal email address and phone number.
Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

Activities For Certified PADI Open Water Divers
Local Diving; It’s a good idea to keep diving regularly especially in the weeks following your course. We’re here to help with advice on dive sites and gear rental. Want a guide? Join us for Dive Days!
Advanced Open Water course; Further your dive skills and continue your underwater adventures with the PADI Advanced Open Water course you can start straight after your Open Water Diver course.
As a certified PADI Open Water Diver you can take the following Specialty Diver courses alongside those available to non-divers; Altitude Diver – AWARE Fish ID diver – Boat Diver – Digital Underwater Photographer – Diver Propulsion Vehicle Diver – Drift Diver – Drysuit Diver – Enriched Air/Nitrox Diver – Equipment Specialist – Night Diver – Peak Performance Buoyancy – Sidemount Diver – Underwater Naturalist – Underwater Navigation

events.venue: 58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510,58 Oxford St, Levin 5510, New Zealand, Otaki
events.long_description:
Matiu Te Huki concert Levin - Firebird Cafe
This sweet, intimate concert gathering will bring sweet souls
together to celebrate life with food, music, dance and good times.
Its time to gather and celebrate community (common unity)
Bring your good vibes and your dancing shoes

7:30pm the music kicks off

Matiu


As a musician, Matiu’s ability to powerfully connect with and lift a crowd with his powerful stage presence, while fronting great bands or with his solid solo looping show is mesmerising.


Looping live, Matiu's soulful roots music has a strong Maori flavor, using haka, chants and traditional Maori instruments, backed by grabbing grooves, deep, beautifully crafted bass lines, funky rhythms and magical melodies that stay with you well after the show ends, all held up by a pillar of Pacific passion and top class technical precision


As a composer, the soul stirring messages in Matiu's music are positive, inspiring and unifying.


Matiu intuitively nurtures a deep connection with his audience creating the energy that opens portals of paradise.


"I tell ya... Your medicine Is your music... Straight from the heart and the depths of your soul. You are a warrior of word n rhythm - inspiring peeps to look within n re switch the light inside their own souls. Thank u incredible you!”


Fan

events.long_description:
ROLL UP, ROLL UP – THE EXTRAVAGANZA FAIR IS BACK!
Celebrating 11 epic years of magical mayhem on the road!
New Zealand’s biggest and most fabulous travelling fair is rolling back into town – and you’re invited!
We’re bringing grassroots charm, vintage flair, and old-school fun to town – a joyride for all ages! Whether you’re 5 or 95, there’s something here to make your heart happy.
FREE ENTRY for kids! Gold coin for adults – that’s it!
Get ready for a weekend packed full of FREE entertainment the whole whānau will love.
Expect a kaleidoscope of colour, creativity, and community vibes with:
Unique market stalls, arts,crafts & more!
Yummy street food galore
Kids rides & games all day
The fabulous Ashton Family Circus
Burns the Dragon breathing fun
Enchanting Mermaid Storytime
Sparkling LuckyStar Zone (as seen at Splore!)
Live music all day
Tarot, past-life readings & mystical moments

Retro lounges & shady chill zones = your new favourite hangout spot
See you there this summer 2025 - 2026!!

events.long_description:
The Pulse of Possibility - A Breathwork Immersion to Expand Beyond the Unknown
Breathe beyond what you know.....
Join us in the Yurt for The Pulse of Possibility - a transformative breathwork immersion to close the year with clarity, expansion, and embodied aliveness.

As the year draws to a close, we gather for one final breath -
a sacred space to release, recalibrate, and remember what’s possible.

✨ The Pulse of Possibility ✨
A Pulse Breathwork Immersion with Melisa Bassett

Join us in the Yurt for an evening of expansion, energy, and embodiment.
Through breath, sound, and rhythm, you’ll open to new creative frequencies and reconnect with the pulse of life itself.

This is not about forcing or striving - it’s about breathing beyond what you know and awakening the aliveness already within you.

🌕 What to Expect

A guided breathwork journey to clear the year’s residue

Somatic movement and sound to awaken energy flow

Gentle integration with grounding and reflection

Community connection in a sacred, candlelit space


💫 You’ll Leave Feeling

Expanded and grounded

Reconnected to your inner rhythm

Clear, light, and inspired for what’s next


📍 Event Details

Location: The R&R Yurt, Rapaura (Marlborough)
Date: Saturday 6th December 2025
Time: 7 – 9pm
Facilitator: Melisa Bassett – founder of Rhythm & Rise, Pulse Breathwork
Exchange: $55 (limited spots available)

🕯️ What to Bring

A yoga mat, blanket, and pillow for comfort

Journal and pen for reflections

Water bottle

An open heart and willingness to explore

💖 Reserve Your Space

Spaces are limited in the Yurt.
Click “Going” and secure your spot, invite your breathing buddies - your breath will thank you.

“You are the pulse, the rhythm, the creation.”

events.id: Aurora Distillery Gin Experience-Aurora Distillery, 76 Hikunui Road, Kahutara, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Aurora Distillery Gin Experience
events.venue: Aurora Distillery, 76 Hikunui Road, Kahutara, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.
events.description:
Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough.
You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved.
While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.
Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket.
To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.

events.id: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve-300 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve
events.venue: 300 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Dive into Taputeranga Marine Reserve and take part in a free snorkelling event this summer!
Beginners welcome! We provide all the necessary gear and experienced guides to ensure your safety and enjoyment in the water. Participants just need to be at least eight years old and confident swimmers. Those under sixteen must be accompanied by an adult.
Registrations open at 9.45am. Come down to book a snorkel time for the day, as spots may fill up quickly. Bring your togs, towel, refreshments and make a day of it exploring the activities and environment at Taputeranga Marine Reserve.
This free event is brought to you in partnership with Greater Wellington Regional Council.
Cancellations/Postponements
Events are weather dependent. Stay updated by checking the Mountains to Sea Wellington Facebook event listings for any cancellations, postponements, or location changes.
To get to Taputeranga Marine Reserve
We encourage attendees to leave cars at home and use alternative transport where possible. Locals- please come on foot or bring along your bikes/scooters! For those further afield, the number 1 bus drops you right to the event from the Wellington Train Station.
Accessibility
Island Bay Beach is accessible by beach wheelchair. The nearest accessible toilets are in Shorland Park. There are two accessible parks in front of the Island Bay Surf Club, additional vehicles can be accommodated if required, near to our MTSW trailers. Please see a staff member on arrival if the Surf Club parks are full. We have a variety of options to enable a more comfortable experience in the water, including flotation aids and 1:1 support from our trained guides. Please get in touch with us at events@mtsw.org.nz in advance of the event to discuss your accessibility requirements, including to enquire about beach wheelchair assistance. We love helping people to experience our marine environment!
The snorkelling in this event is run under the Health and Safety of the Mountains to Sea Conservation Trust programme Experiencing Marine Reserves. Adventure Activity Certified - AA0534.
‍

Photos: Kristine Zipfel

events.long_description:
Crate Day Carnage
HBHC and Crate are bringing you a stacked lineup of rungus hard hitting metal and punk bands from Wellington and Hawkes Bay so that you can celebrate Crate day the right way.

You will experience decimating sets from:

Retaliator - Blistering old school thrash metal.

Postnatal Abortion - Savage sludgy deathgrind.

Maced - Raw noise brickwall grindcore to make your eyes water and your ears bleed.

Heathen Collective - NZ Groove metal legends, heavy riffs and savage vocals.

Crate - Crushing breakdowns, groovy hardcore and thrash style riffs blended with Latin-inspired rhythms and ferocious vocal delivery.

$20 on the door

$17 on UTR (Plus booking fee)

events.id: Kāpiti Food Fair 2025-15 Scaife Drive, Paraparaumu 5032, Kāpiti Coast-Humanitix
events.name: Kāpiti Food Fair 2025
events.venue: 15 Scaife Drive, Paraparaumu 5032, Kāpiti Coast
events.long_description:
All FOODIES and your tribe are invited to an exciting and indulgent day out that leaves a lasting impression on food lovers that will have you returning year after year. We take pride in our offering of GOOD food, GOOD music, and GREAT company for food enthusiasts – the ultimate Food Festival with something for everyone backed with a great vibe and professional entertainment to enjoy all day long!
On the menu for 2025 ……. up to 250 vendor sites including an off licence Liquor Zone, a licenced Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage, ANZ Kāpiti Kitchen Demo Stage, Kāpiti Ice Cream Dining Room, FREE Kid’s Zone, ZEAL Zone buskers, roving street performers and much more!
GETTING THERE: Walk | Bike | Drive | FREE bus from Paraparaumu Railway Station
ALL WELCOME + crowd friendly dogs on lead
LOOK out for the NEW shady picnic zone!
THAMES PACIFIC MAIN STAGE
9:45 AM – 9:50 AM | Official Mayoral Opening
10:00 AM – 10:30 AM | Devon Welch Music
10:45 AM – 11:15 AM | Intercite
11:45 AM – 12:45 PM | Jody & the Stowaways
1:15 PM – 2:15 PM | The Beat Girls
2:45 PM – 3:45 PM | The Relatives
4:15 PM – 5:15 PM | Love Shack
MERCHANDISE: $3 Bags, $5 T-towels, $10 Aprons (not sold online)
NOTE: Humanitix booking fees will be added to the cost of your ticket and paid at check-out.  Booking fees cover Humanitix costs, and everything else goes to their education projects that help to change lives.  Kāpiti Food Fair supports Manaiakalani Education Trust for Māori, Pasifika, and disadvantaged learners in Aotearoa to increase student outcomes and get equal access to digital education.
TOP TIPS for a FANTASTIC DAY at the Kāpiti Food Fair
Bring a gold coin for parking donations.
Pack a hat and sunscreen – complimentary SPF is available if you need it.
Bring a picnic blanket to relax, enjoy the ambiance, and savor your treats with plenty of seating and a NEW shaded picnic spot under the trees.
BYO your own chair if you wish and a chilly bin for purchases!
Plan your foodie route with the Site Map >>
Visit the Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage and relax over a craft brew, wine, local cocktails and delicious cider while enjoying the vibe of the 80's to 90's revival party all day long!  Children are welcome with their parent or guardian.  CHEERS to that!
MOST vendors accept EFTPOS or bank transfer.  BYO cash as there is no ATM available.
THANK YOU SPONSORS
Kāpiti Food Fair is a recipient of the Kāpiti Major Events Fund and is supported by numerous local businesses in-kind and reduced cost of services.  The Fair is a commercial event however we have a social agenda too.  We choose to support Kāpiti Community Patrol, Kāpiti Rotary Charitable Trust, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets, Paekākāriki Surf Lifesavers, Paraparaumu College, and Work Ready Kāpiti to help run key logistics on the day. 
Kāpiti Food Fair Ltd is privately owned and operated by Helene Judge and Jeanine van Kradenburg.  The Fair reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.
#KFF2025 #FoodFestival #KāpitiFoodFair #SomethingForEveryone #VisitKāpiti
Website >> | Facebook >> | Instagram >> | YouTube >> | TikTok >>

events.id: Kāpiti Food Fair 2025-Mazengarb Reserve, Mazengarb Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Kāpiti Food Fair 2025
events.venue: Mazengarb Reserve, Mazengarb Rd, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Kāpiti Food Fair 2025, BOOK your calendar now for a standout food & beverage experience that leaves a lasting impression on food lovers and will have you returning year after year. We take pride in our offering of an exciting and indulgent day filled with good food, good music, and great company for food enthusiasts to enjoy all day long. We are a sustainable major event that is connected to its Kāpiti Coast community. We showcase New Zealand packaged food & beverage, other products related to food & beverage and the United Nations of ready to eat foods. The ultimate food festival with something for everyone backed with a great vibe and professional entertainment to enjoy all day long, RAIN or SHINE!

TICKET COSTS
EARLY BIRD by 9 Nov: $15 Adults | $10 Gold Card or Student ID (+ booking fees)
STANDARD from 10 Nov: $20 Adults | $15 Gold Card or Student ID (+ booking fees)
TICKET OFFICE on the day: $25 Adults | $20 Gold Card or Student ID (Cash or Eftpos)

FREE up to 12 years ANYTIME
PARKING OPTIONS : $10 VIP & Gold Coin
MERCH (not sold online): $3 Bags, $5 T-towels, $10 Aprons at Gate Entry & INFO Hub
Tickets sold online at Humanitix – OPENING AUG

INFORMATION FOR VISITORS:
10,000+ visitors, crowd friendly dogs on lead welcome!
NEW shady picnic zone!
VISITOR SITE MAP: Head to website
GATE ENTRY
BUY tickets ONLINE >> BEFORE arriving to streamline entry, and save money upfront and spend more on delicious food at the Fair! Have your tickets ready to scan at Gate Entry.
OR ON THE DAY, scan our ticket QR CODE on site to purchase ONLINE at Standard ticket prices
TICKET OFFICE operates for last minute purchase at PREMIUM prices – best option, park off site in a GOLD COIN parking zone and walk to the Ticket Office if wanting to buy a ticket on the day
TRANSPORT & PARKING
VIP parking on site at Mazengarb Reserve - ticket scanned at the Barrier Arm once you have entered Scaife Dr and will let you conveniently park all day!
NO VIP parking ticket? Head to a managed GOLD COIN parking zone shown on our PARKING MAP. Walk the short distance to the Fair and enjoy the vibe along the way with many other visitors arriving and departing!
DISABLED/MOBILITY parking is FREE and near Gate Entry 2, with parking marshals ready to assist.
LOCALS: Recommend walking, running, biking (plenty of bike racks and lock-up options on site) – Or catch the train from Waikanae or Paekākāriki and board the FREE bus from Paraparaumu Station (timetable below).
HEADS UP: MEADOW COURT entry will be CLOSED, and Realm Drive car park will be OPEN with a fenced pathway to tarmac near Gate Entry 2.
FREEDOM CAMPING is not permitted on site.
FREE Bus Schedule
CATCH the TRAIN to Paraparaumu Station and board the FREE Bus on the half hour for a short ride to and from the Fair.
Depart Paraparaumu Station Intercity Bus Stop, Main Rd, Southbound:
10.13am, 10.43am, 11.13am, 11.43am, 12.13pm, 12.43pm, 1.13pm, 1.43pm, 2.13pm, 2.43pm, 3.13pm, 3.43pm, 4.13pm.
Depart Mazengarb Reserve:
10.43am, 11.13am, 11.43am, 12.13pm, 12.43pm, 1.13pm, 1.43pm, 2.13pm, 2.43pm, 3.13pm, 3.43pm, 4.13pm, 4.43pm, 5.13pm.
INFO HUB for Qs, LOST property, free BAG STORAGE
BYO cash - no ATM
FREE water for visitors & pooches
FREE sunscreen, don't forget your hat
ON-SITE paramedic
TOILETS: Flush portaloos near Gate 1 & 2 & inside Pavilion including 2 disabled toilets.
SITE MAP: Smoke & vape FREE

TUATARA BAR (EFTPOS ONLY): Craft brews, wine, local cocktails & cider. Children welcome with parent or guardian.
THAMES PACIFIC MAIN STAGE: 80’s to 90’s revival party!
ZEAL ZONE: Rangatahi musicians & buskers
PAVILION STREET ZONE
ANZ KĀPITI KITCHEN STAGE
KĀPITI ICE CREAM Dining Room
FREE Kids Zone
SPONSOR THANKS
PLATINUM: The Chris & Melinda Leatham Charitable Trust, Kāpiti Ice Cream
GOLD: NZME, SignCraft Kāpiti, Thames Pacific
SILVER: ANZ Kāpiti, Big Mac Slabs Furniture, Electra, Mike Pero Mortgages Zebunisso Alimova, Tuatara
BRONZE: ANZIL, Flightdec
Recipient: Kāpiti Major Events Fund

events.name: Let's Sketch at Berhampore Shops
events.venue: Mavericks, 461 Adelaide Rd, Berhampore, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Berhampore has an interesting mix of old and new buildings, retail and residential, good cafes for coffee, some with outside tables. It's usually busy on Saturday mornings so there will be plenty of people to draw. The Modernist Centennial Flats are a short walk to the south on Adelaide Road and there are plenty of character homes in the area. Draw in the shoping area or venture further afield.
Meet in front of the Sprig and Fern Pub at 10.00am.
Regroup again for a chat/snack/drink at the Sprig and Fern at 12.00pm. If the weather is good we can sit at an outdoor table in the garden area, otherwise there are plenty of tables inside.
This is a free informal event. Everybody is welcome. BYO drawing materials

events.id: Martinborough Christmas Community Market-Waihinga Centre, Martinborough Square, 8 Texas St, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Martinborough Christmas Community Market
events.venue: Waihinga Centre, Martinborough Square, 8 Texas St, Martinborough
events.long_description:
This holiday season, step into a world of festive cheer, creativity, and hidden treasures at the Martinborough Christmas Community Market!

Join us for a magical day full of unique finds, second-hand treasures, and joyful holiday shopping.

Discover the artistry of our community’s talented artisans, each bringing their own style and skill through handcrafted goods. Every stall is a showcase of creativity, giving you the chance to find that one-of-a-kind gift that will inspire and delight.

Set out on a treasure hunt through our second-hand treasures! Each item holds its own story and charm, ready to add nostalgia and uniqueness to your holiday season. You never know what special find might be waiting just for you.

Fun for the Whole Family, bring the children along for a Christmas treasure hunt through the market — a fun and festive adventure for little explorers!

Relax in our Tearoom, take a break from shopping and enjoy a cuppa, a Sandwich or a sweet treat — our Tearoom is open and ready to welcome you this Christmas!

Come ready to shop, celebrate, and soak in the holiday atmosphere. Whether you're buying for others or picking out a treat for yourself, this market has something for everyone!

events.id: Modern Shared Living in the Heart of Karori- Open Day-19 Blakey Ave, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Modern Shared Living in the Heart of Karori- Open Day
events.venue: 19 Blakey Ave, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Blakey is Karori’s newest residential offering a thoughtfully refurbished property that reimagines community living for a new generation. Originally built as teachers’ accommodation, Hellen Lowry House has been the home to hundreds of student teachers over the last 25 years. Blakey has been fully transformed into modern functional shared residences designed for comfort, connection, and convenience.
Blakey brings together the best of modern design and shared living. Each residence has been carefully reconfigured to create a sense of independence with access to welcoming communal spaces. Whether you’re a young professional, student, or someone looking for an affordable and social place to call home, Blakey offers a new way to live well in one of Wellington’s most sought-after suburbs close to public transport, shops, and cafes.
Learn More- https://tinyurl.com/4d23n69m
Be among the first to experience this fresh approach to shared living in Karori.
stay@blakey.nz
021283446
Early applications are now open- Email us and register your interest today to secure your spot at Blakey.

events.name: Ōtaki Pottery Club's Public Raku Day!
events.venue: Ōtaki Pottery Club, 47 Te Roto Road, Ōtaki 5512, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Get Ready to Get Creative at Ōtaki Pottery Club's Public Raku Day!

Join the Ōtaki community for a fun-filled day of creativity on Saturday, December 6, 2025, from 10 AM to 1 PM at the Ōtaki Māori Race Club grounds!

Experience the magic of pottery by choosing from a selection of bisque ware pieces starting at just $3 each. Apply vibrant Raku glazes and watch your creations come to life as they are fired on-site!

This family-friendly event features live music, face painting for the kids, and plenty of space to picnic on the grass. Delicious food and drinks will also be available, including a sausage sizzle and refreshing homemade lemon drinks.

Event Details:
Date: Saturday, December 6, 2025
Time: 10 AM - Last sale at 1 PM (Final pieces may take up to 1.5 hours to fire)
Location: Ōtaki Māori Race Club Grounds

events.id: Featherston Christmas Parade 2025-Main Street (Fitzherbert St) -, SH2 Featherston, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: Featherston Christmas Parade 2025
events.venue: Main Street (Fitzherbert St) -, SH2 Featherston, Featherston
events.long_description:
Get ready for a festive celebration in the heart of Featherston!

Decorate your ride-on mower or tractor, gather your friends, dress up in your best holiday style, and join the fun as the parade brings cheer to Featherston’s main street (SH2/Fitzherbert Street). The procession sets off from the corner of Revan and Wakefield Streets, travelling north along SH2 and finishing at Clifford Square.

Everyone is welcome — whether you’re marching, riding, or simply soaking up the atmosphere. Participation is FREE, so bring your creativity and festive spirit!

After the parade, make a day of it. Stay for lunch at one of Featherston’s cosy cafés, bakeries, or eateries, or turn it into a weekend getaway exploring South Wairarapa’s boutique shops, vineyards, coastal scenery, and country walks.

Not dressing up? That’s fine too — come along as a spectator, line the main street, and cheer on the parade participants as Featherston comes alive with Christmas joy complete with Santa in his sleigh.

Participants need to register here: https://form.jotform.com/252601211051841

The procession sets off from the corner of Revan and Wakefield Streets, travelling north along SH2 and finishing at Clifford Square.
Everyone is welcome — whether you’re marching, riding, or simply soaking up the atmosphere.
After the parade, make a day of it.

events.id: Folk in the Vines 2025 - December 6th-Le Gra Vineyard, 42 Loopline RD 1, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Folk in the Vines 2025 - December 6th
events.venue: Le Gra Vineyard, 42 Loopline RD 1, Masterton
events.long_description:
Join us for an afternoon of music and wine. We invite you to bring your own picnic food, pre-order one of Le Grá’s delish platters (pictured below) with your ticket or decide on the day. Our caravan bar will be set up for all beverage needs – Le Grá wines, cocktails, a selection of beers, ciders and non-alcoholic sodas. No BYO drinks please.

And for the music!

Kyan – a local lad who is making his place in the music world. He and his band took out the ‘next in line’ annual music event in Otepoti. He’ll be playing as a solo act for us with some of his original music and covers.

Another local and one of our absolute favourites, Michael Krishnan Jones, will keep toes a-tapping with his acoustic guitar and legendary voice. From his Johnny Cash impression known throughout the land, expect folky covers from the 60’s through to the present day, Scott McKenzie through to George Ezra. We love Mike!

And to take us home – The Noodles. Based in Wellington and the Wairarapa, and entertaining us for the last 20 years, the Noodles are one of the most selected cover bands, so get ready to Party with The Noodles! They promise to serve up a high-energy blend of Rock, Pop, and Party anthems, guaranteed to get you moving and singing along. With their infectious energy, tight musicianship and catchy hooks, The Noodles are a perfect recipe for our afternoon of fun in the sun.

events.id: Just Sew + Furoshiki Gift Wrapping-2 Forresters Ln, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Just Sew + Furoshiki Gift Wrapping
events.venue: 2 Forresters Ln, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Got a tear, a missing button, or a hem that’s come undone? Don’t toss it - fix it!
Book through our website and bring along 1-2 clothing or lightweight household items (cushion covers etc) for repair. We will have sewing machines, needles, thread, and a selection of patches and buttons ready for you.
Our skilled volunteers will be here to help with repairs such as holes, tears, hems and missing buttons. Whether you are completely new to sewing or just need a bit of guidance, we will support you through it.
Book here: https://sustaintrust.org.nz/our.../just-sew-december-2025
Seasonal Special: Furoshiki Gift Wrapping Station
To celebrate the season, we are also offering a Furoshiki Gift Wrapping Station! Learn how to wrap your gifts the sustainable way, using beautiful fabric scraps repurposed from the Curtain Bank.

events.id: Just Sew and Furoshiki Gift Wrapping-Te Aro Zero Waste @ Sustainability Trust, 2 Forresters Lane, CBD, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Just Sew and Furoshiki Gift Wrapping
events.venue: Te Aro Zero Waste @ Sustainability Trust, 2 Forresters Lane, CBD, Wellington
events.long_description:
Just Sew - December Edition + Furoshiki Gift Wrapping!

Got a tear, a missing button, or a hem that’s come undone? Don’t toss it - fix it!

Book through our website and bring along 1-2 clothing or lightweight household items (cushion covers etc) for repair. We will have sewing machines, needles, thread, and a selection of patches and buttons ready for you. If you have something special you would like to use, feel free to bring it along.

Our skilled volunteers will be here to help with repairs such as holes, tears, hems and missing buttons. Whether you are completely new to sewing or just need a bit of guidance, we will support you through it.

Seasonal Special: Furoshiki Gift Wrapping Station

To celebrate the season, we are also offering a Furoshiki Gift Wrapping Station! Learn how to wrap your gifts the sustainable way, using beautiful fabric scraps repurposed from the Curtain Bank.

A friendly volunteer will be on hand to guide you through the wrapping technique, so you can add a thoughtful, sustainable touch to your gifts this season.

No booking needed - just drop by during the event to give it a try. You can wrap a gift as a koha, or give a koha for the fabric you use.

events.id: South Wairarapa Half Day Tour - Afternoon-Featherston Train Station, Harrison Street West, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: South Wairarapa Half Day Tour - Afternoon
events.venue: Featherston Train Station, Harrison Street West, Featherston
events.long_description:
Journey with us through the breathtaking landscapes of South Wairarapa, where every hill, river, and breeze carries a story. Our guided experience weaves together the rich history of the land, the life-giving waters, and discover the ancestral stories. Learn about the deep connections between people and environment. Our half day tours invites you to see, feel, and respect this region in a way that stays with you long after you leave.

This tour is a travelling tour. We pick you up from Featherston Train Station 10 minutes before the event starts and we will deliver you back to Featherston Train Station on finishing.

Please ensure you bring comfy shoes, warm clothes and sun protection. Water Bottles are encouraged and refreshments will be provided throughout the trip.

Journey with us through the breathtaking landscapes of South Wairarapa, where every hill, river, and breeze carries a story.
Our guided experience weaves together the rich history of the land, the life-giving waters, and discover the ancestral stories.
Learn about the deep connections between people and environment.
Our half day tours invites you to see, feel, and respect this region in a way that stays with you long after you leave.

events.id: Around the world in fifteen plants - Guided Walk-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Around the world in fifteen plants - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for an easy 60-minute guided walk to enjoy the stories of 15 plants significant to the countries in which they are found.

Meet at the Founders’ Entrance, Glenmore Street
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). Or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden; they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.

Join the Friends for only $30 a year, and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Gingerbread House Masterclass for Two-Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Gingerbread House Masterclass for Two
events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Step into the magic of the season with Le Ciel’s Gingerbread House Masterclass for Two.

In this joyful, hands-on workshop, you and your partner will work together to build and decorate your very own festive gingerbread house. Our pastry chefs will guide you through every step — from assembling the spiced gingerbread walls to piping intricate icing details and adding those whimsical finishing touches.

Each station will be fully equipped with pre-baked gingerbread pieces, an array of colourful candies, royal icing, and everything you need to let your creativity shine. Sip on a comforting hot chocolate or mulled wine as holiday music fills the air, and create a show-stopping centrepiece to take home (if you can resist eating it first!).

Whether you’re looking for a fun date idea, a festive afternoon with a friend, or a family-friendly treat, this class is a perfect way to kick off the Christmas spirit.

$120 per pair | All materials included
Duration: 2 hours
Location: Le Ciel, 100 Tory street
Spaces are limited — book early to secure your spot for this festive favourite!

Includes:

Pre-baked gingerbread house pieces ready for assembly

Royal icing and a selection of edible decorations

A hot chocolate or mulled wine on arrival

Expert guidance from Le Ciel pastry chefs

A beautifully packaged gingerbread house to take home

Price: $120 per pair

Our friends from Cosa Nostra food truck will be back serving fresh pizzas and also have a range of soft drinks available.

Please note no alcohol will be allowed, you are however welcome to bring your own food and beverage refreshments, NO glass is allowed please. There will also be multiple water stations free for use.
The #29 Metlink Bus route will be running on the hour with the last bus leaving Happy Valley around 10pm. We will also contact the taxi companies to get them to provision taxis for the event closure.
We will not be offering ticket refunds or swaps for this event, if you can no longer make the event, you can on-sell your own ticket - buyers please be sure about who you are buying from as there are lots of scammers around!
Consent is always required at any event to ensure that everyone is kept safe and boundaries are not crossed. Please ask before any hugging, touching of any sort, taking photos, etc. We operate a zero-tolerance policy to bad behaviour. If you see something that doesn’t seem right, you have a responsibility to do something. And remember, if it’s not an enthusiastic YES then it’s a NO.
Open Air reserve all rights and have a zero-tolerance approach.

events.id: A Very Cantoris Christmas-211 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: A Very Cantoris Christmas
events.venue: 211 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cantoris would like to warmly welcome you to our final concert of 2025: A Very Cantoris Christmas!
The festivities will begin with Vivaldi’s Gloria, a joyous and uplifting work that will get you right into the Christmas spirit. Then it will be time to get your singing caps on and join us in singing a selection of beloved and well-known carols. From Silent Night in Te Reo to Joy to the World, this is a perfect opportunity to gather and feel the Christmas spirit through music.
Alongside familiar favourites, we’ll showcase a selection of beautiful choral works, including traditional 16th-century carols, as well as pieces by the likes of Arvo Pärt and kiwi composer Jenny McLeod. It’s going to be a night full music and Christmas cheer - the perfect way to end 2025!
We can’t wait to share it all with you. See you there!

events.id: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December-28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December
events.venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness.
Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc.. Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.
Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years.
He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer.

events.id: Kiwi Christmas in Kaitoke-Kaitoke Regional Park, Kaitoke Waterworks Rd, Pakuratahi, Upper Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Kiwi Christmas in Kaitoke
events.venue: Kaitoke Regional Park, Kaitoke Waterworks Rd, Pakuratahi, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Celebrate the season at Kaitoke Regional Park – Christmas carols and movie night in the park.
Gather the whānau and head to Kaitoke Regional Park for a magical evening of festive fun in nature.

Join us for Nick Tansley’s Carols Caravan, bringing joyful live music to the park. Stay later for a screening of the movie Kiwi Christmas on the big screen—a funny, whānau-friendly movie about Santa tuning up for a summer holiday as far away from the North Pole as possible – Aotearoa!

Warm up with marshmallow toasting, pack a picnic or grab a bite from the from the local Scouts fundraising food stall (cash only), and if conditions allow, join a guided night time walk with the park ranger after the movie.

Carols: 5.30pm - 6.30pm

Movie: 6.30pm - 8pm

Why not make a weekend of it? Come camp at Kaitoke Regional Park and enjoy everything the park has to offer—from swimming holes and forest walks to peaceful picnic spots and native wildlife.



Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of your regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Kaitoke Regional Park is more than just a beautiful place—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater, restores native bush, preserves historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers play a vital role in keeping this park special.

events.name: Soundscape - An evening with Wellywind Trio
events.venue: 3 Kenya Street, Ngaio, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for an enchanting evening with the Wellywind Trio!

We’re excited to announce that the Wellywind Trio will be performing a special Saturday evening concert in Ngaio – perfect for locals who want to enjoy beautiful classical music without the weekday rush!

The Wellywind Trio is known for their stunning flute arrangements, blending centuries-old classics with contemporary masterpieces. We end the 2025 season ends with a fresh new program filled with landscape and journey, taking you from paintings, mythical creatures, and new lands, including Debussy, New World by Dvorak, Grieg and The Legend of Zelda music.
Save the date:
Saturday Night 6pm - 7:30pm
Entry: $10 waged | FREE for unwaged
Come, relax, and be swept away by the mesmerizing sounds of the Wellywind Trio. We can’t wait to share this magical experience with you!
Don’t miss out – mark your calendars and spread the word!

Wellywind Trio consists of 2 flutes and a piano, and has been performing around Wellington since 2018.
Flutes: Elsa Shih & Bella Anderson
Piano: Pei-Ying Pan

events.id: Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show-Wild Kiwi Distillery Limited,27 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show
events.venue: Wild Kiwi Distillery Limited,27 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show
Featuring Tributes to: Pantera, Ozzy Osbourne, Megadeth, Faith No More and more bands TBA.

About this Event



Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: A Memorial for Metal Legends

Rail Records, Wildkiwi Distillery, Women's Refuge, and Riockstock present a monumental night of heavy metal in honor of two of the genre's most important and beloved figures: the legendary guitarist "Dimebag" Darrell Abbott of Pantera, and the recently departed Godfather of Metal, Ozzy Osbourne.
Join us on Saturday, December 6th, 2025, at Wildkiwi in Upper Hutt for a memorial show that will shake the foundations. This date holds a special importance to us metal heads, falling just three days after what would have been Ozzy's 77th birthday (December 3rd) and just two days before the anniversary of Dimebag's tragic passing (December 8th, 2004), giving us all a chance to raise a glass and celebrate both legends in the loudest way possible.
This is a night to pay tribute to the artists who defined a generation of heavy music. From Dimebag's revolutionary groove and unmistakable harmonic squeals to Ozzy's haunting vocals and iconic stage presence, their impact is eternal. We invite the metal community to come together for an unforgettable evening of remembrance, unity, and blistering riffs.


The Lineup
Prepare for a full-throttle sonic assault from four of New Zealand's premier tribute acts, performing the anthems that have become the soundtrack to our lives:
•Hell's Wrath delivering the ferocious power of Pantera
•Zombie Stomp (ft. Danny Rascal) channeling the madness of Ozzy Osbourne
•Angel Dust performing the eclectic genius of Faith No More
•Demon Foetal Harvest unleashing the thrash mastery of Megadeth
(More acts to be announced!)


Event Details
•Date: Saturday, December 6, 2025
•Venue: Wildkiwi, Unit 13/27 Blenheim Street, Maidstone, Upper Hutt
•Time: Doors open at 6:00 PM
•Age Restriction: This is a strictly R18 event. ID will be required.
•Charity: We will be accepting donations at the event and at point of sale on behalf of Women's Refuge. Your support is greatly appreciated.


Ticket Information
Secure your spot to witness this massive tribute event. Tickets are on sale now!
•$20 Early Bird (+GST/BF) - Limited quantity available! Grab them before they're gone.
•$30 General Admission (+GST/BF)
•$40 Door Sales/Lates (If not sold out prior)


VIP Table Experience - Only 6 Available!
For the ultimate night out, gather your crew and secure a VIP table.
Price: $240 per table (includes 6 tickets - works out to $40 per person)
Perks:
•Guaranteed reserved seating for your group of 6.
•Early venue access from 4:00 PM to settle in and have a meal.
•10% discount on delicious bar food from the Wildkiwi kitchen.
•First dibs on the merch table.
•Check out soundcheck and meet the bands (where possible).


Limited Edition Merchandise
•Exclusive Event T-Shirt: $30
•Commemorate this special night with a limited edition T-shirt. There are only 20 of these shirts being made, so this is a true collector's item. Available as a ticket add-on. Don't miss out!
This show is a tribute, a memorial, and a celebration. Get your tickets now and be part of a historic night for New Zealand's metal scene.
Full ticketing TnCs: https://www.railrecords.net/ticketing-tncs
