events.id: Yana- An Inward Journey of Release and Renewal-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Yana- An Inward Journey of Release and Renewal
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Mystic Creative warmly invites you to join us for a very special evening to close out the last part of 2025. You'll experience the opportunity to restore, recalibrate and realign your soul to its highest timeline for 2026 and beyond. This intimate event will have very limited capacity, to ensure a deep inward experience for all.
We will share in a sacred water ceremony with coherent water that has been structured, charged and infused with frequency- ready to be programmed with your intentions to release and shift into the new.
Next, we will connect with a Triple Cone Orgonite meditation, further amplifying the Euphoria to all, energising your intentions and clearing the way for the shifts to come.
With awareness of breath and the rhythmic handpan drumming, you will gently be guided inward to begin your journey and actualize your intentions.
The heartbeat of the journey is a very special 30 year old handmade Buffalo drum from Utah, USA. Yana is the beat we move and breathe to, the guide and the gateway, the beat of Mother Earth. Allow her depth and resonance to take you to places you’ve forgotten and re-introduce to you the primal heartbeat of humanity, of your humanity. 
An intentional weaving of a multitude of instruments, beats and frequencies that will take you to places deep within yourself: an opportunity to explore, feel and release what no longer serves you. As we move into higher frequencies of consciousness as a collective, we are being called to clear the old- expectations, stories, beliefs, programs, conditioning and paradigms. You bring the intention and Yana will guide you into surrender, allowing all that does not serve your highest timeline to fall away.
And as you gently re-emerge into the waking state, you'll experience the quiet and space to recalibrate and sink into the tenderness of renewal.
This journey is a sacred experience, designed to guide you through your own process. As such, this will mainly be a silent event (not social). We ask that you respect others by refraining from socializing in the space.
Namaste
Mystic Creative

events.id: Face of the Feminine-Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Face of the Feminine
events.venue: Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.long_description:
~ FACE OF THE FEMININE ~
She is it all!
An evening of embodiment. Two women bringing to life the rich depth and diversity the feminine nature beholds.

You are invited to join Jennifer (Jennifer Moss Joy) and Marigold (Marama Medicine) for an evening traversing the diverse landscape of the feminine.
Through the body and voice, you will witness song, sound, ancient language, movement, storyweaving and expression, as we venture through the feminine village together hand in hand, walking ourselves and each other home.
PS: it’s a show, you are the audience, we do stuff, you watch….
Includes nudity and strong language.
About Jennifer: Jennifer is a musician, photographer, and soulful guide who celebrates the beauty of the human journey. Through music, images, and deep presence, she helps women embrace aging, honor their uniqueness, and discover joy in every season of life.
At the heart of her work is a devotion to joy, authenticity, and connection.
She's busting with excitement to be bringing this delicious offering to the stage with gorgeous Marigold.

About Marigold: Marigold is a weaver of the Feminine, Temple Keeper, and Priestess.
She holds many years experience working with the mysteries of the Feminine - she is a Yoni Massage Practitioner, Mother, Midwife, and Witch, working with energies of the unseen and the human form.
Her mission is to raise the Feminine in all beings. The Feminine being the key holder to our innate body wisdom, medicine and healing.
She is honoured to work with and bring this Feminine offering to the stage with Jennifer!

events.id: Lecrae - Reconstruction World Tour NZ | Wellington-The Opera House, 109 Manners St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Lecrae - Reconstruction World Tour NZ | Wellington
events.venue: The Opera House, 109 Manners St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
4x GRAMMY® Award-winning artist, author, actor and activist Lecrae has formally announced his headlining tour, ‘Reconstruction World Tour,’ on the heels of unveiling the release date for his tenth studio album, Reconstruction, due August 22nd.
Tickets will be available starting with an artist presale beginning Wed, July 30 at 10am local time. Additional presales will run throughout the week ahead of the general on sale beginning Fri, August 1 at 10am local at lecrae.com/tour.
Making his anticipated return to the stage, the tour will mark one-year since Lecrae’s last outing in 2024 for ‘The Final Church Clothes Tour!’ The fan favorite is slated to perform songs from his decorated catalog, as well as music from his upcoming album Reconstruction.
Beyond the music, Lecrae has fostered a direct relationship with his local community. Last Monday (July 21), the Grammy-winner held a back-to-school drive in the heart of Atlanta alongside nonprofit City Takers. With over 100+ people in attendance, both fans and residents alike joined Lecrae in assembling backpacks filled with essential school supplies for students across the city.
As a special treat to fans, Lecrae revealed the features on Reconstruction with a one-of-a-kind mailer that went out to 1,000 of his most active supporters. Each mailer included a handwritten note from the Reach Records founder, and a QR code linking to The Workshop – an online community where fans can access early music, content, and engage to earn points for incentives.
Continuing his mission of bringing Christ to the culture, he now gears up to make international headlines with his renewed stage presence, ultimately setting the tone for an unstoppable and intentional run. The announcement also heralds the arrival of Lecrae’s forthcoming album Reconstruction – his first solo project since 2022’s Church Clothes 4 LP.

events.id: Matiu Te Huki concert Levin - Firebird Cafe-58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Matiu Te Huki concert Levin - Firebird Cafe
events.venue: 58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This sweet, intimate concert gathering will bring sweet souls
together to celebrate life with food, music, dance and good times.
Its time to gather and celebrate community (common unity)
Bring your good vibes and your dancing shoes

7:30pm the music kicks off
Matiu
As a musician, Matiu’s ability to powerfully connect with and lift a crowd with his powerful stage presence, while fronting great bands or with his solid solo looping show is mesmerising.
Looping live, Matiu's soulful roots music has a strong Maori flavor, using haka, chants and traditional Maori instruments, backed by grabbing grooves, deep, beautifully crafted bass lines, funky rhythms and magical melodies that stay with you well after the show ends, all held up by a pillar of Pacific passion and top class technical precision
As a composer, the soul stirring messages in Matiu's music are positive, inspiring and unifying.
Matiu intuitively nurtures a deep connection with his audience creating the energy that opens portals of paradise.
"I tell ya... Your medicine Is your music... Straight from the heart and the depths of your soul. You are a warrior of word n rhythm - inspiring peeps to look within n re switch the light inside their own souls. Thank u incredible you!”
Fan

events.id: S-ence presents Jasper James (Glasgow)-172 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: S-ence presents Jasper James (Glasgow)
events.venue: 172 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
S-ence returns to the Cuba St Tavern Courtyard with what will be one of the standout events of the year.
Featuring Jasper James from Glasgow this is a strictly limited intimate dancefloor experience not to be missed.
Jasper James is part of the great UK tradition of standout resident DJs who go on to international acclaim. His well-honed ability to work a dance floor and his eclecticism are what has got him there. A decade or so after breaking out, he’s now matured as a DJ and producer to the point where he has the confidence to lead his crowd wherever he wants and they always go with him wherever he plays. Synonymous with long sets and an innate ability to read a crowd, his immediate early impact led to high-profile gigs as soon as he arrived on the scene.
He is now perfectly at home at places like fabric, Circoloco, WHP, Glasgow's very own Sub Club and many more alongside a who's who of the underground scene. It's almost impossible to define his sound, switching between heavy, swing-fuelled house, fizzing techno tools and twitchy minimal wig-outs. Essentially, what you get from Jasper James are stripped-back solid grooves that make people move. Releasing on labels ranging from Optimo Trax and ESP Institute through to No Art, as well as his own Mitchell Street Records imprint, the quality remains high because releases only come when James truly connects with them. With a flurry of new music currently in the pipeline, Jasper James remains as vital a presence in the underground as ever.
Jasper is more certainly one of the finest selectors in the world.
Make an evening of it and come for a late afternoon drink or meal - and get into the groove when the beats start.
Early doors, early night.
Saturday 6 December - 7pm to 1am
Lock in the date for your dose of sonic essence.
House through to techno and beyond.

A Night of INDIAN Comedy and Unmatched Energy
Pritish Narula, known for his sharp wit and natural stage presence, is all set to deliver a comedy performance that connects effortlessly with audiences. His relatable storytelling, cultural references, and spontaneous improvisation make Udta Punjabi a must-attend event for comedy lovers in Wellington. Expect rib-tickling moments as he touches on everyday life, family quirks, and the vibrant Punjabi spirit that transcends borders.

events.long_description:
Are you ready to funk it up Pōneke?
Party band MAJOR FLAWS returns to Moon, singing about supermarkets and janitors, work-life balance, Pokemon and mythical equine beasties - all over infectious funky grooves.
Come and experience our funky original tunes that will have you grooving, our soulful ballads that will have you wiping your eyes and our novelty numbers that will have you collapsing in a heap of hilarity.
Opening act is Wellington-based Agatha Pantha, a folk/rock four-piece whose sounds range from bouncing rhythms to dark, tangled ballads to anthemic rock numbers. Agatha Pantha is the product of four unlikely allies joined by musical fortitude and lived experience, here to provide a therapeutic soundtrack to the every day.
Tickets available at https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/.../Major-Flaws---Live-At...
$10 on the door if you bring your own mop!
Doors open at 7:30pm
Agatha Pantha 8-8:45pm

Are you ready to funk it up Pōneke?
Party band MAJOR FLAWS returns to Moon, singing about supermarkets and janitors, work-life balance, Pokemon and mythical equine beasties - all over infectious funky grooves.
Come and experience our funky original tunes that will have you grooving, our soulful ballads that will have you wiping your eyes and our novelty numbers that will have you collapsing in a heap of hilarity.
Opening act is Wellington-based Agatha Pantha, a folk/rock four-piece whose sounds range from bouncing rhythms to dark, tangled ballads to anthemic rock numbers.
Agatha Pantha is the product of four unlikely allies joined by musical fortitude and lived experience, here to provide a therapeutic soundtrack to the every day.

events.id: Sonic Delusion "Smoooth" Single Release Tour-Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sonic Delusion "Smoooth" Single Release Tour
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Gate opens 7pm Music Starts 7.30pm

Too funky for folk and too folky for funk — that’s Sonic Delusion’s happy, funky, and groovy indie pop. To celebrate the release of André Manella’s new single “Smoooth” (out Friday 7th November 2025), the vibrant Swiss-Kiwi performer is hitting the road for a six-show tour across the North Island.

Armed with his trusty loop pedal and an array of instruments, Sonic Delusion layers beats, baselines, and melodies into a boogielicious live performance “bursting with more funk than folk can handle.”
With over 1500 shows played across Switzerland, New Zealand, Australia, and Germany, André has built a reputation for turning every gig into a feel-good party — “funny, fresh and funky… a welcome breath of entertainment, joy, fun and smiles” Graham Reid – Elsewhere.

From Taranaki to the lower North Island, the “Smoooth” release tour promises catchy hooks, infectious grooves, and the perfect excuse to shake your worries away.

“catchy melodic hooks that make you want to get up and dance” Amy Maynard – NZ Musician Magazine

Come along and enjoy this great gig in our special space, up close and personal.

Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $30.

Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.

Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

events.id: Summer Brass-Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Summer Brass
events.venue: Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Internationally acclaimed musician and conductor Gail Williams joins the NZSO Brass and Percussion for a celebration of all things Brass!

After 20 years with the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, Williams is currently Principal Horn of the Grand Teton Music Festival Orchestra, a founding member of Chicago Chamber Musicians and is in demand as a soloist and pedagogue throughout North America, as well as in Europe and Asia.

Summer Brass is a great concert for the whole whānau, featuring a mix of bold classics, fantastic fanfares and even the odd Christmas carol or two.

Prepare to be entertained!

--

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.

events.long_description:
One Massive Night of Heavy Riffs and Doom Vibes!
Get ready for a crushing night of stoner and doom-infused heaviness as Sidewinder unleash their brand new single Firelight, and they’re bringing the noise with a lineup that’s guaranteed to shake the walls.
Wellington heavyweights Sidewinder are gearing up to melt faces by blasting out Firelight along with all their fan-favourite bangers. Don’t miss your chance to hear it live and loud!
Listen to Sidewinder on Bandcamp - https://sidewindernz.bandcamp.com/
Joining the chaos:
Planet of the Dead – local legends known for their apocalyptic grooves and crushing riffs.

This is one hell of a lineup for one hell of a night . A celebration of heavy music you won’t want to miss.
Tickets $20+BF, $30 on the door

events.id: Caburlesque - Have A Very Merry Caburlesque 12-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Caburlesque - Have A Very Merry Caburlesque 12
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Doors open 7pm Show starts 8pm
Twas the night before Show Time, when all through the house,
Not a creature was stirring, not even a rhinestone-stealing mouse.
The stockings were hung by the chimney with care,
In hopes that no ladders or holes would appear.

The audience were nestled all snug on their seats,
While visions of pasties danced to cool beats.
With Sadie in her corset, and Soundbitch in the know,
Had just set the tables for our Christmas Caburlesque show.

Featuring
Diamante Doll (Nelson)
Cardiac Mercenary
Mistress Mia Purrs (Palmerston North)
Anubis Alkali
Jeff Coates (Nelson)
The Pleasers
Sadie Von Scrumptious (MC)

events.id: Comedy on the Coast Christmas Party-Kapiti Playhouse, 7 Ruahine St, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Comedy on the Coast Christmas Party
events.venue: Kapiti Playhouse, 7 Ruahine St, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Join us for Comedy on the Coast, a night of great laughs at the Kapiti Playhouse! Our MC for the evening is Jerome Chandrahasen, a veteran comedian known for his clever wordplay, crowd work, and bring-it-all energy (yes, “Drunk Santa” might make an appearance).

Headlining is Sera Devcich, Kapiti’s favourite stand-up star — sharp, funny, and totally relatable. The lineup also features Keegan Thomas, Rhian Hill, Jenice The Menace, and Marc Hamilton, promising a well-rounded showcase of talent.

Perfect for a friends’ night out, a festive treat, or a quirky team gathering — come for the laughs, stay for the community vibes.

Retaliator - Blistering old school thrash metal.

events.id: Graeme James - Live at Te Horo Hall, Kāpiti-56 School Road, Te Horo 5582, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Graeme James - Live at Te Horo Hall, Kāpiti
events.venue: 56 School Road, Te Horo 5582, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Experience the foot-stomping energy of multi-instrumentalist Graeme James as he brings his one-man-band show to the iconic Te Horo Hall on the beautiful Kāpiti Coast.
Armed with electric violin, guitar, banjo, bass, piano, baritone ukulele, mandolin, harmonica, and percussion, Graeme builds epic, full-band soundscapes live on stage—layer by layer—creating a loop-driven folk sound bursting with rhythm, melody, and joy.
From his beginnings busking on the streets of Wellington to tours across Europe and North America, Graeme has learned how to turn any room into a shared celebration. Now back in Aotearoa, his music continues to capture the beauty of life’s journeys and the landscapes that inspire them.
With over 50 million streams on Spotify and praise from Rolling Stone and Indie Shuffle, Graeme’s heartfelt songs and electrifying performances have won audiences around the world.
Don't miss out on this night of foot-stomping, heart-thumping, sing-it-out folk music!

events.id: Isaac Chambers & Dub Princess 2025 Tour-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Isaac Chambers & Dub Princess 2025 Tour
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Isaac Chambers & Dub Princess in Wellington with support from Rhombus and Byte Size!

After a sold-out Tour in 2023, Isaac Chambers and Dub Princess return to Aotearoa New Zealand with nine shows across the country. Producer Isaac Chambers (NZ) and vocalist Dub Princess (UK) have been collaborating since 2015, fusing elements of roots reggae, soulful hip-hop, and psychedelic downtempo.

Touring as a four-piece band, their live show takes inspiration from soulful Hip Hop, Roots Reggae & Downtempo, seamlessly layering sublime vocals over original chunky beats, saxophone & minimoog - creating a balance of dancefloor energy and laid-back grooves.

- Doors open from 8pm
- Support acts from Rhombus (Live DJ set) & Byte Size
- Tickets available at Moshtix

events.id: Revulva Presents: Global Pussy - Get Phoebe To New York! Fundraiser-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: Revulva Presents: Global Pussy - Get Phoebe To New York! Fundraiser
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
That’s right - Revulva are reuniting for one final hit in Wellington: a fundraising show to get Phoebe to New York City!

Easing you into summer, Revulva will play two sets at everyone's second home (the Rogue & Vagabond) on Saturday 6th December as a final fundraising effort to get the band’s leader, Phoebe Johnson, to New York to study a masters degree at the New School for January 2026.

After their last sold out home show at Meow in April for the Album Reminder Tour - the band hugged goodbye unsure of when they would reunite next, everyone heading seperate ways for the foreseeable. With international plans delayed, the original Wellington lineup are coming together one last time to see off Phoebe for her next chapter in New York City.

Phoebe began Revulva in 2019 in her final year of jazz performance at Te Kōkī New Zealand School of Music to throw a funky, theatrical, 8-piece hat into the Wellington scene. Since then the band have released two chart topping albums, toured the country up and down with several sold out shows, numerous sweaty festival slots, they’ve opened for international acts such as Mononeon, Snarky Puppy, and Donny Benet, as well as making first ventures overseas with a sold out show in London last month. And now, Revulva will spread its wings to the United States.

There will be guests, merch, maybe a sausage sizzle or bake sale if the Rogue let us. Tickets will go live on UTR on Wednesday 12th November - one last “I Love Pussy” on three!

After their last sold out home show at Meow in April for the Album Reminder Tour - the band hugged goodbye unsure of when they would reunite next, everyone heading seperate ways for the foreseeable.
Since then the band have released two chart topping albums, toured the country up and down with several sold out shows, numerous sweaty festival slots, they’ve opened for international acts such as Mononeon, Snarky Puppy, and Donny Benet, as well as making first ventures overseas with a sold out show in London last month.
And now, Revulva will spread its wings to the United States.

events.id: Bike-a-Palooza - Wellington-Wainuiomata Mountain Bike Park,32 Waiu St, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt 5014, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Bike-a-Palooza - Wellington
events.venue: Wainuiomata Mountain Bike Park,32 Waiu St, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt 5014, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Bike-a-Palooza - Wellington
YES that's right! The most RAD kids' mountain biking event is back in Wellington for 2025!

Get ready for an epic morning of racing (the friendly type), games, BBQ, spot prizes and stoke! This event is open to all riders aged 2 to 12 years-old. We will have 4 different courses (two of which will be timed) on offer to cater to all abilities.

TIMELINE

8.30-9:30am- Check in and on-the-day registrations at the rego tent in the main carpark at the end of Waiu street

9.30am- Event Briefing (kids and parents to attend)

10am- Race START!
Race order:
-Black Course (Timed- age: 10-12 year olds Advanced)
-Blue Course (Timed - age: 10-12 year olds Intermediate loop)
-Green Course (age: 7-9 year olds)
-Orange Course (age 2-6 years-old parents allowed to walk/ride with this group)

12pm (ish)- Prize Giving!

PRICING
Individual- $20 online ($25 cash on the day)
Family (3 kids)- $50 online ($60 cash on the day)
Wainuiomata residents- $5!

Visit word.org.nz to find out more about the event and register via our Bookings page!

This event is brought to you by our awesome Assistant Instructors part of WORD Youth Leadership and Events Team!

events.name: Seasons at URLAR Pop-Up Market
events.venue: 140 Dakins Rd, East Taratahi, Carterton 5887
events.long_description:
Seasons at URLAR Pop-Up Market
We’re excited to welcome you to 'Seasons at URLAR', a pop-up market of earthy delights and creative finds set amongst the vines.

This is our way of celebrating the incredible growers, makers, and artisan producers in our region, while creating a relaxed space where our community can come together.

events.id: Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants - Christmas session!-Workspace Studios Ltd,65 Abel Smith St, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants - Christmas session!
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd,65 Abel Smith St, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants - Christmas session!
A quick taster class that’s ideal as a fun outing for friends, or as a treat for you! In three short hours, learn to craft an amazing pair of textured silver, brass and/or copper earrings - from scratch!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. After completing this class, you will have one pair of beautiful earrings to wear away or gift to someone special!

You will practice on smaller texture samples to work out what texture and what metal you want to go with, and then move on to creating your earrings in metal.

Your class materials pack includes everything you need for the class to make a super cool pair of earrings. Extra silver can be purchased in the class if you wish to go bigger.

We use quality pre-made sterling silver earring wires, or earring posts with silicone stud backs for these taster classes so that you can focus on making the main part of the earrings and know that your findings will be just perfect.

The outcome for this taster class is to have one pair of completed earrings to wear away or gift to someone special.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

Workshop fee is $128, Early Bird $115 - ends 9 November.

events.id: The Power of Slowing Down - meditation course-174 Albert Street, New Zealand 4410,174 Albert St, Hokowhitu, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: The Power of Slowing Down - meditation course
events.venue: 174 Albert Street, New Zealand 4410,174 Albert St, Hokowhitu, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
The Power of Slowing Down - meditation course
The Power of Slowing Down - meditation course
with Kadam Birgit

It seems fair to say that we’re in a distraction crisis these days.
Or perhaps you’ve been too distracted to notice.
The world seems to be (is!) moving ever and ever faster, throwing more and more things into our path.
And our natural instinct is to move just as fast in order to keep up. And good luck with that.

Buddha is a b-i-g fan of the Slow Down Movement.

When we slow down in meditation, for example, we give ourselves the chance to absorb.
When we slow down in daily life, we give ourselves the chance to respond to people, events, thoughts, etc. with wisdom and empathy.
We regain crucial control over our own mind and our own actions. If you feel that your world is slipping out of your control, please join us for some teachings on Buddha’s advice for how to shift into a lower gear, in life and in meditation.

Everyone is welcome.

WHAT TO EXPECT
These classes are based on Buddha’s teachings on the mind, but you do not need to be a Buddhist to attend, or to benefit from them. There is no physical exercise involved and you can choose to sit either in a chair or on a cushion. These classes are suitable for all levels of experience.

Registration starts at 9:30am. This course includes a vegan, wheat-free morning tea (we cannot guarantee gluten-free).

If you feel that your world is slipping out of your control, please join us for some teachings on Buddha’s advice for how to shift into a lower gear, in life and in meditation.

events.long_description:
Ōtaki Market - December
Nau Mai Haere Mai, meet you at the Market. 🌞
Discover a vibrant outdoor market nestled on State Highway One in Ōtaki, just across from New World. Join us to greet our regular stallholders and special guests from the community.
---

PARKING
There is plenty of free parking available at the Otaki train station.
Main Highway is a perfect spot for customers to the market
60 Minute Parking zone behind Riverstone Cafe.

CASH / ATM
Some vendors have eftpos, and all take cash. There is an ATM located on the main highway.

FOOD VENDORS
And when hunger strikes, our lineup of food trucks and stalls is ready to tantalize your taste buds. From waffles to hangi, seafood chowder to fry bread, sausage sizzles, and a delectable assortment of rice, noodles, and home baking – a feast awaits.

BUSKER
We often have an awesome busker, who'll be playing chilled out middle of the road tunes.
🎨 Art & Craft
🌳 Native trees, flowers and plants
🍶 Candles, soaps and wax melts
🕰️ Antiques and collectables
🍯 Produce, including yummy honey!
👚 Pre-love clothing, shoes and accessories
⚒️ Tools for the home and garden
🧸 Toys and books for tamariki
Come for the finds, stay for the flavor.
---

STALL HOLDERS
Would you like to be a stall holder?
Join our market family, fill out the enquiry form: www.otakiwomensclub.org/stall-holder

Featherston | 2025/26 NZ Jetsprint Championship R1
Featherston | 2025/26 NZ Jetsprint Championship – Round 1

Get ready, the 2025/26 NZ Jetsprint Championship launches into action at the Kiwispan Jetsprint Track, Tauherenikau Racecourse, Featherston!

📍 Just 30 minutes south of Masterton, the Kiwispan Jetsprint Track was first established in 2000 and has undergone major upgrades to deliver an even better experience. With elevated viewing on three sides, fans are treated to an incredible amphitheatre atmosphere perfect for families and adrenaline seekers alike.

Known as a true driver’s track, Tauherenikau pushes teams to the limit with blistering high speeds through tight, narrow channels. It’s a test of skill, courage, and precision you won’t want to miss.

👉 More info at: www.jetsprint.co.nz

PRESALES ONLINE: $20

AT THE GATE: (LIMITED GATES SALES) ADULTS - $30
CHILD 5-16YRS - $10
UNDER 5 - FREE

events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
SOLSTICE FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY
Come and Sing, Sound and Meditate!

Want to mark the important time of the Solstice full moon?

Come and join with us on Sunday the 7th December for a group ceremonial gathering in Paraparaumu.

We will explore sacred conscious sounding practices to balance and align the energy system, sing healing chants and songs from different traditions, and explore guided vocal improvisation for freedom, upliftment and joy!

Ceremonial cacao will be served with focus and healing inTention.

There will be guided journal prompts around the energy of the Solstice and the whole session will finish with a full sound healing.

Everyone is welcome and there is no need for any particular preparation or pre existing skill.

Please get in touch with any questions or to book. Come and enjoy Song, Chant, Sound and Healing!!

So looking forward to gathering for the Solstice Full Moon on December 7th. Come and join with us to invoke and celebrate the energies of balance and creation at this profound time of year.

This session will explore singing, chanting, sounding and conscious voice empowerment practices. We will also explore energy practices like Qigong and meditation. All within a ceremonial framework.

Everyone is welcome. Limited spaces. Get in touch soon

You are warmly invited to book to join this powerful sound and voice ceremony which will work with Spirit, the forces of Nature and Bryony's skill and expertise in creating sound for growth and transformation.

This is a special opportunity to tune into the sacred energies and potentialities of this time of the Solstice: opening us to balance, healing, nourishment, new growth and positive change.

Bryony will invoke and work with the healing power of the supportive energies of Spirit, ancestors and our highest Selves. Bryony's has an extensive background experience with Spirit, the Earth forces and sacred lands; these forces are central to her practice and Self.

She will lead you firstly in a process of meditation, conscious sounding, toning and singing healing chants.

This use of our voices to co-create a sacred group sound is uplifting and transformative and will support you in your process of healing, releasing and visioning.

There will be time for guided journaling and intention setting.

The second section of the workshop will be a focused and dedicated sound bath which will bring balance and deep relaxation, into a sense of stillness and peace. There can be a sense of gratitude and appreciation.

Both the conscious use of the voice and the sound healing have many benefits, which are verified by science and which can effect us positively on the physical, mental, emotional, energetic and spiritual levels. A document which has more information about these benefits can be provided on request.

All are welcome:
I look forward to sharing with you and supporting you in this ceremony.

Investment for full 2.5 hours

$77 - full price - https://buy.stripe.com/bIY9Ep67A00xdwYcND

$59 - concession - https://buy.stripe.com/8wMaItcvY6oV0Kc7ti

Please contact me if finances are a challenge for you and we can make it work for you to join.

events.long_description:
Free Vietnamese Cooking Class, Proudly sponsored by Pomare Tāita Community Trust & E Tū Whānau
📌 Registration Required – Limited spaces available! Sign up to secure your spot.

Free Vietnamese Cooking Sundays – Sponsored by Pomare Taita & E Tū Whāna

🍽️ Free Cooking Class – Bring Your Own Containers
This is a free, hands-on cooking experience, and we encourage participants to bring their own takeaway containers to share the food with their whānau.

💛 Koha Appreciated
While the class is free, a koha (donation) towards ingredients is appreciated to help support the program.

👩‍🍳 This Session’s Menu:

• Braised Chicken with Ginger (Gà kho gừng) – Tender chicken pieces slow-braised in a rich, savoury sauce infused with fragrant ginger, creating a warming and comforting dish.

• Root Vegetable Soup with Pork Bones (Canh củ nấu xương) – A hearty and nourishing soup made with slow-simmered pork bones and a variety of root vegetables, offering natural sweetness and depth of flavour.

• Stir-Fried Choy Sum/Spinach with Beef (Cải ngọt/Bó xôi xào bò) – A nutritious and flavourful stir-fry featuring tender beef slices cooked with fresh choy sum or spinach, lightly seasoned for a perfect balance.

Join us for a fun, hands-on experience and bring home Healthy, delicious Vietnamese meals! 🥢🍲✨

events.name: Pleiadian Encoded Attunement Circle | Wellington
events.venue: Whitby Wellington New Zealand,84 Samwell Dr, Whitby, Porirua 5024, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Pleiadian Encoded Attunement Circle | Wellington
A Boutique Galactic Group Experience to Uplift, Activate & Attune Your Energy

Are you ready to connect with loving cosmic support, raise your vibration, and anchor powerful light codes that you can access again and again in your daily life?

Join me for a deeply transformative and high-frequency group healing and attunement experience — the Pleiadian Encoded Attunement Circle.
This sacred circle is designed to open your energy field to the uplifting and joyous frequency of the Pleiadians, guiding you into deeper alignment, soul activation, and vibrational expansion. Because I work and hold space within a high vibrational field, everyone present is able to access, attune to, and receive these elevated frequencies too - opening a gateway to higher states of awareness and multidimensional reconnection.
This is a multi-layered energetic journey that will support your soul’s evolution and empower you with tools to continue accessing these frequencies whenever you need them.

In Ancient Atlantean Times...
Healing was simple.
People would sit before sacred, light-infused paintings, allowing frequency, sound, and intention to restore balance and harmony.
I’m bringing this ancient practice back.

Join me for a group Healing Session in Wellington • a beautiful multidimensional experience for deep new-code absorption, renewal, and alignment. You’ll sit in sacred space before my Pleiadian Portal Painting, surrounded by gentle frequency music, sipping ceremonial Kakao, and immersed in high-vibrational energy.
Each person will receive a clearing and then be guided through a powerful meditation and activation, with time to journal and share afterwards.

• What’s Included in This Sacred Attunement Journey
• Individual Galactic Clearing
We begin by preparing your field for higher frequencies. Each participant will receive a personal energy clearing to release stagnant or lower vibrations, supported by channeled light language to open you to deeper transformation.

• Heart-Opening Kacao Ceremony
Once the clearing is complete, we’ll share a gentle ceremonial Kacao experience to expand the heart, deepen receptivity, and create a sacred container for Pleiadian frequencies to flow through.

“Raise Your Vibration” Pleiadian Wisdom Talk
I’ll share insights into who the Pleiadians are, their role in humanity’s awakening, and how their joyous, supportive energy can help you in everyday life. You’ll also receive simple, powerful tools to help you reconnect with this frequency long after our circle.

• Guided Meditation & Activation
We journey through a deeply guided meditation supported by my Pleiadian Encoded Artwork and light language transmissions. This works on a soul level to activate deeper layers of your light body, anchor wisdom, and align you with higher frequencies. The energetic transmission continues to integrate long after the session.

• Personal Angelic Attunement & Integration
To complete our journey, each participant will receive a personal ANGELIC attunement to anchor the frequencies received and integrate them into their unique energetic system, supporting lasting transformation and soul alignment.

• Why This Circle is Unique
This is an intimate, boutique-style event limited to just 10 participants to ensure a deeply personal and supportive experience for everyone. Smaller groups allow me to focus the energy on each individual, maximising the depth and potency of the transformation you’ll receive.
You will leave feeling uplifted, attuned, and supported — and with the ability to reconnect with these higher frequencies whenever you need.
To help extend and nurture the energy beyond the circle, supportive tools will be available and to order - including aura sprays, light-encoded scarves, and art prints, so you can continue to connect with and access the Pleiadian frequencies in your own space.

Event Details
Date: Sunday, 7 December 2025
Location: Whitby, Wellington (address supplied upon booking)
Time: 4:00 PM – 6:00 PM
Exchange: NZ$65
Maximum Group: 10 participants only — early booking is recommended.

events.id: Author Talk | Lynley Edmeades with Claire Mabey-Unity Books Wellington,57 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Author Talk | Lynley Edmeades with Claire Mabey
events.venue: Unity Books Wellington,57 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Author Talk | Lynley Edmeades with Claire Mabey
Unity Books Wellington and Otago University Press warmly invite you to an author talk featuring Lynley Edmeades in conversation with Claire Mabey about Lynley's new book, 'Hiding Places'.

Hiding Places is a compelling and beautifully written meditation on early motherhood and creativity. Told through a series of fragments that range from raw and troubled to delightful and hilarious, this remarkable book responds to the unexpected shocks and discoveries of becoming a mother, drawing on excerpts from family letters and secretive medical records, and advice contained in Truby King’s 1913 tract, Feeding and Care of Baby. Resonant with, yet distinct from, the works of writers like Maggie Nelson, Kate Zambreno, Olga Ravn and Chris Kraus, Hiding Places is an inspiring read for anyone interested in the dangerous yet fruitful zones where life and art overlap.

Sunday 7 December 2025
5:00pm–6:00pm
Unity Books Wellington
57 Willis Street, Wellington Central
All welcome!

events.long_description:
We’re excited to welcome you to 'Seasons at URLAR', a pop-up market of earthy delights and creative finds set amongst the vines.

This is our way of celebrating the incredible growers, makers, and artisan producers in our region, while creating a relaxed space where our community can come together.

There’ll be great coffee on hand as you wander, sample, and chat with the people behind the products. If you'd like to stay for lunch, we recommend booking in - it’s the perfect way to spend your Sunday.

events.name: Shots Fired! A Comedy Roast Battle
events.venue: Globe Theatre,318 Main St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Shots Fired! A Comedy Roast Battle
The Roast Battle is back! Eight fantastic comics compete in a roasting tournament for the title of Roast Regent, plus a $100 cash prize!

Friends, Flatmates, Neighbours, Loose Acquaintances... the gloves are off and no one will be spared.

MC'd by Callum Wagstaff (2022's Roast Regent), and featuring:
Richie Faavesi (reigning Roast Regent)
Alexander Sparrow
Rhian Wood-Hill
Dylan Stewart
Justin Ngai
Chris Ingham
Manish Latch
and Airguityler

Come on down to NZ's wildest venue - Old Pete's, for some great laughs and savage roasts!

Head down the long driveway next to SaveMart, all the way to the end and turn right - there'll be a bunch of cars, a pizza oven, a spa pool... all in front of the Tui-themed bar room where complimentary finger food, good music and a pool table await. And that's not even the show! Around the corner (past the haunted maze) is where the comedy (and sometimes the magic) happens.

Entry is $10, or just $5 for students!

events.id: Dying Fetus + 200 Stab Wounds + Organectomy - Wellington - San Fran-San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Dying Fetus + 200 Stab Wounds + Organectomy - Wellington - San Fran
events.venue: San Fran,Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Dying Fetus + 200 Stab Wounds + Organectomy - Wellington - San Fran
𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗴𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝘀 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦
𝗔𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻 & 𝗡𝗲𝘄 𝗭𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗧𝗼𝘂𝗿, 𝗗𝗲𝗰 𝟱 – 𝟭𝟰, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱

DYING FETUS with 200 STAB WOUNDS performing at:
Dec 5th – Auckland, Galatos*
Dec 6th – Christchurch, Loons*
Dec 7th – Wellington, San Fran*
Dec 9th – Adelaide, Lion Arts Factory+
Dec 11th – Hobart, Altar+
Dec 12th – Melbourne, Northcote Theatre+
Dec 13th – Sydney, Metro Theatre+
Dec 14th – Brisbane, The Triffid+
*Organectomy appearing / +Ashen appearing

TICKETS ON SALE NOW at:
ADELAIDE, HOBART, MELBOURNE, BRISBANE – www.moshtix.com.au
SYDNEY – https://premier.ticketek.com.au
AUCKLAND – https://galatos.co.nz
CHRISTCHURCH – www.undertheradar.co.nz
WELLINGTON – https://moshtix.co.nz

Armed with undeniably some of the heaviest riffs known to mankind, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 has established a reputation for uncompromising integrity with a slew of classic albums and today rides a resurgence of respect and esteem with a new generation. The band continually refines its unique take on death, grind, and hardcore with a combination of virtuosity and ferocity, inescapably catchy hooks, punishing breakdowns and a complete lack of pretension.

After 12 horribly long years since their last tour in Australia and in only their second appearance in New Zealand since 2009, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 are well overdue to lash us unmercifully with their savage beatdowns and earth-moving grooves and grunt, equally designed to pulverize and mesmerize.

On their first slog into the antipodes, Cleveland death metal legends-in-waiting 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 serve up a brutal slab of old school death metal with a contemporary edge. Not for the faint-hearted, 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 craft classic gore-themed savagery for themselves and like-minded brethren: thrill-seekers, carnage cravers, horror fans, and aficionados of the most extreme of metal.

Warming up the circle pits and necks will be the slamming sonic signature of ORGANECTOMY in New Zealand and the old-school death metal grit and punishing ferocity of ASHEN in Australia.

www.facebook.com/DyingFetus
www.facebook.com/200StabWounds
www.facebook.com/organectomynz
www.facebook.com/ashendeath
https://swdpresents.com

𝘈𝘋𝘌𝘓𝘈𝘐𝘋𝘌, 𝘏𝘖𝘉𝘈𝘙𝘛, 𝘉𝘙𝘐𝘚𝘉𝘈𝘕𝘌, 𝘔𝘌𝘓𝘉𝘖𝘜𝘙𝘕𝘌 – www.moshtix.com.au

𝘊𝘏𝘙𝘐𝘚𝘛𝘊𝘏𝘜𝘙𝘊𝘏 – www.undertheradar.co.nz
𝘞𝘌𝘓𝘓𝘐𝘕𝘎𝘛𝘖𝘕 – https://moshtix.co.nz

Armed with undeniably some of the heaviest riffs known to mankind, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 has established a reputation for uncompromising integrity with a slew of classic albums and today rides a resurgence of respect and esteem with a new generation. The band continually refines its unique take on death, grind, and hardcore with a combination of virtuosity and ferocity, inescapably catchy hooks, punishing breakdowns and a complete lack of pretension.

After 12 horribly long years since their last tour in Australia and in only their second appearance in New Zealand since 2009, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 are well overdue to lash us unmercifully with their savage beatdowns and earth-moving grooves and grunt, equally designed to pulverize and mesmerize.

On their first slog into the antipodes, Cleveland death metal legends-in-waiting 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 serve up a brutal slab of old school death metal with a contemporary edge. Not for the faint-hearted, 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 craft classic gore-themed savagery for themselves and like-minded brethren: thrill-seekers, carnage cravers, horror fans, and aficionados of the most extreme of metal.

www.facebook.com/DyingFetus
www.facebook.com/200StabWounds
https://swdpresents.com

events.id: Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants - Christmas Taster-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants - Christmas Taster
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
A quick taster class that’s ideal as a weekend outing for friends, or as a treat for you! In three short hours, learn to craft an amazing pair of textured metal earrings - from scratch!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. After completing this class, you will have one pair of beautiful earrings to wear away or gift to someone special!

You will practice on smaller texture samples to work out what texture and what metal you want to go with, and then move on to creating your earrings in warm copper, yellow brass and sterling silver - with solid sterling silver earring hooks or posts.

Your class materials pack includes everything you need for the class to make a super cool pair of beautiful earrings. You are welcome to purchase extra materials for larger pieces at the studio.

We use quality pre-made sterling silver earring wires, or earring posts with silicone stud backs for these taster classes so that you can focus on making the main part of the earrings and know that your findings will be just perfect.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany anyone under the age of 16.

events.long_description:

events.id: Round 1 New Zealand Jetsprint Championship-Kiwispan Jetsprint Track, Tauherenikau Race Course, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: Round 1 New Zealand Jetsprint Championship
events.venue: Kiwispan Jetsprint Track, Tauherenikau Race Course, Featherston
events.long_description:
Round 1 NZ Jetsprint Championship is back.

Love speed, the smell of methanol and the vibration of V8s then you won't want to miss the action of the V8 Jetsprints ... where high-speed adrenaline junkies make split-second decisions and hesitation could mean elevation (to an island or suspension in a fence that is!). Bring your family, bring a blanket and a picnic and be entertained by one of the fastest machines on the planet reaching speeds of 140km in under 2 seconds.

Watch as they navigate their way around the tight channels on the Kiwispan Jetsprint track which is about the size of a rugby field, all of the teams pushing hard for the ultimate glory of winning.

Food caravans will be an onsite, family-friendly event. Please no pets.
Racing Starts 9am

Get your tickets here and save!

Presale online Adult $20.00pp
Child $10.00pp (6-16yrs, under 5's free)
Family Pass $50.00 (2 Adults, 3 Children)

Limited Gate Sales
Adult $30.00pp
Child $10.00pp (6-16yrs, under 5's free)
Family Pass $60.00 (2 Adults, 3 Children)

events.id: Thorndon Fair 2025-241 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Thorndon Fair 2025
events.venue: 241 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington’s iconic street fair is back!
Since 1977, the Thorndon Fair has been a highlight of the capital’s summer calendar — and in 2025, we’re bringing the energy, creativity and community spirit back to the streets of Thorndon.
With over 250 stallholders from across Aotearoa, this is your chance to discover:
Unique art and crafts
Delicious food and drink
Fashion, accessories and lifestyle products
Books, gifts, toys, and treats for pets
Outdoor and experience products
Live music and entertainment all day
Whether you're shopping, looking for a fun day out with the whānau, or just love a good local market — there’s something for everyone.
Around 40% of our stallholders travel 100km or more to be here, so many of the products you’ll find are unique to Wellington on the day.
Follow our page for sneak peeks, giveaways, and stallholder showcases as we count down to the big day.
Click "Going" and invite your friends — let's make this our biggest fair yet!

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Gallows Tour (Dec 2025)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Gallows Tour (Dec 2025)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Crime, Justice, and the Final Walk.
Delve into the complex history of capital punishment in Wellington with this thought-provoking tour through Karori Cemetery. Gallows shines a light on the people behind the process. Discover their roles in shaping justice, the cases that defined their careers, and the human stories behind a system of ultimate consequence.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 2 hours long.
This tour contains a number of adult themes and some graphic descriptions so is not suitable for everyone.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions.
While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: James Marsh Memorial-Percival Road, Paraparaumu Beach-Facebook
events.name: James Marsh Memorial
events.venue: Percival Road, Paraparaumu Beach
events.long_description:
Join us for the annual James Marsh Memorial Game, a Kāpiti Coast Softball Club tradition.
This special event honours the memory of James Marsh, who was a cherished member of our softball family, alongside his family and father Tom.
The day is more than a game, it's a time to come together, celebrate James’s life, and remind ourselves of the strength and unity in our community. It also highlights the importance of looking out for one another and supporting mental health awareness.
Game plan:
11.00: U17 invitational game
1.00: Game, open to all skill levels—come play or cheer from the sidelines. We will put you in teams on the day.
1.00-2.00: Shared Kai, bring a plate if you can.
Let’s honor James’s legacy and continue the conversation about mental health, ensuring that no one feels alone.
This event is for everyone—friends, family, and community members. Whether you’re part of the softball world or simply want to show support, we’d love to see you there.
For more information, please contact us at info@kapitisoftball.co.nz

events.id: The Fabulous Carmen Walk Tour: Tea, Toasties and Trade-Ilott Green, Cnr Jervois Quay & Harris St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Fabulous Carmen Walk Tour: Tea, Toasties and Trade
events.venue: Ilott Green, Cnr Jervois Quay & Harris St, Wellington
events.long_description:
** FREE, but please register at https://walktours.nz/book

Entrepreneur, entertainer, madam and mayoral candidate Carmen Rupe was based in Wellington for less than 15-years but has left us a rich legacy of memories and inspiring moments.
Join us on this free 90-minute community walk-tour as we trace Carmen's Wellington years (1967-1980). We'll visit some of the remaining inner-city business locations and imagine some of those that are no longer here: Le Balcon, Carmen's International Coffee Lounge, The Peacock, Cleopatra's Coffee Lounge, Carmen's Bazaar, The Gazebo massage parlour, The Cottage brothel and Carmen's Curio Shop.

Learn about Carmen's landmark 1966 court case, her race to become Mayor of Wellington in the 1970s, and how she supported and offered a safe harbour to Wellington's Takatāpui LGBTI Rainbow communities.

“I would more or less hypnotise all my guests like a black widow spider and trap my clients caught in my web. As people left my coffee lounge at 6am or earlier I would splash them with Carmen’s exotic juice which meant that they would be back another night for more. The scent would guide them to me. Some would hear my voice calling like an eerie whisper from the depths of darkness.” [from Carmen’s autobiography]

Accessibility information: The tour is on flat public footpaths. Tours are limited to around 20 walkers.

Starts at the rugby sculpture, Jack Ilott Green, corner of Harris Street & Jervois Quay (just by Civic Square)
Ends: Upper Cuba Street

Cost: FREE
Please register (for walker numbers): https://walktours.nz/book/
DURATION: 90-minutes

events.id: The fabulous Carmen walk tour: tea, toasties and trade-88 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: The fabulous Carmen walk tour: tea, toasties and trade
events.venue: 88 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Starts: 1pm, Sunday 7 December 2025
** FREE, but please register at https://walktours.nz/book
Entrepreneur, entertainer, madam and mayoral candidate Carmen Rupe was based in Wellington for less than 15-years but has left us a rich legacy of memories and inspiring moments.
Join us on this free 90-minute community walk-tour as we trace Carmen's Wellington years (1967-1980). We'll visit some of the remaining inner-city business locations and imagine some of those that are no longer here: Le Balcon, Carmen's International Coffee Lounge, The Peacock, Cleopatra's Coffee Lounge, Carmen's Bazaar, The Gazebo massage parlour, The Cottage brothel and Carmen's Curio Shop.
Learn about Carmen's landmark 1966 court case, her race to become Mayor of Wellington in the 1970s, and how she supported and offered a safe harbour to Wellington's Takatāpui LGBTI Rainbow communities.
“I would more or less hypnotise all my guests like a black widow spider and trap my clients caught in my web. As people left my coffee lounge at 6am or earlier I would splash them with Carmen’s exotic juice which meant that they would be back another night for more. The scent would guide them to me. Some would hear my voice calling like an eerie whisper from the depths of darkness.” [from Carmen’s autobiography]
Accessibility information: The tour is on flat public footpaths. Tours are limited to around 20 walkers.
Starts at the rugby sculpture, Jack Ilott Green, corner of Harris Street & Jervois Quay (just by Civic Square)
Ends: Upper Cuba Street
Cost: FREE
Please register (for walker numbers): https://walktours.nz/book/
DURATION: 90-minutes

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: National Monuments (Dec 2025)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: National Monuments (Dec 2025)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The two main stops on the tour are the Cemeteries’ two national Monuments – the Tangiwai disaster and Prime Minister Peter Fraser.  We will review what happened at Tangiwai and especially the bravery of the trains crew and in addition, what the court of inquiry found about the safety of the bridge. 
Peter Fraser is generally regarded as one of NZ’s best Prime Ministers of the 20th century, and we explore his initiatives in public health and education and also his leadership during WW2.
These are just two of the several stops we will make.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
This tour requires reasonable physical fitness and sadly is not suited for those with limited mobility. 
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you 1 hour before the tour start time by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Stacking Rings - Christmas session!-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Stacking Rings - Christmas session!
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Create your very own ring stack from copper, brass and sterling silver in this fast, fun and highly rewarding festive workshop!

Guided by our experienced and supportive tutors, you’ll be introduced to the fundamental skills of jewellery-making while creating a small collection of rings to take home and treasure.

During this 3-hour class, you’ll learn how to measure your finger, cut metal to size, and add textures and patterns using hammers and punches. From there, you’ll be shown how to solder your rings together with a jeweller’s torch before finishing them with filing, sanding and polishing techniques. Along the way, our tutors will share tips and tricks, patiently guiding you so you feel confident every step of the way.

By the end of the session, you’ll have crafted two sterling silver rings and two copper or brass rings, and if time allows, you can make even more!

Each ring you make is completely your own, whether you keep them sleek and simple or experiment with texture and pattern. You’ll leave not only with a stylish, wearable ring stack, but also with the joy of having made something truly unique with your own hands.

This class is perfect for beginners, groups of friends, or visitors wanting a memorable creative experience. Many students find jewellery making a wonderfully mindful activity - slowing down, working with their hands and enjoying the calming rhythm of making.

Your class fee includes copper and brass for practice, sterling silver for two rings, plus all consumables such as solder, sandpaper and polishing materials. Extra silver and other metals are available for purchase in the studio if you’d like to expand your collection.

Children aged 12 and up are welcome, though anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.long_description:

events.id: Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Greytown-73 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Greytown
events.venue: 73 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To mark the release of his brand-new single “Smoooth”, Sonic Delusion is hitting the road for a special six-date release tour. Known for his infectious grooves, playful looping, and feel-good folk-pop energy, Sonic Delusion brings audiences a mix of fresh tunes and crowd favourites — all wrapped in the joy and honesty that make his shows so irresistible.
Audiences can join the celebration at:
Saturday 15 November – Lakeside Playhouse, Opunake
Sunday 16 November – Wood St, Kakaramea
Thursday 4 December – Globe Theatre, Palmerston North
Friday 5 December – Firebird Cafe, Levin
Saturday 6 December – Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Sunday 7 December – Janette House Gig, Studio 73, Greytown
From Taranaki to the lower North Island, each stop promises to be a night of rhythm, laughter, and community. With “Smoooth” as the soundtrack, Sonic Delusion invites audiences to protest the madness of the world in the best way possible — by coming together, dancing, and choosing to live smoooth.

events.name: Sonic Delusion at Greytown Up Close & Personal
events.venue: Studio 73, 73 Main Street, Greytown
events.long_description:
Too funky for folk and too folky for funk - that’s Sonic Delusion’s happy, funky & groovy indie pop.
In his boogielicious live performances, Sonic Delusion uses his well-worn loop pedal with an array of instruments to skillfully layer and create an irresistible sound that is bursting with more funk than folk can handle.

The vibrant Swiss-Kiwi, high-energy performer, Sonic Delusion (André Manella) has played over 1000 live shows at venues and festivals across Switzerland, New Zealand, Australia and Germany over the past 10 years.

“Sonic Delusion is funny, fresh and funky…a welcome breath of entertainment, joy, fun and smiles”
Graham Reid - Elsewhere.co.nz
“catchy melodic hooks that make you want to get up and dance”
Amy Maynard - NZ Musician Magazine

Buy tickets here or book by txt to 02102361951 and pay $25 cash only on the door.

Back where we belong at Studio 73.

Refreshments available for gold coin donation, including Scottish recipe Christmas cake (yes it does contain whisky)

events.id: The Warratahs at MEOW-9 Edward Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Warratahs at MEOW
events.venue: 9 Edward Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Warratahs are one of New Zealand’s best loved bands and have just been inducted into the NZ Music Hall of Fame.
For nearly 40 years they have toured their iconic NZ music to audiences in New Zealand and Australia, from large festivals to small country towns and just about everywhere else in between.
They have released 8 charting studio albums, winning gold and platinum awards for the songs that have become part of this country's musical culture since 1987 when the band formed.
Their last album "Runaway Days" won the 2017 Tui Music Awards Country Album of the Year. Their latest album “Burning Daylight” will be released in July.
They have supported several international artists, including John Cash and The Highwaymen, Billy Joel, Jackson Brown and Lucinda Williams during their shows in New Zealand.
The Warratahs have 3 times been music video finalists at the International TV & Film Awards in New York. Their latest singles and supporting videos are “Silver Train” and “Goin’ Up North”.

They have released 8 charting studio albums, winning gold and platinum awards for the songs that have become part of this country's musical culture since 1987 when the band formed.
Their last album "Runaway Days" won the 2017 Tui Music Awards Country Album of the Year.
Their latest album “Burning Daylight” will be released in July.

The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz. Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz. Beer, hangs, and jazz, on a Sunday, perfect!

This week featuring local pianist Ayrton Foote with 'Vote For Dizzy'

In 1964 Dizzy Gillespie launched his bid to be the next president of the USA. Come join us as we pay tribute to the Jazz Trumpet legend, and ponder what the world could had of been like had he been elected.

Michael Taylor - Trumpet
Oscar Lavern - Sax
Ayrton Foote - Piano
Daniel Yeabsley - Bass
John Rae - Drums

Music from 5pm, FREE ENTRY - Koha for the band encouraged

All societies which entered plays into this year's Festival have been contacted so if you were involved in any of those productions make sure you've registered your interest to attend with the relevant society.
If you were involved in productions with more than one society decide which one you want to start the evening with - that's to ensure you aren't double-booked.

events.name: Out in the Pool
events.venue: 6 Wanaka St, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our Out in the Pool sessions are regular monthly sessions for all queer, transgender, gender diverse and non-binary folks
We invite the LGBTQI+ community and allies to dive in and swim in a safe and welcoming environment at Keith Spry Pool. These sessions are held on the first Sunday of every month and run 6pm-8pm.
Out in the Pool evenings at Keith Spry have:
Gender neutral changing rooms and bathrooms, as well as our Men's and Women's changing facilities.
Recreation lanes with inflatables, as well as the Dive board open (as staffing allows).
Lane space will be available to swim some lengths or aqua jog, and the teaching pool will be open as staffing allows.
Spa and Sauna available
Music, swimming and good vibes only.
There is no additional cost for these sessions, simply turn up and pay our regular pool entry fees. There is no need to register, just come on down!

events.id: SIRIOL JOYNER - Dance, Movement & Sound-13 Vennell Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: SIRIOL JOYNER - Dance, Movement & Sound
events.venue: 13 Vennell Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
SIRIOL JOYNER is an artist working within the field of dance and choreography.
She is obsessed with language: its relationship to dance and dancing and the material and political implications of this connection.
She creates movement, text, and object works focusing on notions of mutation, translation, and code-switching. Her interests are informed by her Welsh identity, her mother tongue Cymraeg and extend to the indigenous languages of Sweden and Sápmi where she currently lives. Her work has been presented at PSi, Aomori Japan; Museum of Contemporary Art, Puerto Rico; Movement Research NYC and in 2021 her solo piece ‘Listening to-’ was presented by Cullberg, the leading repertoire company for contemporary dance in Sweden.
On this, her first performance in Aotearoa, she will collaborate with local musicians in creating a rich and unique meeting of sound, music, and movement.
Featuring:
ERIKA GRANT
RICKY PREBBLE
ISAAC SMITH
WINTERWOOD
Sunday 7th December
Vogelmorn Hall
7:00pm doors7:30pm performance
$20.00
Siriol visits Aotearoa with Support of the Swedish Arts Grants Committee.

events.id: DYING FETUS w/ 200 Stab Wounds-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: DYING FETUS w/ 200 Stab Wounds
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Armed with undeniably some of the heaviest riffs known to mankind, DYING FETUS has established a reputation for uncompromising integrity with a slew of classical bums and today rides a resurgence of respect and esteem with a new generation. The band continually refines its unique take on death, grind, and hardcore with a combination of virtuosity and ferocity, inescapably catchy hooks, punishing breakdowns and a complete lack of pretension.
After12 horribly long years since their last tour in Australia and in only their second appearance in New Zealand since 2009, DYING FETUS are well overdue to lash us unmercifully with their savage beatdowns and earth-moving grooves and grunt, equally designed to pulverize and mesmerize. 
On their first slog into the antipodes, Cleveland death metal legends-in-waiting 200 Stab Wounds serve up a brutal slab of old school death metal with a contemporary edge. Not for the faint-hearted, 200 Stab Wounds craft classic gore-themed savagery for themselves and like-minded brethren: thrill-seekers, carnage cravers, horror fans, and aficionados of the most extreme of metal.

events.id: Wellington Theatre Awards 2025-12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington Theatre Awards 2025
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Celebrate the theatrical wrap-up of the season, The Wellington Theatre Awards, Ngā Whakarākei O Whātaitai 2025, at the Hannah Playhouse.
From reimagined classical texts to politically charged reflections on Aotearoa, New Zealand, the Wellington Theatre Awards recognise the innovation, creativity and excellence of our live theatre sector and the hundreds of shows produced and performed in Te Whanganui a Tara over the last year. Indulge in art, connect, reminisce, and laugh the night away at this special evening honouring the writers, designers, actors, directors, technicians and audiences that make theatre in this city possible.
Without the support of our wonderful sponsors and funders the 2025 Ngā Whakarākei O Whātaitai - Wellington Theatre Awards wouldn’t be possible. Thank you Wellington City Council, Grouse Lighting, HardKase Audio, The Woodbury Family, Suzanne Snively & Ian Fraser, Adam Foundation and to our wonderful theatre cluster - Playmarket, Tākina, Taki Rua Productions, BATS Theatre, Circa Theatre, NZ Fringe, Barbarian Productions, Aotearoa NZ Festival, Te Auaha, Tahi Festival, PAYPA and Hannah Playhouse!

events.name: Thorndon Fair 2025
events.venue: Tinakori Rd and Hill Street, New Zealand 6011,241 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Thorndon Fair 2025
Wellington’s iconic street fair is back!

Since 1977, the Thorndon Fair has been a highlight of the capital’s summer calendar — and in 2025, we’re bringing the energy, creativity and community spirit back to the streets of Thorndon.

With over 250 stallholders from across Aotearoa, this is your chance to discover:
🖼️ Unique art and crafts
🍴 Delicious food and drink
👚 Fashion, accessories and lifestyle products
📚 Books, gifts, toys, and treats for pets
🌿 Outdoor and experience products
🎶 Live music and entertainment all day

Whether you're shopping, looking for a fun day out with the whānau, or just love a good local market — there’s something for everyone.

Around 40% of our stallholders travel 100km or more to be here, so many of the products you’ll find are unique to Wellington on the day.

🎈 Follow our page for sneak peeks, giveaways, and stallholder showcases as we count down to the big day.
📲 Click "Going" and invite your friends — let's make this our biggest fair yet!

Also check out other Music events in Wellington, Arts events in Wellington.

events.id: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking-Boatshed Apartments, 22 Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking
events.venue: Boatshed Apartments, 22 Herd St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We're joining up with Pedal Ready for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay.
Build your confidence and skills to ride safely and efficiently by paihikara (bike), explore the latest cycleway improvements, and learn practical tips for night-time commuting.
The ride starts and finishes at Switched On Bikes HQ near Waitangi Park, heading to Shorland Park in Island Bay. You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park. Note: the event may be postponed in the case of adverse weather.
Monday 8 December
5.30pm - 7.30pm (arrive 30 minutes early if renting a bike)
Meet at Switched on Bikes HQ, near Waitangi Park
Free event. E-bike hire available for $10.
These rides are suitable for people who:
Know how to ride a bike but aren't yet travelling by bike in the city; or
Those travelling by bike in the city but would like to gain confidence; or
Those who want to learn how to use new infrastructure.
Open to riders aged 18+ (or 13+ if accompanied by an adult). Families are also welcome to bring younger children on cargo bikes or bike seats provided themselves. Please enquire directly with Switched on Bikes if you'd like to borrow a bike seat for the tour.
Spaces are limited, so make sure to register here: https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/.../welly-on.../wellington

events.id: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking-Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking
events.venue: Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Wellington City Council, Pedal Ready, and Switched On Bikes for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay. Build your confidence and skills to ride safely and efficiently by paihikara (bike), explore the latest cycleway improvements, and learn practical tips for night-time commuting.

The ride starts and finishes at Switched On Bikes HQ near Waitangi Park, heading to Shorland Park in Island Bay. You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park. Note: the event may be postponed in the case of adverse weather.

Duration: Please allow around 2 hours for the ride.
Arrival: Arrive 30 minutes early if you’re renting a bike.
Preparation: Bring clothing suitable for changing weather conditions.

These rides are ideal for people who:
- Can ride a bike but haven’t yet started biking regularly in the city.
- Already ride in the city but want to gain confidence.
- Want to learn how to use Wellington’s cycleway network safely and efficiently.

Who can join: Open to riders aged 18+, or 13+ if accompanied by an adult. Younger children are welcome on cargo bikes or bike seats provided by participants. If you’d like to borrow a bike seat, please contact Switched On Bikes directly.

Bikes and bookings:
An electric bike is strongly recommended. Thanks to Switched On Bikes and Wellington City Council, you can rent one for only $10 if you don’t have access to your own. Please book your e-bike separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels

After the tour, you can either leave your bike with us and catch a bus back to the city or keep riding if you’re feeling energetic! You’re welcome to return the bike before 9am the next day at no extra cost or hold onto it for the following day at a discounted rate of $39.

If you’d like to learn to ride a bike away from traffic, check out the free Pedal Ready courses on their website.

For any pātai (questions) about the tours, please email info@pedalready.org.nz.

Privacy Statement:
Information collected for this ride is used for booking and safety purposes. Your name and emergency contact details will be deleted within 14 days after the tour. Other provided information may be stored anonymously to support project evaluation. Your email address will be kept for up to 4 months so we can share follow-up information about biking in Pōneke and invite you to give feedback about your experience.

You have the right to request access to or correction of your information. To do so, please email tours@wcc.govt.nz.
events.description:
Join Wellington City Council, Pedal Ready, and Switched On Bikes for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay.
You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park.
If you’d like to borrow a bike seat, please contact Switched On Bikes directly.
Please book your e-bike separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels After the tour, you can either leave your bike with us and catch a bus back to the city or keep riding if you’re feeling energetic!
Your email address will be kept for up to 4 months so we can share follow-up information about biking in Pōneke and invite you to give feedback about your experience.

events.id: Paint and Wine Night in Tawa, Wellington - Piha Sunset-The Borough, 162/168 Main Road, Tawa, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Tawa, Wellington - Piha Sunset
events.venue: The Borough, 162/168 Main Road, Tawa, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Tawa, Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
