events.id: Peach PRC — Wandering Spirit Tour-Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Peach PRC — Wandering Spirit Tour
events.venue: Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Peach PRC is celebrated globally for her emotionally rich, unfiltered and vulnerable songwriting. Now the Australian pop sensation is coming to Wellington with a solo show that presents her magnetic personality and irreverent sense of humour. The Wandering Spirit Tour will help cement her reputation as one of Australia’s most influential new-gen pop visionaries. Peach has cultivated a deeply engaged community by pushing pop into bold and theatrical territory. 
With over 230 million streams across her discography and over 2 billion social views, Peach has established a large presence in the music world. Her debut EP ‘Manic Dream Pixie’ debuted at #1 on the ARIA Album Charts and won Music Act of the Year at the TikTok Awards in 2023. Rolling Stone magazine says of her rise, “Peach PRC is absolutely living her best life — and she’s bringing her fans along for the ride.” Joining Peach PRC in her Wellington concert are US pop newcomer, Maude Latour and Sydney pop artist, Salty.

🇳🇿 Sip, sample, and savour the finest espresso, cold brew, specialty blends, and coffee-inspired creations from Wellington’s best cafés, roasters, and artisan makers — all under one roof.
💥 Expect live barista throwdowns, latte art workshops, tasting sessions, local food stalls, and great music filling the air — because it’s not just about coffee, it’s about the vibe.
Whether you’re a caffeine connoisseur or just love a good flat white, this is Wellington’s most aromatic, energising, and fun-filled festival yet!

events.id: FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL-309 Rapaura Road, Rapaura 7273, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL
events.venue: 309 Rapaura Road, Rapaura 7273, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Fruit Loop Festival
Marlborough’s freshest music festival!
About the Festival
Fruit Loop Festival is Marlborough’s juiciest new summer gig! A full-blown celebration of music and dance, kicking off under the sun and well into the night. Think open-air energy - blending Marlborough's summer magic with a full-scale music festival. An insane line-up of DJs and live performers with production to match! From the first drop to the final track, it's where the beat hits harder and the drinks taste sweeter.
Fresh, wild, fierce - Fruit Loop is the party Marlborough has been waiting for.
The Line-Up
DICK JOHNSON: The heart of NZ’s electronic scene, Dick Johnson is a true house music heavyweight. With remixes for global icons like Fatboy Slim and Claude VonStroke, plus Kiwi favourites L.A.B and Tiki Taane, he’s spent over two decades electrifying dancefloors worldwide. A relentless force behind the decks - and music director for Synthony - Dick brings the fire every time.
SIN: Co-host of George FM Drive, Sin is plugged into the pulse of the dance scene and has quickly become a revered authority on all things electronica. She’s torn up stages at Rhythm & Vines, Homegrown, Hidden Valley, and international festivals from Fiji to the UK. With supports for legends like Fatboy Slim, Groove Armada, and Netsky, Sin brings high-energy house, techno, and ravey curveballs to every set.
KITA MEAN: Kita Mean is New Zealand’s award-winning drag superstar, known for her infectious charm, razor-sharp wit, and high-camp aesthetic. With a career spanning 15+ years across stages and screens worldwide, she’s wowed audiences from Aotearoa and Australia to London, Canada, the USA, and beyond. Winner of the very first RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under and co-owner of the iconic Caluzzi Cabaret, Kita continues to dazzle with colourful looks, flawless mug, and hilarious timing. Quirky, kooky, kitsch, and quick - Kita Mean isn’t just a queen, she’s an experience.
PETE GREEN: Originally from the UK, Pete is part of the vinyl-digging collective Rare Specimens. His love for deep, worldly electronic sounds brings low-end warmth and an infectious energy to the dancefloor. Along the way, he’s supported artists such as Crazy P, Psychemagik, Audio Jack, and Christopher Tubbs, playing festivals and parties from Creamfields and Rhythm & Alps to Tempo Schmempo. Expect a set seasoned with Italo, ambient, and deep house flavours, dusted with disco, and finished with a splash of techno.
Event Details
Date: Saturday 28 March 2026
Time: 2pm - 10pm
Location: The Fancy Cow, Marlborough
R18 event - Photo identification will be required.
Return Bus Service:
Getting to and from the festival is easy with our return bus service. Pick-up points will include Redwoodtown Woolworths, Seymour Square, and Countdown Springlands. Purchase a return bus ticket when you nab your ticket.
A full timetable and bus information will be announced closer to the event.
Parking is strictly limited at the festival. Drop off recommended.
Tickets
Tickets are limited — don’t wait. Secure yours now!
Door sales may be available.
Have your ticket open and ready to be scanned at the gate.
Kaupapa
Fruit Loop is a safe, inclusive space where everyone belongs. If you can’t celebrate diversity, respect others, and bring good vibes, this festival isn’t for you.
Harassment or discrimination of any kind will not be tolerated. Anyone behaving this way will be removed.
Refunds and Cancellations
Fruit Loop Festival is a rain or shine event. The festival will proceed regardless of weather conditions, except in circumstances where safety is compromised or conditions make it impossible for the event to continue.
No refunds will be given for changes to the programme, line-up, or advertised performers.
Stay Connected
Follow us for line-up drops, updates and key event information: @fruitloopfestival on Instagram

events.id: Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026-Maclean park Paraparaumu Beach,12A Marine Pde, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026
events.venue: Maclean park Paraparaumu Beach,12A Marine Pde, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026
We’ve checked the tide timetable – Anchor your calendar now to take part in the 2026 Web Genius Kāpiti Run for Youth on Sunday 29 March 2026 – Raising funds for rangatahi in Kāpiti since 2011 while having fun strolling or running along the beautiful Kāpiti coastline. Kāpiti Run for Youth is a lively, family-friendly event focused on fostering community spirit and supporting organisations that encourage and uplift local young people. RAIN or SHINE, get ready to have fun!

We know Kāpiti Run for Youth helps to support amazing community work done by local fundraising partners. We have 13 incredible fundraising partners you can choose to support and raise funds for. We are very proud of them all and the work they do to uplift the youth of Kāpiti. Each partner brings something unique to the table, from providing essential resources and mentorship to creating spaces where young people can thrive. By supporting rangatahi through education, creativity, employment, and well-being initiatives, they ensure our youth are not just supported but empowered to reach their full potential. Our partners are creating a brighter tomorrow for the young people of Kāpiti!

In the beginning Kāpiti Run for Youth was created by Web Genius as their way as a local business to ‘give back’ to the community so, more than a decade on we can proudly say the event is sustainable and is popular with all sorts, young and old, the fit and not so fit. Kāpiti Run for Youth has raised $280,003 for rangatahi since inception in 2011. In 2025 the event raised $25,531 which was remarkable.

Kāpiti Run for Youth will be open for sign up early in January 2026 >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/signup

At that time, we will be seeking individuals and teams to get together to walk or run from Paraparaumu Beach (Maclean Park) to Raumati Beach and back. For those choosing the 12km walk or run, they will do two circuits of the course.

Choose your adventure – a 6km or 12km run or walk along the beautiful Kāpiti coastline. Whether it's a leisurely stroll or a mad dash to be the first across the finish, you choose the event that suits you best, and which of our amazing fundraising partners you're going to raise funds for. On race day grab your dog and your mates and head down to the beach for fun, family and fitness. Registration takes place from 8.30am to 9.45am with a briefing at 9.45am and all walkers and runners starting together at 10am.

Once your profile is set-up online, let your family, friends and work mates know so they can sponsor your efforts. We encourage every participant to raise $20 through sponsorship instead of paying an entry fee. All entrants receive regular campaigns to motivate their sponsorship efforts along the way.

Kāpiti Run for Youth prides itself on being a sustainable, family-friendly event that is all about supporting each other and having fun. Join your community for a feel-good morning on the beach. Your fundraising makes a difference in the lives of our young people! BYO sunhat, sunscreen, and water on the day, and there are sponsored spot prizes, treats for the kids, certificates for participating and free Paekākāriki Mini Pops for everyone at the end.

Checkout our FAQs over on our website >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/faqs

Closer to the event, go to our website to sign up or sponsor someone that you know who is participating >>
https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/search

All registrations and sponsorship are handled securely and confidentially on the Kāpiti Run for Youth website that is powered by Raisley and supported by Stripe online payments.

---------------------------------------------

BUSINESS SPONSORSHIP
Platinum $1,000+, Gold $500, Silver $250, Bronze $125 is available for businesses who want to support the underlying work of this event and rangatahi youth of Kāpiti. In 2025 we were grateful to 58 local business sponsors to the value of $15,125 that can be viewed on our website >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/sponsors

Sponsorship for the 2026 campaign will open late in January 2026

---------------------------------------------

FUNDRAISING MODEL
We focus on returning as much money as we can back to the Kāpiti community to those working with rangatahi. All funds raised are split 70% to the official Fundraising Partner chosen by the participant at the time of registration and 30% is retained towards running and promotion of the event.

FUNDRAISING PARTNERS
Birthright Kāpiti, Challenge for Change Kāpiti, Kāpiti Basketball Association, Kāpiti College, Kāpiti Kindness Trust, Kāpiti Youth Support, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets Kāpiti, Ōtaki College, Paraparaumu College, The Shed Project Kāpiti, Whirlwind Kāpiti, Work Ready Kāpiti, ZEAL Kāpiti >>
https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/fundraising-partners

---------------------------------------------

WELLNESS UPDATE
We operate within the Event Sector Voluntary Code. Please don’t attend if you are feeling unwell.

REGISTRATION DISCLAIMER
Kāpiti Run for Youth carries comprehensive Public Liability event insurance for a period of 48 hours that includes set-up, pack-down and during the event. We maintain an Accident & Incident Register at the Registration Gazebo and local GP, Paraparaumu Medical Centre, handle any medical emergency on the day of the event. We dial 111 if there is an incident beyond their resources.

We remind participants to take self-responsibility and those they are with when on the beach course and to alert officials as needed. It is important to listen to all instructions given on the day of the event at the pre-course briefing, and to report any incidents however minor they may seem. To report an incident, dial 027 244 9585.

PHOTOGRAPHY DISCLAIMER
Kāpiti Run for Youth reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.

---------------------------------------------

IN-KIND EVENT SPONSORS
24/7 Fitness, Beach FM, Captured By Friday Photography, Coffee to Die For, Kāpiti Business Projects, Kāpiti Chocolate Factory, Kāpiti Law, Kāpiti Party Hire, NZME, Paekākāriki Pops, Peter Jackson Plumbing, R-Line, Shoe Clinic, SignCraft Kāpiti, Speedy Signs Kāpiti-Porirua, Wellington Water Filters & Kāpiti Pure Water and Founder, Web Genius.

CAMPAIGN MANAGER:
Helene Judge | 027 244 9585

Also check out other Workshops in Paraparaumu, Sports events in Paraparaumu.

In the beginning Kāpiti Run for Youth was created by Web Genius as their way as a local business to ‘give back’ to the community so, more than a decade on we can proudly say the event is sustainable and is popular with all sorts, young and old, the fit and not so fit.

events.id: Soweto Gospel Choir-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Soweto Gospel Choir
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The sound of close harmony singing from South Africa is set to ring out across the St James Theatre in March. The Soweto Gospel Choir is a 30-member ensemble that blends African gospel, spirituals, reggae and American popular music into rousing concerts. For its Wellington concert, the choir will present songs and anthems from Nelson Mandela’s Freedom Movement in South Africa and the Civil Rights Movement of Dr Martin Luther King’s America. There will also be contemporary classics. Hear songs by legendary artists Elvis Presley, Sam Cooke, Cynthia Erivo, Stevie Wonder, and Aretha Franklin. 
Since it formed in 2002, the Soweto Gospel Choir has performed around the world. The choir is dedicated to celebrating the unique and inspirational power of South African Gospel music. It’s won numerous awards, including three Grammy Awards for Best Traditional World Music Album.

events.id: Bic Runga & The NZSO-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Bic Runga & The NZSO
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
More than 60 classical musicians will collaborate with Bic Runga and her band for a special concert in Wellington. Bic Runga & the NZSO is a concert of songs from Bic’s much-anticipated new album ‘Red Sunset’. The performance will also feature a selection of hits and best-loved songs spanning the artist’s extraordinary 31-year career.   
This is the only leg of the ‘Red Sunset’ tour featuring orchestra, so expect the songs to be transformed by the powerful accompaniment. Also involved in the show is Bic’s partner, multi-instrumentalist Kody Nielson of The Mint Chicks and Unknown Mortal Orchestra fame.   
Bic Runga (Ngāti Kahungunu) is a multi-award-winning singer-songwriter. The youngest inductee into the New Zealand Music Hall of Fame, she shot to fame in 1996 with the single ‘Drive’. Her 1997 debut album ‘Drive’, including the hit ‘Sway’, won the Tūī for Album of the Year. Over her career, she has won 20 Tūī awards — the most for an Aotearoa solo artist, including Best Female Vocalist four times. 
A New Zealand Order of Merit recipient for services to music. Bic is also acclaimed for her collaborations and live performances with other music icons, such as Tim and Neil Finn, Sir Dave Dobbyn and Anika Moa. She’s also inspired and influenced a new generation of New Zealand musicians. Lorde described her as “New Zealand music royalty” when she performed on stage with Bic in 2019.

Bic Runga & the NZSO is a concert of songs from Bic’s much-anticipated new album ‘Red Sunset’.
The youngest inductee into the New Zealand Music Hall of Fame, she shot to fame in 1996 with the single ‘Drive’.
Her 1997 debut album ‘Drive’, including the hit ‘Sway’, won the Tūī for Album of the Year.
She’s also inspired and influenced a new generation of New Zealand musicians.
Lorde described her as “New Zealand music royalty” when she performed on stage with Bic in 2019.

events.id: The Pogues — Rum, Sodomy & the Lash 40th Anniversary-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Pogues — Rum, Sodomy & the Lash 40th Anniversary
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s been 35 years since The Pogues were in New Zealand, and 40 years since the release of their most famous album. Now is your chance to hear them live singing songs from their iconic 1985 album ‘Rum, Sodomy & the Lash’. Not only will you get the full album, but there will also be other much-loved favourites. Hear A Pair of Brown Eyes, Dirty Old Town, A Rainy Night in Soho, and plenty more. 
Helping bring this re-creation to life are original members James Fearnley, Jem Finer and Spider Stacy. There is also a special lineup of acclaimed guest vocalists, Daragh Lynch, Iona Zajac, and John Francis Flynn. Together they’ll present a soul-stirring celebration of one of modern music’s most enduring legacies. 
The Pogues formed in 1982 and fused punk with traditional Irish music. They originally called themselves Pogue Mahone. This phrase is an anglicisation of the Irish for póg mo thóin, meaning “kiss my arse”.

🎪✨ ROLL UP, ROLL UP – THE EXTRAVAGANZA FAIR IS BACK! ✨🎪

🎉 Celebrating 11 epic years of magical mayhem on the road! 🎉

New Zealand’s biggest and most fabulous travelling fair is rolling back into town – and you’re invited!

We’re bringing grassroots charm, vintage flair, and old-school fun to town – a joyride for all ages! Whether you’re 5 or 95, there’s something here to make your heart happy.

💫 FREE ENTRY for kids! Gold coin for adults – that’s it!
Get ready for a weekend packed full of FREE entertainment the whole whānau will love.

Expect a kaleidoscope of colour, creativity, and community vibes with:

🎨 Unique market stalls, arts,crafts & more!
🌮 Yummy street food galore
🎡 Kids rides & games all day
🎭 The fabulous Ashton Family Circus
🐉 Burns the Dragon breathing fun
🧜‍♀️ Enchanting Mermaid Storytime
🎪 Sparkling LuckyStar Zone (as seen at Splore!)
🎶 Live music all day
🔮 Tarot, past-life readings & mystical moments

⚡ Tiny homes, solar setups & sustainable inspiration
🕶️ Retro lounges & shady chill zones = your new favourite hangout spot 🛋️

See you there this summer 2025 - 2026!! 💥 🌼

HELMET ANNOUNCE RETURN TO AOTEAROA IN APRIL 2026
"Helmet stripped away the excess, dialled in the precision, and redefined what heaviness could sound like without succumbing to clichés." Pitchfork
NYC Noise Rock Instigators Helmet return to Aotearoa / New Zealand for two shows in April 2026. Playing Wellington’s San Fran on Saturday 11 April, followed by The Powerstation in Auckland on Sunday 12 April. 
Tickets on sale Thursday 2 October 12pm from helmetmusic.com
Helmet has built a reputation as one of the most commanding forces in the underground scene. Born at the dawn of the rage-filled 90’s, Helmet fiercely holds space for multiple generations of alternative fans seeking the vital energy of hostile riffs and inventive metronomic groove. With a refusal to fit neatly into a genre, Helmet’s music creates an atmosphere best known live; part industrial, part hip-hop, part existential sermon. 

Formed in 1989 in NYC by Page Hamilton, Helmet has been crushing stages for over three decades. In that time they have only come to Aotearoa / NZ a handful of times, most recently in 2023 during their sold out Best of Helmet 1989-2023 tour, with 13th Floor declaring “a complete evening of essential music from one of heavy music’s most essential bands.” With 35 years of rocking behind them, Helmet are at the top of their game. Don’t miss Helmet in New Zealand next April. Tickets on sale Thursday 2 October, 12pm 
HELMET 
New Zealand April ‘26
Presented by Eccles Entertainment, 95bFM, Under The Radar

Sat 11 April 
San Fran | Wellington
helmetmusic.com
Sun 12 April 
Powerstation | Auckland
helmetmusic.com

events.id: Joanne McNally — Pinotphile-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Joanne McNally — Pinotphile
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
She’s a comedian boasting stage, television, and podcast success. Joanne McNally heads to The Opera House in Wellington for a new stage show. Pinotphile displays the Irish comic’s wry wit and sense of the absurd. Hailed by Variety as One to Watch, McNally has been keeping herself busy since her last tour by ruining men’s lives (and her own). For Pinophile, she’s still single, still unfertilised, and laden with irreverent, ridiculous and hilarious war stories. Join Joanne for a wild ride as she navigates situationships, revenge, frenemies and rejection. The Irish Examiner describes her trademark style as ‘joyously nuts’. 
You may have come across Joanne as a co-host of the award-winning podcast My Therapist Ghosted Me. She’s also had riotous appearances on Taskmaster, The Jonathan Ross Show and The Big Fat Quiz of Everything.

events.id: NZ Brewers Fest-25 Blenheim Street, New Zealand 5014,25 Blenheim St, Maidstone, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt-All Events In
events.name: NZ Brewers Fest
events.venue: 25 Blenheim Street, New Zealand 5014,25 Blenheim St, Maidstone, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
NZ Brewers Fest
NZ Brewers Fest is moving to April!
Lining up with Fresh Hop season, we will be bringing the all the incredible beers, outstanding entertainment and delicious kai you expect, with a fresh hop twist!

Save the date and watch this space for more info, coming soon!


Drinks!
It wouldn’t be NZBF without great beer, and this year 20 of Aotearoa’s best breweries will descend on Brewtown to pour every style you could possibly desire, from crisp Lagers, cold IPAs and hoppy Pale Ales, to funky Sours, smoky Porters, rich Pastry Stouts – and everything in between!

Visit Brewtown’s own custom Unimog Bar for 13 beers handpicked by our craft beer experts, but get in quick – we only have 1 keg of each, and they won’t last long!

New for this year! Step into our cocktail bar for some seriously scrumptious spirits! Our mixologists have been hard at work creating some delicious drops just for you.

We’re bringing in some of the best wines the Wairarapa has to offer, so whether you prefer a crisp Sauv, a fruity Pinot or a refreshing Frosé there will be something to enjoy.

Still not enough for you? Then head down to the Everything Else Bar, for NZ crafted ciders, as well as bourbon, rum, gin and vodka alongside a range of low and no alcohol beers, cocktails and soft drinks.

Kai!
The NZBF food court hosts the region’s top foodies, bringing you big, bold, flavour-packed festival eats that’ll satisfy every craving.
Watch this space as we announce our festive foodie lineup!

Entertainment!
Lose yourself in a cabaret of the bizarre, where the performances are as dark as they are dazzling.

Witness the brutal thrill of buhurt armoured combat, as warriors face off in full medieval kit in a raw display of might and mayhem.

Dance the day away at the main stage, as Welly’s top talent smash out tune after tune, all building up to a headline show from Brewtown favourites, The Blueprint.

Grab your mates and get stuck in at the Games Zone, where a bit of friendly rivalry meets festive fun, and the loser buys the next round.

With affordable return coaches from Welly and Petone and great discounts for group tickets it's scarily easy to get involved!
🎃 R18

events.long_description:
Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026
Get ready for a day of love, celebration, and unforgettable inspiration at the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026 – the Kapiti Coast’s premier event for anyone planning a wedding, special event, or milestone celebration. Taking place on Sunday, 19 April 2026, from 10am to 3pm at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, this vibrant expo brings together over 40 of the region’s top wedding and event professionals, all in one beautiful space. Best of all? Entry is completely FREE!

From breathtaking florals and stunning venue styling to expert celebrants, creative photographers, world-class entertainment, and delectable food and drink offerings, this expo has it all. Whether you’re newly engaged, planning a birthday bash, organising a corporate event, or simply love all things celebration, the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is your one-stop destination for inspiration and expert advice.

This year’s expo promises an immersive experience packed with exclusive show-only offers, giveaways, and dazzling live performances on the Main Stage. Meet the creative minds behind Kapiti’s most iconic celebrations, explore dreamy decor ideas, and uncover the latest wedding and event trends that will help you bring your vision to life. Our hand-picked exhibitors are the best in the business, offering fresh ideas and tailored solutions to make your event truly unforgettable.

But that’s not all – your free ticket also unlocks exclusive deals across the Kapiti Coast. From boutique shopping and cosy cafes to scenic stays and local attractions, our Explore Kapiti program gives you access to fantastic discounts and experiences from our local business partners. Simply show your expo ticket to take advantage of these offers while you’re in town.

The Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is proudly brought to you by Kapiti Castles, experienced event organisers who understand how to make moments magical. With a deep love for creativity, community, and connection, we’ve crafted this event to help you dream big and plan with confidence.

So don’t miss out – grab your free tickets today and join us for an extraordinary day of discovery, excitement, and inspiration. Whether you're planning a wedding, a party, or something truly unique, this is where your perfect celebration begins.

Also check out other Business events in Paraparaumu, Exhibitions in Paraparaumu, Workshops in Paraparaumu.

events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Handsome Tours
Handsome Tours are proud to present Sleaford Mods 2026 Australian & New Zealand Tour
This will be Sleaford Mods first time back to Australian and New Zealand soil since May and June of 2023, where they performed at events like Sydney's Vivid LIVE and Hobart's Dark Mofo.
“We took a year off ’cause I needed to get my nails did, and now we’re itching to get back out there and play live”, says Sleaford Mods' Jason Williamson. “We released a new single Megaton last month, it’s an absolute banger so we’re buzzing to play that live for the first time. Who knows, we might have a few more new tracks to drop by then. Either way, it’s been a while since we toured, and we’re gagging for it.”
Sleaford Mods has partnered with PLUS1 to support War Child. $1.15 inc GST from every ticket sold will help War Child to protect, educate, and stand up for the rights of children affected by war.
www.warchild.org.uk

events.id: Faultline Ultra--Wellington NZ
events.name: Faultline Ultra
events.long_description:
Calling all athletes on foot or bike. National and international competitors are invited to test their endurance at Faultline Ultra. For runners and mountain bikers, it’s a dream come true — the ultimate stamina challenge set against the wildly beautiful Wellington landscape. 
In April 2026, the hills and trails around Wellington offer six possible routes for athletes to push their limits. Beginning with 6-kilometre and 12km tests, the routes grow in length to 25km, 53km, 103km, and a colossal 161-kilometre challenge. You choose the length depending on your ability. 
The fault lines around Wellington have pushed and pulled the land to create soaring peaks, rugged ridgelines, and bush-clad hills. Athletes can choose trails that wind through Wellington City, Karori, Porirua, Belmont, the Hutt River Trail, and Kāpiti. Sign up and compete — you’re likely to get the best after-match stories you will ever tell.

events.id: King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s a global phenomenon hailed as the most electrifying celebration of the King of Pop’s music. ‘The King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience’ makes its way to New Zealand — and Wellington — for the first time. If you never had the chance to see Michael Jackson live, this is the closest you’ll ever get. From the famous moonwalk to the spine-tingling vocals, every moment of this production channels the spirit of the King of Pop at his peak. Witness the power of hits like Billie Jean, Thriller, Beat It, Smooth Criminal, and plenty more. 
The star of the show is TJ Cappola. His stunning vocals and commanding stage presence make for a flawless embodiment of Michael Jackson. With sold-out performances across Australia and Asia, thousands have been mesmerised by his performance. Backing TJ is a live band and world-class dancers. The replica costumes and cutting-edge lighting and visual display make this more than just a show — it’s an experience.

events.id: One New Zealand Warriors ANZAC Weekend-Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: One New Zealand Warriors ANZAC Weekend
events.venue: Sky Stadium, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The One New Zealand Warriors and Sky Stadium are proud to invite you to the Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
This exclusive experience will give the biggest Rugby League fans a unique opportunity to get closer to the action than ever before as the One New Zealand Warriors return to Sky Stadium on ANZAC weekend 2026. With a jam-packed schedule of behind-the-scenes access, enthralling events, and an epic showdown on the Saturday, it’s bound to be a weekend you won’t forget.
What’s Included:
Friday Night Welcome
Kick off the weekend with some of the biggest Warriors fans in the country! Start in the Warriors changing room, feel the hype build, and then emerge through the players tunnel with pyrotechnics, smoke, lights and music - experience entering Sky Stadium just as the teams themselves do. The entourage will then move up to Sky Stadiums’ premium lounges for snacks, a cash bar, and a Q&A from some legendary ex-Warriors.
Saturday Match Day Hospitality
Enjoy the Anzac Day match and entertainment with fellow Warriors fanatics from the comfort of one of our premium lounges. Included is a premium food offering, private seats with epic views and dedicated bar facilities.
Hosted by Warriors Legends
Throughout the weekend you’ll also be in the company of some of the Warriors greats. You’ll have ample opportunity to ask questions, get insights, tips and tricks, or hear a play by play of some of your favourite Warriors action moments straight from the source.
Exclusive Prizes
Be in to win some exclusive signed Warriors merchandise and other spot prizes over the course of the weekend as a cherry on top of a fantastic Ultimate Weekend Warriors Experience.
Don’t miss out! We expect tickets to go quick, so call up your mates and lock it in today.

events.id: Fat Freddy’s Drop-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Fat Freddy’s Drop
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Doing it for the love of music, Fat Freddy’s Drop takes to the Michael Fowler Centre stage in May 2026. They’ll be there for two nights performing their ground-breaking debut album, ‘Based On A True Story’. The tour will mark the first live performances since the sudden death of founding band member Chris ‘MU’ Faiumu.
Lead singer Dallas Tamaira says, “It’s important for us to honour the intentions we had with MU and playing this album live is part of that.” ‘Based On A True Story’ was independently released in 2005. It became Aotearoa’s longest-charting album with 111 weeks in the Top 40. It also won eight NZ Music Awards and took out Giles Peterson’s Worldwide Music Awards in the UK.
Twenty years later, and the band’s unique funk and roots style has become a defining sound of Aotearoa. “[Based On A True Story] was the band’s first full-length studio album and its success was the springboard for what has been an incredible journey together,” explains saxophonist Scott Towers. “We want to pay tribute to the music, to MU, and the band he established. And, of course, to play to our fans around the world who have supported us through everything.”

events.id: Wellington WikiCon 2026-2 Taranaki Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington WikiCon 2026
events.venue: 2 Taranaki Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
WikiCon is the annual gathering for editors of Wikipedia, Wikidata, Wikimedia Commons, and other Wikimedia platforms. Organised by Wikimedia Aotearoa New Zealand (WANZ), our local chapter of the Wikimedia Foundation, this conference brings together Wikimedians from across the country. In 2026, WikiCon will be held in Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington.
This event will provide opportunities for editors and contributors to connect face-to-face, helping to build collaborative relationships. The conference will also provide opportunities for editors and contributors to share and develop their skills and knowledge in working with Wikimedia projects. All are welcome, from complete beginners to highly experienced editors.
Conference sessions will be run on Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 May 2026, with informal welcome activities kicking off on the afternoon of Friday 1 May.
Further information will be posted on the event page.
If you’ve got a project you’d like to share with other Wikimedians, or suggestions for topics you’d like to learn more about, please feel free to get in touch at info@wikimedia.nz — we’d love your input.
We are offering grants covering registration, travel, accommodation and meals. Apply now by contacting info@wikimedia.nz with the following information:
Location
Occupation
Areas/topics of interest
Wikipedia editing experience

events.id: Dolores Mosquera Wellington New Zealand May 2026-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Dolores Mosquera Wellington New Zealand May 2026
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Day 1 – May 10, 2026 (9:00am–4:30pm)
Topic: Working with Dissociative Parts and Their Voices in Complex Trauma and Dissociative Disorders
Overview:
This seminar focuses on adapting EMDR for individuals with dissociative disorders, using the Trauma-Informed Relational Approach for Dissociative Parts (TADP) Dolores has developed. It provides strategies for working with dissociative parts and their voices and integrating a trauma-informed approach to inner conflict safely from early treatment stages.
Key Learning Points:
·         Identifying and working with dissociative parts and their voices.
·         Understanding the function and purpose of “hostile” parts.
·         Addressing dissociative phobias through EMDR informed techniques.
·         Managing resistance and treatment impasses.
·         Structuring work with dissociative parts effectively.
Program Description:
After many early cautions about the potential dangers of using EMDR with individuals suffering from dissociative disorders, limited methods have been offered for adapting standard EMDR procedures to this specific population. Based on these early cautions, EMDR is still considered by many clinicians as limited to the treatment of traumatic memories in high-functioning dissociative clients and only after a long preparation phase that depends on other treatment modalities. Confined by this conceptualisation, the use of EMDR is too often limited, and many survivors of severe traumatisation are unable to benefit from EMDR reprocessing and, if at all, only much later in the treatment process.
Dolores Mosquera developed (with AnabelGonzalez, M.D.) the Progressive Approach model for treating complex trauma and dissociation (2012) and the Trauma-Informed Relational Approach for Dissociative Parts (TADP) (2019, 2025). Using this trauma and AIP-informed models, clinicians can safely utilise a wide range of EMDR interventions (including BLS) from early in the preparatory phase of treatment for patients with dissociative disorders.
In this seminar, she will present her current practice of working with clients, including video demonstrations. Mosquera's deft clinical skills and ground-breaking innovative thinking teach a middle ground between "dissociation blind" aggressive EMDR interventions and overly cautious delays to the use of EMDR reprocessing.
Many dissociative clients have difficulty with hostile, critical voices. The internal conflict is sometimes so intense that the person even has difficulty carrying on an ordinary conversation. One factor that affects this conflict is how the patient deals with the voices or parts of the self.
Key Program Content:
Identify the internal system of dissociation and internal voices that are hostile and critical
How to read the function and purpose behind the saboteur parts of self
Using compassion and understanding to help deal with dissociative phobias within the internal system
Skills to reduce impasses and resistance that may complicate or reduce the efficacy of the treatment
Specific steps to organize the work with hostile parts and voices
 Days 2–3 – May 11–12, 2026 (9:00am–4:30pm)
Topic: From Fragmentation to Integration: A Master Class in Treating Complex Trauma and Dissociation
Format: 2-Day Masterclass: Three Clinical Cases from Start to Finish
Across two days, Dolores will present three distinct new cases illustrating varying levels of dissociation — including one with frequent switching and no initial Adult Self. Each session is interactive, highlighting the therapeutic process from assessment to completion.
Over two immersive days, this advanced master class offers a rare opportunity to observe and analyse complete therapeutic processes under the expert guidance of Dolores Mosquera.

Dolores will present three new and distinct clinical cases, each representing different manifestations of complex trauma and dissociation — including one client who experiences frequent switching and begins therapy without an integrated adult self.
Participants will follow these clients’ journeys from the initial stages of therapy through to treatment completion, gaining deep insight into decision-making, pacing, and the integration of EMDR strategies within complex systems. The format is designed to be highly interactive and reflective, combining video demonstrations, live commentary, and group discussion to deepen understanding of safe, flexible, and attuned clinical practice when working with dissociative clients.
This master class is ideal for clinicians seeking to refine their skills, expand their conceptual framework, and enhance clinical confidence when navigating the challenges of trauma-related dissociation.
Additional Details
·         Eligibility: Must have completed at least Part One of EMDR Basic Training (University of Otago or equivalent).
·         Certification: Participants receive a Professional Development Certificate of Attendance.
·         Dietary needs: Provided upon registration.
·         Parking: Paid on-site parking available.
·         Accommodation: Discounted rates at a local hotel (discount code to be posted on the event site).
events.description:
Day 1 – May 10, 2026 (9:00am–4:30pm) Topic: Working with Dissociative Parts and Their Voices in Complex Trauma and Dissociative Disorders Overview: This seminar focuses on adapting EMDR for individuals with dissociative disorders, using the Trauma-Informed Relational Approach for Dissociative Parts (TADP) Dolores has developed.
It provides strategies for working with dissociative parts and their voices and integrating a trauma-informed approach to inner conflict safely from early treatment stages.
Program Description: After many early cautions about the potential dangers of using EMDR with individuals suffering from dissociative disorders, limited methods have been offered for adapting standard EMDR procedures to this specific population.
Confined by this conceptualisation, the use of EMDR is too often limited, and many survivors of severe traumatisation are unable to benefit from EMDR reprocessing and, if at all, only much later in the treatment process.

events.id: New Zealand International Comedy Festival--Wellington NZ
events.name: New Zealand International Comedy Festival
events.long_description:
Every May, the capital comes alive with laughter, thanks to the New Zealand International Comedy Festival (NZICF). New Zealand’s homegrown talent shares the stage with some of the world’s most exciting comedians. You could catch a big-name international artist, or discover a new local rising star. 
Since it began in 1993, the aim of the festival has been to champion the craft of comedy so everyone can share a laugh. Every year, a huge group of comedians descend on Wellington from local shores and beyond to deliver three weeks of merriment. 
The festival offers a diverse range of high-quality laughs. It showcases the best of local comedy and gives audiences a taste of some of the world’s best acts. Catch over 100 comics performing at The Opera House, BATS Theatre, Fringe Bar, San Fran, and more.

events.long_description:
Presented by: Destroy All Lines
THE WATERBOYS make their long-awaited return to New Zealand in May 2026 their first tour in over a decade!
Critically acclaimed as one of the best live bands on the planet, the 2025 band features double keyboard players Brother Paul from Memphis and James Hallawell from Cornwall and is grounded by killer Irish rhythm section Aongus Ralston (bass) and Eamon Ferris (drums).
THE WATERBOYS will be performing tracks from their audacious new album, Life, Death and Dennis Hopper: a bold, cinematic tribute to the maverick American actor and cultural icon, along with material across their storied catalogue. From the early "big music" of The Whole Of The Moon and classic album This Is The Sea through to the roots-inspired Fisherman's Blues era and music from their ambitious post-2015 output.
Mike Scott comments: "The Waterboys live for the experience of playing, of feeling our music evolve and grow with each consecutive concert. Nothing makes us happier than seeing a long list of dates like these. How will the music change? What will happen that's never happened before? How much fun and thrills can we and the audiences have? Australia and New Zealand come and join us!"

events.id: Tommy Emmanuel CGP — Living In The Light Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Tommy Emmanuel CGP — Living In The Light Tour
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
He’s a world-renowned guitarist and master entertainer. Tommy Emmanuel, CGP, is bringing his beloved Maton guitar to The Opera House stage in Wellington. He is considered a living legend in the acoustic guitar world. The Australian musical legend has enthralled audiences around the globe with his dazzling technique. The concert promises to be an inspiring journey as Tommy strums and plucks his way through jazz, rock, country and pop music. Fans will be captivated by the diverse musical landscape he creates. 
Since his career began in the 1960s, Tommy has toured with luminaries like Eric Clapton and John Denver. He has won a Grammy Award and performed for a televised audience of more than two billion at the 2000 Sydney Olympics. Collaborations include guitar greats like Les Paul, Mark Knopfler, Joe Walsh, and Richard Thompson. 
Tommy’s hero, legendary guitarist Chet Atkins, bestowed the title of Certified Guitar Player (CGP) on him. He is one of only four players in the world with the title. Tommy Emmanuel CGP continues to push the boundaries of what is possible on the acoustic guitar.

events.id: Rock Tenors — Anthems Reloaded-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Rock Tenors — Anthems Reloaded
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Get ready for some of the biggest anthems in the rock world. Rock Tenors roar into The Opera House in Wellington for a night of big tunes and big voices. The Anthems Reloaded Tour celebrates key moments in the Kiwi group’s musical journey. 
The five members of Rock Tenors have wide experience. They cross multiple music genres from opera and musical theatre to contemporary rock and thrash metal. They’ve reinvented the standard rock vocal arrangements with harmonic complexity, so audiences will get a dose of skilled musicality as well as nostalgia. You’ll hear The Rock Tenors’ signature renditions of legendary anthems from bands stretching back to the 60s. Hear Queen, The Animals, Bon Jovi, Aerosmith, AC/DC, Black Sabbath, Iron Maiden, White Snake, KISS, Guns N’ Roses, Red Hot Chilli Peppers, U2, and more. 
The touring ensemble of James Adams, Luke Butson, Ben Hayward, Steve Jones, and Justin Wilson are some of New Zealand’s premier vocalists. Since forming in 2022, they have taken the South Island by storm. They have become the must-see act for their vocal mastery and high-voltage rock singing.
events.description:
Get ready for some of the biggest anthems in the rock world.
Rock Tenors roar into The Opera House in Wellington for a night of big tunes and big voices.

They cross multiple music genres from opera and musical theatre to contemporary rock and thrash metal.

events.id: Beyond the Bookshelves: Diversity in Austen Retellings-2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Beyond the Bookshelves: Diversity in Austen Retellings
events.venue: 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Rachel Pilios, passionate Austen lover (owner of over 30 copies of Pride and Prejudice) and Children's Book Buyer at Unity Books, for an illuminating exploration of diversity in contemporary Austen retellings. As a mixed-race, queer, and neurodiverse bookseller, Rachel brings a unique perspective to the rich tapestry of Austen-inspired literature.
In this talk, Rachel will showcase a curated selection of titles—all available through Unity Books—that reimagine Austen's beloved stories through diverse lenses. Discover queer retellings, tales set in other cultures, modern adaptations, and even Regency-era stories that amplify marginalized voices.
Attendees will gain a deeper appreciation for the breadth of the current Austen book market and its resonance with the modern world. Prepare to expand your reading list and discover exciting new perspectives on timeless classics.
Part of the Jane Austen Society of Aotearoa New Zealand's 2026 series on diversity.
Bring a friend: purchase 2 or more tickets and get a 10% discount
Who this event is for:
People who love Austen
People who love books
People who care about diversity
Afternoon tea provided

Image: Pride & Prejudice Pride flag by AmateurAusten (available for purchase on multiple items on Red Bubble)
Austen, Maths and Queer nerds unite! A take on Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice but you don't have to be an Austenite to appreciate the sentiment because Pride truly is Greater than Prejudice.
FAQs
Do I need to know about Jane Austen?
No. Everyone is welcome.
Do I need to be a member of the society?
We don't technically have membership, if you turn up we think of you as a member.
I have accessibility or dietary requirements
We aim to meet at venues that are accessible and provide for all dietary requirements. Please check out the accessibility section or contact us if you're unsure. We want you to be there and we want you to be comfortable.

Part of the Jane Austen Society of Aotearoa New Zealand's 2026 series on diversity.
A take on Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice but you don't have to be an Austenite to appreciate the sentiment because Pride truly is Greater than Prejudice.

events.id: Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Eddie’s 35 years of sell-out comedy shows stretch from ‘The Ambassadors’ in 1993 to ‘Wunderbar’ in 2019.
Ever wondered what became of Darth Vader and Mr Stevens or the monkey in the tree, did the pears ever ripen… and will God ever appear? It’s a glorious chance to ‘maybe’ find out the answers or discover more questions to those Izzard conundrums. It’s highly likely that no night will be exactly the same, so as ever with Eddie, expect the unexpected.
“In the first 35 years of my stand-up career, I came up with many weird and crazy comedy stories. The ones I like the best will be in my 2025 live Remix Tour,“ says Eddie.
This show promises to be a beautiful, hilarious journey spanning a 35-year career of thought-provoking, intelligent and surreal ideas. Who could resist?
This show may contain strong and imaginative language.

events.id: Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington-Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington
events.venue: Level 28/100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass is an intensely practical guide through the essentials of contract law, exploring such details as when a contract will be required, when you have a contract (and don’t necessarily know it), what types of contract exist and the effect of legislation on your contractual arrangements.
This masterclass also scrutinises what happens when things go wrong, including how you can get out of a contract, options for assessing damages and remedies for breach and looking at the contractual implications of working in an e-commerce environment. You will grasp the crucial ingredients required for a good contract, and gain tips to better understand and manage your contracts.

events.id: Alexandr Misko - The International Guitar Sensation LIVE at St Peter's Village Hall | Paekākāriki-Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Alexandr Misko - The International Guitar Sensation LIVE at St Peter's Village Hall | Paekākāriki
events.venue: Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The international guitar sensation brings his groundbreaking stage show to New Zealand shores for the very first time!
May 30 at St Peter's Village Hall, Paekākāriki
7:00pm doors / 7:30pm show
Seated Concert
FAMILY FRIENDLY with $20 tickets for under 18s
Hailed as “the future of guitar” (Total Guitar), Misko is a globally renowned virtuoso known for his jaw-dropping technique, emotional depth, and genre-defying style. Fusing classical precision with elements of jazz, rock, and modern fingerstyle, his performances are both technically astonishing and deeply moving.
Misko’s self-taught, boundary-pushing approach has captivated millions online, earning him a massive global following and praise from some of the world’s top music publications. With lightning-fast fingerpicking, percussive tapping, and masterful arrangements, he transforms a single acoustic guitar into an entire musical universe — live and without loops.
A must-see for fans of instrumental brilliance, next-level guitar playing, and world-class musical storytelling!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY
“Misko is the future of guitar.” — Total Guitar
“A one-of-a-kind performance that will leave you speechless.” — The Guardian
“Alexandr Misko redefines guitar playing with every note he plays.” — MusicRadar
“A mesmerizing display of technical brilliance and raw emotion.” — Rolling Stone “A true guitar prodigy.” — Guitar World
“An artist who combines virtuosic technique with deep musical expression.” — Guitar Player
Tickets are VERY limited for these intimate concerts — don’t miss out on seeing live music at its finest!
St Peter’s Hall in Paekakariki is a welcoming community space that combines timeless charm with practical versatility. Its bright, open interiors and flexible layout make it perfect for a wide range of events—from concerts and theatre to meetings and celebrations. The main hall offers a stage area with quality sound and lighting, creating a comfortable setting for performances of all kinds. Additional rooms provide space for smaller gatherings or workshops, making the venue adaptable to many needs. Whether you’re attending a lively show or a community meeting, St Peter’s Hall offers a warm, inviting atmosphere that truly brings people together.

Come immerse yourself in the captivating world of vinyl records at our 4th Annual Record Convention - set to become world-famous in New Zealand. Featuring a specially curated playlist of the good, the bad, the obscure, and the cringe of NZ music! Bound to be something for everyone.

Nah, jokes. All the music will be sweet as.

This is the perfect way to celebrate the culmination of NZ Music Month with like-minded individuals.

At this event, you'll experience a mind-blowing convergence of vendors from up and down the motu, which promises to be bigger than the both of us, with 10000s of records for sale.

Don't miss this unparalleled opportunity to connect with fellow music enthusiasts, discover hidden gems, and vibe with the beats that define our culture and identity.

This year, we are adding a VIP Early Bird hour, 9-10, for $6

Fusing classical precision with elements of jazz, rock, and modern fingerstyle, his performances are both technically astonishing and deeply moving.
Misko’s self-taught, boundary-pushing approach has captivated millions online, earning him a massive global following and praise from some of the world’s top music publications. With lightning-fast fingerpicking, percussive tapping, and masterful arrangements, he transforms a single acoustic guitar into an entire musical universe — live and without loops.
A must-see for fans of instrumental brilliance, next-level guitar playing, and world-class musical storytelling!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY
“Misko is the future of guitar.” — Total Guitar
“A one-of-a-kind performance that will leave you speechless.” — The Guardian
“Alexandr Misko redefines guitar playing with every note he plays.” — MusicRadar
“A mesmerizing display of technical brilliance and raw emotion.” — Rolling Stone “A true guitar prodigy.” — Guitar World
“An artist who combines virtuosic technique with deep musical expression.” — Guitar Player
Tickets are VERY limited for these intimate concerts — don’t miss out on seeing live music at its finest!
Old St Paul’s is a stunning example of Gothic Revival architecture, constructed entirely from native timbers and consecrated in 1866. Its soaring wooden arches, stained glass windows, and rich acoustics make it a sought-after venue for a variety of events. The church offers seating for up to 460 guests, with facilities including a grand piano, organ, and a bar licence. While on-site catering isn't available, nearby venues such as Loaves & Fishes Hall, the Royal Society of New Zealand, and the Thistle Inn provide excellent options for receptions and gatherings. Located at 34 Mulgrave Street in Thorndon, Old St Paul’s is easily accessible by public transport and offers a serene setting for weddings, concerts, memorials, and other significant events.

Fusing classical precision with elements of jazz, rock, and modern fingerstyle, his performances are both technically astonishing and deeply moving.
Misko’s self-taught, boundary-pushing approach has captivated millions online, earning him a massive global following and praise from some of the world’s top music publications.

events.id: Getdown Services - Australia & New Zealand 2026-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Getdown Services - Australia & New Zealand 2026
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Meet Getdown Services – your new favourite band and one of the UK’s hottest word-of-mouth acts! The brilliantly offbeat cult British duo has been turning heads across Britain and Europe with their balls-to-the-walls live shows, tongue-in-cheek wit, razor-sharp lyrics and infectious disco-fuelled grooves, teetering between chaos and genius. And now, after selling out tours across the UK and Europe, they’re bringing their riotous show down under for the first time in May/June 2026 – with shows in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Auckland and Wellington, presented by I OH YOU and MG Live. 
Tickets go on sale Friday 14 November at 10.00am local time, with MG Live presale commencing Thursday 13 November at 10.00am local time. Sign up for early access to the MG Live presale here.               
“I reckon we get people asking us to come to Australia probably every day, and everyone in England is moving there, so will be good to see what all the fuss is about.

“Always been one of those places where you’re like, ‘Fair enough, but I can’t be arsed with that. It looks mad – there’s snakes and also it takes 40 hours to get there.’ Will be good fun, though! Went to New Zealand to see a mate of ours get married a few years ago and thought it was a lovely country and I really liked those pies they have. It felt quite similar to the UK in a lot of ways, so playing gigs there should be fun!”
Getdown Services

For those in the know, Bristol-based duo Josh Law and Ben Sadler – aka Getdown Services – are THE must-see new act of the year. And if you don’t know yet, you will soon … and you’ll wish you got in early! Named as “one to watch” at this year’s Glastonbury Festival and dubbed (by the band themselves) “Britain’s Best Band”, their live shows are equal parts smart, sweaty and gloriously unhinged. Their sound is a wild blend of scrappy indie disco, twisted funk and post-punk energy, turning the absurdity of modern Britain into dancefloor gold.        
 
The pair met at school in Minehead, Somerset and now make music together at home in Bristol – churning out what Rolling Stone called “power disco with unrepentant silliness” with a healthy dose of satire and swagger. Their highly lauded debut album Crisps (Breakfast Records, 2023) showcased their eclectic danceable grooves and biting social commentary, and a mix of sharp, funny social observations wrapped in irresistible, funk-fuelled rhythms. Follow-up EPs Your Medal’s In The Post, Crumbs and latest, Primordial Slot Machine, cemented their cult status, alongside an arsenal of red-hot singles – including James Bay’s Hat, Dog Dribble, I Got Views and Eat Quiche, Sleep, Repeat.   
 
 “Getdown Services are unrepentantly silly and constantly deliver one of the most joyously deranged live shows – just one of the best live bands out there!”
 Rolling Stone
“Their live show is as daft and as exhilarating as they come. Five stars.”
 Buzz Magazine
 
 “Genuine contenders to being the most exciting and interesting band in the UK right now.”
 CLASH

 Getdown Services look set to gobble up the world, one crumb at a time. Whether you’re into danceable chaos, satirical genius or just want to be ahead of the curve, Getdown Services are the band you didn’t know you needed – until now! Britain’s favourite new band are about to become yours too! 

MG LIVE TERMS OF SALE

https://mg.live/termsofsale

events.id: Professor Brian Cox: Emergence-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Professor Brian Cox: Emergence
events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s a stage show that covers vast rivers of galaxies in the cosmos, the ecosystems of Earth, and the structure of the human brain. Emergence is the latest show by English physicist, presenter, and personality Professor Brian Cox. He takes to the stage at TSB Arena to contemplate the dazzling complexity of the universe and how it’s built on profoundly simple principles. 
Emergence is also a scientific history of 400 years of human discovery. How did we come to understand so much about the cosmos? Guided by mathematics, curiosity, and an aesthetic sense of symmetry, our species has begun to read the story of the Universe. We’ve started to carry our spacecraft to the edge of the solar system and outwards to the stars. Brian’s engaging style makes these questions come to life. The audience will be left awestruck and thrilled as the show covers vast topics in an accessible way. 
Brian has appeared in many landmark science programs for BBC radio and television over the last 15 years, from the Peabody Award-winning Wonders of the Solar System to the worldwide hit series The Planets. His previous touring show, Horizons, was performed to nearly half a million people across the world.

events.id: The Marriage of Figaro-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Marriage of Figaro
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Written when Mozart was operating at the top of his powers, The Marriage of Figaro is considered one of the great operas. New Zealand Opera’s production in 2026 promises to bring the 240-year-old masterpiece to life in a sumptuous setting. 
Picking up narratively where The Barber of Seville left off, The Marriage of Figaro is renowned for its wit and musical sophistication. It follows Figaro and his bride-to-be, Susannah, on their wedding day. Figaro’s employer, Count Almaviva, tries to seduce Susanna, so the engaged couple seek revenge. The cast boasts an unbelievable wealth of talent from Aotearoa and Australia, including runner-up at the 2022 Lexus Song Quest Felicity Tompkins, Julien Van Mellaerts, and James Clayton. 
Trans-Tasman creative duo Lindy Hume and Tracy Grant Lord take the helm with direction and design while Orchestra Wellington and conductor James Judd lead from the pit. This season offers opera at its most gorgeous, its most vivid, its most unforgettable.

events.id: Melanie Bracewell — Dilly Dallying-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Melanie Bracewell — Dilly Dallying
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Melanie Bracewell is back with a brand-new hour-long show. It took a long time to write because she got distracted by a Sudoku puzzle. Melanie Bracewell — Dilly Dallying is about procrastination. Come along (don’t be late) to hear the Kiwi comic’s hilarious observations about avoidance. The UK comedy guide Chortle described Melanie as a “phenomenal storyteller”. Expect some wild stories as she dissects why she ‘puts things off’ for another day. 
Stand-up comedy, radio announcing, radio producer, script writing — Melanie Bracewell has found success in multiple disciplines. Her TV appearances include ‘The Cheap Seats,’ ‘Taskmaster’ (NZ), ‘Have You Been Paying Attention,’ and ‘Thank God You’re Here.’ She has won multiple awards as well, including the Billy T Award for the country’s best emerging comedian in 2018. The same year, she won Breakthrough Comedian of the Year at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards.

events.id: Peter Hook and The Light-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Peter Hook and The Light
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Bassist Peter Hook has intimate knowledge of the music of bands Joy Division and New Order. He’s one of the founding members of both British new wave bands. In July 2026, he is bringing his band The Light to The Opera House in Wellington. Together they will perform New Order’s album ‘Get Ready’ in full to celebrate its 25th anniversary. To make the concert even better, they will also perform a selection of greatest hits from Joy Division’s and New Order’s back catalogue. Get ready to enjoy songs like Disorder, Shadowplay, Transmission, Love Will Tear Us Apart, Blue Monday, and True Faith. 
The dark and ethereal sound of Joy Division and New Order ushered in the post-punk era and continue to be influential in the rock music scene. Peter Hook and The Light are careful to meticulously recreate their music in a live setting. Audiences are in for a show where treasured songs are played with the passion and energy they deserve.

events.id: Postmodern Jukebox — The Future is Vintage-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Postmodern Jukebox — The Future is Vintage
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The world’s foremost purveyors of time-twisting hits, Postmodern Jukebox, return to Wellington for one highly anticipated show at The Opera House. 
Founded in New York, the trailblazing troupe made up of singers, dancers, and instrumentalists brings their brand new ‘The Future is Vintage’ tour to New Zealand shores. Concertgoers can expect to enter a parallel musical universe where modern-day earworms and iconic pop tracks are reimagined. Expect everything from 70s rock classics and 80s Britpop hits to current chart-toppers, movie and video game soundtracks. Dress in your vintage best for the full time-travel experience. 
“We’re humbly presenting our own unique vision of a spectacular future; one that is built upon the timeless musical genres of the past and the authentically human spirit of creativity that inspired them,” says PMJ founder and arranger, Scott Bradlee. 
Come and be swept away by the romance and swagger of the past while enjoying your favourite tunes from now.
events.description:
The world’s foremost purveyors of time-twisting hits, Postmodern Jukebox, return to Wellington for one highly anticipated show at The Opera House.
Founded in New York, the trailblazing troupe made up of singers, dancers, and instrumentalists brings their brand new ‘The Future is Vintage’ tour to New Zealand shores.
Concertgoers can expect to enter a parallel musical universe where modern-day earworms and iconic pop tracks are reimagined.
Expect everything from 70s rock classics and 80s Britpop hits to current chart-toppers, movie and video game soundtracks.
Dress in your vintage best for the full time-travel experience.

events.id: Dita Von Teese-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Dita Von Teese
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
With her signature mystery and old-Hollywood glamour, Dita Von Teese is a global icon in the world of burlesque. She’s bringing an exciting new show to The Opera House in August. ‘Nocturnelle’ is a sensual spectacle inspired by the golden age of magic. It blends sophisticated striptease with the art of illusion for an unforgettable evening. Dita is accompanied by an ensemble of hand-picked neo-burlesque artists, so expect to be dazzled. 
Dita Von Teese is considered to have set the benchmark for American burlesque. The exotic and provocative art form has advanced under her unrivalled artistry and flair. The performer, creative director, and choreographer has sold out some of the world’s grandest venues, from Shanghai to New York. She is also a designer, collaborator, and entrepreneur. She’s forayed into fashion, beauty, music, and publishing.

events.id: Suzanne Vega-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Suzanne Vega
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Widely regarded as one of the foremost songwriters of her generation, Suzanne Vega emerged as a leading figure of the folk revival of the early 1980s. Four decades later, she is still writing and singing great songs. In her Wellington show, Suzanne will perform a career-spanning set. See her on stage at St James Theatre performing favourites like Tom’s Diner, Luka, Marlene On The Wall, and plenty more. There’ll also be new songs from her 2025 album, ‘Flying with Angels’. Joining her on stage will be longtime guitarist, Gerry Leonard, and cellist Stephanie Winters. 
Since the release of her self-titled, critically acclaimed 1985 debut album, Suzanne Vega has played to sold-out concerts across the world. She is a masterful storyteller who, according to one The New York Times critique, “observes the world with a clinically poetic eye.” Her song lyrics often focus on city life, ordinary people, and real-world subjects. They are notably succinct, understated, and immediately recognisable.

See her on stage at St James Theatre performing favourites like Tom’s Diner, Luka, Marlene On The Wall, and plenty more.
There’ll also be new songs from her 2025 album, ‘Flying with Angels’.

events.id: Cornelia Parker-City Gallery Wellington-Wellington NZ
events.name: Cornelia Parker
events.venue: City Gallery Wellington
events.long_description:
After three years of closure, the newly renovated and strengthened City Gallery Wellington Te Whare Toi will host the art of Cornelia Parker. The English visual artist is best known for her innovative and contemporary sculpture and installation art. Her large-scale, immersive installations explore themes of destruction and reconstruction, transformation and metamorphosis. Objects are exploded, crushed, and suspended in a world upended and remade anew.
Curated by independent UK-based curator Andrea Schlieker and City Gallery Wellington’s Senior Curator Aaron Lister, City Gallery Wellington's exhibition will encompass Parker’s long career as an artist. This includes an immersive sound and light installation, ‘Stolen Thunder’. The work gathers the sounds of approaching storms from around the globe and across time. The exhibition will also showcase her paintings, photos, films, and sculptures.
“I have always said this is the one exhibition I want to do before I die,” said Charlotte Davy, Ringatohu Toi Director Art and City Gallery Wellington. “I have been following Cornelia Parker’s work for the last twenty years. Bringing her mischievous, dark, and literally explosive work to Wellington is incredible.” 
Parker’s work often fills entire rooms and invites the viewer to move through and around the art. Given its physical scale, the blank canvas of the reopened gallery offers the perfect opportunity to host the exhibition. The exhibition will kick off in October 2026, carrying through to March 2027. 
Charlotte notes the exhibition’s themes are also of particular relevance to Wellington. “I hope that the exhibition and our return to Te Ngākau Civic Square will reflect our city and also help remake it. We are looking forward to opening with a bang.”
Hero image: © Cornelia Parker. Courtesy of the artist and Frith Street Gallery, London
events.description:

“I have been following Cornelia Parker’s work for the last twenty years.
Bringing her mischievous, dark, and literally explosive work to Wellington is incredible.” Parker’s work often fills entire rooms and invites the viewer to move through and around the art.

events.id: Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki-Level 2/57 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki
events.venue: Level 2/57 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us in person to discuss Emiko, a contemporary version of Jane Austen's Emma set in Canada.
(Order your copy through us by 20 March 2026 for delivery at the 23 May meeting or couriered in NZ)
About Emiko:
A busybody foodie avoids questions of her own future as she meddles in the love lives of those around her. Has this matcha-maker met her match?

Self-declared matchmaking GENIUS (a la Beyonce) Emiko Kimori has already found success by helping her aunt find true love, so when the new girl in town becomes her new BFF, it's only natural for Emiko to help set her up for social success with a suitable love match.

Emiko lives with her Ojiichan in a small town on BC's West Coast surrounded by friends and neighbors, including her childhood friend Kenzo Sanada, who wishes she'd spend less time playing matchmaker. But Emiko can so clearly see who belongs together, even when her targets don't know it themselves. She simply has to meddle - for the sake of true love!

As for her own romantic life though . . . who has time for that? Emiko is far too busy with her matchmaking schemes, her brunch recipes, volunteering, her bustling social life, keeping up her grades, eating said brunch recipes and making plans for after graduation. Plans she will absolutely decide on soon. Definitely. Maybe? But when Emiko ends up falling for the last person she expects, she finds herself caught in the tangled web of her own love matches. For the first time, instead of arranging from afar, Emiko has to figure out what it means to be in love herself, and that friendship and romance are more complicated than she ever imagined . . .
About the Author:
Chieri Uegaki is a second generation Japanese-Canadian and award-winning children’s author living and writing on Vancouver Island, in the traditional and unceded territory of the lək̓ʷəŋən speaking peoples, today known as the Esquimalt and Songhees Nations.
She graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of British Columbia’s Creative Writing Department and has written a number of stories for children, including the picture books Suki’s Kimono and Rosie and Buttercup (both illustrated by Stéphane Jorisch); Hana Hashimoto, Sixth Violin (illustrated by Qin Leng); and Ojiichan’s Gift (illustrated by Genevieve Simms).
When not reading or writing, Chieri consumes rom-coms and mysteries in any form, chooses appetizers over dessert most of the time, and tries to stay on top of her collecting problem. She is currently working on a number of projects.
Rachel Pilois (Book Buyer) on this selection:
There have been many retellings of Austen’s novels in the last 200 years. Pride and Prejudice easily wins the prize of Austen’s most adapted novel in both film and literature. In the last 20 years there’s been a noticeable growth in culturally (and gender) diverse takes on Austen’s work, with the most popular retellings being of Indian (i.e Bride and Prejudice) or African-American (i.e. Ibi Zoboi’s Pride) heritage. Sadly, some of her less popular novels (Mansfield Park and Northanger Abbey) have few adaptations in both film and literature, faithful or modern retelling.
With the 2026 theme of the JASNZ being diversity it made sense to choose a slightly less popular novel (only in terms of how many adaptations) and a slightly less common culture used in Austen retellings. Thus I settled on the upcoming YA novel Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, a Japanese-Canadian retelling of Emma.
Emma is a much beloved story and a much beloved character, who’s thoughts, actions and motivations are very recognisable in a modern teenager. Adding in the deep cultural etiquette of Japan as a likeness to the rules of regency society, makes Uegaki’s Emiko a brilliant and well thought out modern retelling of the Emma.
As it publishes on 9 September 2025, we can discover and discuss this new and exciting adaptation for the first time together! 
NB: Ticket numbers are limited to ensure ease of discussion. Afternoon tea is provided
FRIEND: bring a friend, get 10% off! Discount automatically applied

Emiko lives with her Ojiichan in a small town on BC's West Coast surrounded by friends and neighbors, including her childhood friend Kenzo Sanada, who wishes she'd spend less time playing matchmaker.
But when Emiko ends up falling for the last person she expects, she finds herself caught in the tangled web of her own love matches.

events.venue: TSB Arena,4 Queens Wharf, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Go Green Expo 2026
TSB ARENA • Saturday 7th & Sunday 8th November

About this Event


FREE Tickets Available Online Now!
$5 adult door sales available upon entry
Children under 16 are free
Win Spot Prizes just by being there from 2pm – 4pm
Expo Info - 10am - 5pm Saturday & 10am - 4pm Sunday

**1 Hour of FREE Parking on Us with any Expo purchase!!**
Park conveniently in the TSB Arena car park and get your first hour free!*
*simply see the ticketing staff on your way out to validate your parking ticket.

New Zealand’s Largest Green Living & Sustainable Lifestyle Show! This is your one stop shop for everything you need to live a sustainable life.
Eco home/building, food and beverages, advisory services, supplements, organic products, health and wellness, beauty and personal care, household products, pet products, gardening, grocery and many more categories are showcased at this fantastic event that is not to be missed!
A large, diverse range of companies and brands cannot wait to transform your way of life, in favour of the environment and you!
This show is dedicated to promoting a healthy, environmentally friendly, sustainable lifestyle for New Zealanders.

events.id: Wellington Wild Coffee & Tea Workshop, forage, cook and taste + Healthy potluck-berhampore island community orchard,Community Orchard, Adelaide Rd, Berhampore, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Wild Coffee & Tea Workshop, forage, cook and taste + Healthy potluck
events.venue: berhampore island community orchard,Community Orchard, Adelaide Rd, Berhampore, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Wild Coffee & Tea Workshop, forage, cook and taste + Healthy potluck
Foraging and Growing Workshops coming to Wellington. No need for prior knowledge we will learn everything from scratch.

Workshop description:

Come to enjoy learning over a foraged cuppa with a fun and hands-on workshop all about wild coffee and tea! We’ll head out to forage for plants that can be used as a coffee alternative, then cook, brew, and taste our way through the process together.
You’ll learn how to spot potential coffee subs in nature, prep them from scratch, and sip your way through a few different brews. Tasting is a big part of this one—so come hungry and curious!
No experience needed—just bring your sense of humor
neighbors, friends or come solo💚

_______
Come with your family, friends, neighbors and furry companions, please share this event.
_________
I encourage everyone to walk, cycle or bus to the event as part of the experience and help not to impact the environment. I will have some special gifts for the ones who do 🌻💚
________
Please allow enough time to immerse into the workshop with no rush"
_______
REGISTRATION IS Essential the event is number of registered people dependent.
50$ per person per workshop, 80$ for 2 ppl within a family, children are free, animals welcome. Volunteers of non profit organization's and community gardeners are welcome to come on a koha or vegetables from their garden bases if you prefer, make sure to indicate upon registration, numbers are limited. Please register here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1JDsUTlOZYvF870A1bJ7JNxR5-eGL3tlCX3PZtMRRjV0/viewform

🔗 Learn more about my work: foraging and growing corner
https://www.facebook.com/foragingandgrowingcorner/

Registration is essential, helps to keep our events clear, organized and respectful.

Warning: bring your cuppas and a spare one in case someone forgets <3 and a healthy food platter to share with others. i will have some interesting edibles to share <3

at 3pm - 5:30 pm grow your own Fungi workshop
Looking forward to seeing you there!
https://www.facebook.com/share/1H9a69MFTp/

events.id: Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters Airshow 2027-79 Aerodrome Road, Burleigh, Blenheim 7272, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters Airshow 2027
events.venue: 79 Aerodrome Road, Burleigh, Blenheim 7272, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marlborough Lines Classic Fighters – ‘Putting on the Ritz’
We’re bringing the glamour back bigger and better for 2027!
Step into the golden age of aviation as the skies sparkle with the elegance of the 1920s and 1930s. Marvel at breathtaking aerobatics, feel the thrill as legendary WW2 warbirds take command overhead, and soak up the glamour of a bygone era.
Beyond the flying action, enjoy a weekend packed with classic cars, fireworks, fantastic food, live entertainment, and family fun. It’s a celebration you won’t want to miss!
🎟️ Tickets now available online – choose a single-day ticket for any day you prefer, or take advantage of our new multi-day passes. A Friday ticket includes the full day’s program plus the spectacular Twilight Extreme.
Join us in Marlborough for a show that promises to be unforgettable – we can’t wait to see you there!
